La socia LUZGARDA pertenece al banco comunal “HATUN SONCCO”. El nombre del banco comunal es de origen del idioma Quechua, “HATUN” significa “Grande” y “SONCCO” significa “Corazón” que traducido al español significa “Corazón grande”. 

La socia tiene 24 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene dos hijas mujeres, ellas viven en la ciudad Imperial del Cusco. La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el pequeño negocio de venta de comidas, nuestra socia prepara de comida desayuno, almuerzo y cena y su restaurante se encuentra ubicado en la  Plaza de Armas del Cusco. Ya son varios años con esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo, nuestra socia es una mujer joven, luchadora y emprendedora pues con mucha voluntad se dedica al negocio y quiere aumentar su capital de negocio comprando víveres y verduras para preparar más platos de comida.  
 
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
LUZGARDA, 24, is a member of the "HATUN SONCCO" communal bank. The name of the bank is from the Quechua language. "HATUN means "Big, and "SONCCO" means "Heart" so, translated into Spanish, it means "Big Heart." She lives with her life partner in the imperial city of Cusco and they have two daughters. She alternates her domestic chores with a small, prepared meals sales business. She prepares breakfast, lunch, and dinner in an eatery located in Cusco's Plaza de Armas (Main Square). She has had this line of work for several years now and she does very well thanks to all the effort she puts into it. She is a young, hard-working, enterprising woman who, with much dedication, sees to her business. She wants to increase her working capital buying more groceries and vegetables to increase the number of her meal preparations. She is grateful for the opportunity granted by this means and pledges to repay in a timely manner.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her meal preparations.

loans.name: Omar Antonia

texts.en:
Omar, 28, has been working in this motorcycle repair shop since he was a child. The shop, called “Taller Miguel,” was started by his brother-in-law Miguel about 20 years ago, and now the two are partners.  Omar is requesting a loan to help buy motorcycle parts. He plans to buy all types of parts, including cables and batteries, but it depends on what his clients need. There are only three people who sell motorcycle parts in the area, and since Omar has a good supplier he can offer the parts at a very competitive price.

Omar is excited about the loan. It is his first with CEPRODEL. He hopes it will help him improve his shop and grow the business little by little. Omar lives with his partner and 5 year-old-daughter. He hopes to have more children some day.

loans.use: To buy motorcycle parts

loans.name: Nubia Del Carmen

texts.en:
Nubia del Carmen has been selling used clothing for 12 years. She is requesting a loan to buy more used clothing and sandals to sell to her clients. This will be her second loan from CEPRODEL.

The clothing comes in large bales from the United States and the sandals are from Nicaragua. Five days a week, Nubia travels to many nearby towns to sell her goods. She used to sell the clothing in the local market in Masaya, but says she prefers travelling because she sells more. She sells the most on weekends. 

Nubia says that she likes working with CEPRODEL because they are very nice and they don’t delay when she needs a loan. She has always been a good client, because she wants to be able to get more loans. Nubia is single and has 5 adult children. Only one of her children lives with her. 

“I am a fighter,” she said, when asked about her business. “I don’t have anyone to depend on except myself and God.”

loans.use: To buy more used clothing

loans.name: Kelly

texts.en:
Kelly truly has the mindset of an entrepreneur. When her daughter was born, she was inspired to use her talent for sewing to make unique clothes and accessories for her rather than buy them. Soon after, her children's clothing business took off, and she was selling and sharing her handmade items with others. Kelly draws her inspiration from her daughter, who models most of her designs, and she is also helped by her supportive husband, who from time to time helps her with various sewing tasks.

Kelly always feels successful when she receives emails from her customers thanking her for her work, and telling her how much their children love the outfits. She is always striving to offer new designs and meeting the ever-changing needs of her customers. She will use her loan from ACCION USA to purchase additional machines for making her items, fabric and t-shirt inventory, embroidery designs, and marketing. This is Kelly's first time obtaining a loan for her business - in the past, she had always used funds from previous sales to buy supplies, but was always just breaking even.

In the future, Kelly hopes her company will be able to produce all of her customer's needs, like accessories, bags, and even shoes, becoming a "one-stop shop." She would also like to eventually hire an employee to assist her in production.

loans.use: Sewing machines, fabric, t-shirts, embroidery, and marketing

loans.name: Alimatou

texts.fr: S. Alimatou est née en 1969 à Dassa dans les collines au Bénin. Mariée à GOUNDOMEDE Barthélémy, Alimatou est mère de quatre enfants, dont trois sont à sa charge.  Tous les enfants sont scolarisés et vivent avec leurs parents au quartier Tokpota à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Alimatou vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Alimatou a fait seulement le cours primaire. Depuis une vingtaine d’année, Alimatou vend des produits vivriers (riz, maïs, haricot, farine de manioc, etc.) et des divers (savons, sucre, piles, conserves, omo, etc.) dans sa boutique sise au carrefour Ave Maria à Porto-Novo. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a bien remboursé les deux crédits qu’elle avait obtenu de ALIDé. C’est en vue de renforcer son capital et d’accroître son activité en cette période de fêtes de fin d’année, que Alimatou sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
S. Alimatou was born in 1969 in Dassa in the hills of Benin.  Married to GOUNDOMEDE Barthélémy, she is the mother of four children, of whom three are in her care.  All of the children are in school and live with their parents in the Tokpota district in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin.  Alimatou works in aid of her husband to support the family. Alimatou attended primary school only.  For twenty years, she has sold staple foods (rice, corn, cassava flour, etc.) and a variety of goods (soaps, sugar, batteries, canned foods, Omo, etc.) in her shop found at the Ave Maria crossroad in Porto-Novo. She is a previous ALIDé client who has repaid the two loans she obtained from ALIDé.  With the aim of bolstering her capital and growing her business during this year-end holiday period, she's requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grains (sacks of corn and rice), and various goods (boxes of soap, canned foods, sugar)

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
Arturo G. J., tiene la edad de 21 años, es soltero, no tiene hijos.El quiere el préstamo para la compra de una novilla para cría, esto debido a que el precio del ganado está bajo, entonces comprandola ya puede obtener mejores ganancias cuando el precio del mismo tienda a la alza.El tiene pensado  en el futuro poder vender las crías de esta vaca y así obtener ganancias. Don Arturo nunca a realizado ningún crédito, es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR, y está muy contento porque el tramite no ha sido complicado y la tasa de interes es accesible para él.
El desea tener con este proyecto una mejor calidad de vida.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Arturo G. J., 21, is single and has no children. He wants financing to buy a young heifer to raise now that cattle prices are low so that he can earn higher profits when he sells her when cattle prices rise. He also hopes to sell this heifer's young thereby earning additional profits. This is Arturo's first venture into credit and first loan with FUDECOSUR and he is happy that the paperwork wasn't very complicated and the interest rates are easily attainable for him. He hopes this project will afford him a better quality of life. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a young heifer.

loans.name: Amarilis

texts.es:
Amarilis A. B., tiene la edad de 36 años, es casada, y tiene 5 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Los hijos tienen 17, 15, 14, 11 y 1 años respectivamente. Ella quiere comprar almacigo de cafe para cultivar en el año que viene. Tiene varios años que se dedica a su finca y quiere crecer. Este prestamo puede ultizar para tener mas producción, gracias a que van a tener mas cantidad. Es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR.  FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja. Ella no tenía problemas en su propiedad, pero si tiene el deseo de sea una finca productiva. Gracias al credito, ella puede mejorar la calidad de vida de todos los miembros de la familia. 

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Amarilis A. B., 36, is married and the mother of 5 children who are her greatest priority in life. Her children are 17, 15, 14, 11, and one-year old respectively. She wants to buy coffee seedlings to plant next year. She has tended to her farming for several years and whe wants to expand. This financing will be used to increase production since she will have more plants. This is the first loan she has gotten from FUDECOSUR. FUDECOSUR offered the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate. She had no problems with her property but she does want her farm to be productive. Thanks to the loan, she can improve the quality of life of all her family members. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy coffee seedlings.

loans.name: Rubi

texts.es:
La señora Rubí, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Doradinas en Acción”, Distrito de San José de Sisa, Provincia del Dorado, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 36 años y es madre de 04 hijos, 03 que aun depende de ella.

Ante la necesidad de aportar al ingreso económico del hogar, motivada por ella misma, emprendió un pequeño  negocio de venta de abarrotes con su primer crédito de S/. 300.00 obteniendo muy buenos resultados desde un inicio por la calidad de sus productos, sus precios cómodos y la buena atención al cliente.
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio ubicada en su propia casa, donde sus principales clientes son los vecinos de su barrio.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará  más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en kilos, huevos en javas,  insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, gaseosas en paquetes, golosinas  y otros productos para mantener contenta a su clientela.

Hoy se siente muy feliz de la labor y servicio que brinda y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por apoyar a personas como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante, espera que sigan así por mucho tiempo y ayuden a muchas familias y mujeres emprendedoras.
texts.en:
Sra. Rubi is a member of the Communal Bank “Doradinas en Acción”, which is in the District of San José de Sisa, Dorado Province, Department of San Martín. She is 36 years old, married, and the mother of four children of whom three are still dependent.

Rubi was motivated to start a small business selling groceries so that she could contribute to the household income. She obtained very good results from her first loan of 300 soles. From that point, she improved the quality of her products, offered affordable prices, and provided good customer service. Rubi continues to operate her business out of her home to this very day. Her main customers are neighbors from the area.

With this loan of 1000 soles, she will buy more products to restock her business such as rice and sugar by the kilo, crates of eggs, personal hygiene products, household cleaning supplies, packs of sodas, candy, and other items to keep her customers happy. Rubi is very satisfied with her work and the service she provides. She thanks Manuela Ramos for supporting people like her who want to work to get ahead. Rubi hopes to continue working for a long time and helping other families and women entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Melvin Rafael

texts.es:
Melvin Rafael A. B., tiene la edad de 23 años, su estado civil es unión libre,tiene 2 hijos.El quiere el préstamo para la dar asistencia a su finca en la cual tiene sembrado café, y necesita abonar el mismo, esto le ayudará a mejorar su producción cuando llegue el momento de la cosecha. Don Melvin tiene sembrado una hectárea y media de café y siempre se ha dedicado a este negocio del café.
Es la primera vez que don Melvin realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR, y está muy contento porque no fueron trámites tediosos y la tasa de interes es accesible para él.
El desea tener éxito con este proyecto, para así ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y un futuro provechoso para todos.Cabe mencionar que don Melvin tiene un niño de 4 años que tiene problemas físcos, y es por ello que el desea ofrecerle las condiciones adecuadas para que su hijo pueda desenvolverse de la manera más idóneade, lo mismo que el resto de su familia.


About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Melvin Rafael A. B., 23, is in a common-law relationship and has two children. He needs financing to cover general farming expenses for his farm where he grows coffee. He needs to fertilize the soil so that production at harvest time will be better. He has one-and-a-half hectares planted with coffee and he has always been a coffee grower. This is the first time that Melvin has negotiated a loan with FUDECOSUR and he's very happy because the paperwork wasn't tedious and the interest rate is accessible to him. He wants to be successful with this project in order to offer his family a better quality of life and a profitable future for all of them. It is important to note that Melvin has a 4-year-old son that has physical handicaps so he wants to be able to offer him, as well as to the rest of the family, adequate conditions within which to develop to the utmost degree possible. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For general farming expenses.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
Erika O. M., tiene la edad de 21 años, es soltera, y no tiene hijos. Ella todavia vive con su familia, ayudando con la finca. Ella quiere comprar abono y fertilizantes para mejorar la finca. Con el crédito, el año que viene el cosecha sería mejor. Su familia siempre ha tenido cafe pero tambien trabajan en ganadería. Su familia no tenía problemas en su propiedad, pero si tiene el deseo de sea una finca productiva. Es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja. Ella también tiene el deseo para tratar de tener un buen futuro para la familia. 

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Erika O. M. is 21 years of age, single and has no children. She still lives with her family, helping them with the farm. She wants to buy nutrients and fertilizers to improve the farm. With the loan, the coming year's harvest would be better. Her family has always had coffee but they are also raising livestock. Her family has not had problems with their property but they want it to be a productive farm. This is the first loan that she has received from FUDECOSUR. The FUDECOSUR loan was more easily obtained and the interest rate is much lower. Erika also wants to try to have a good future for her family. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy nutrients and fertilizers.

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
La señora Hermelinda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Corazón D. Jesús”, Distrito D. San José D. Sisa, Provincia del Dorado, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 36 años y es madre D. 03 hijos, los 03 que aun dependen D. ella y están estudiando.

Su impulso y empeño D. ver a sus hijos profesionales, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio D. venta D. abarrotes, se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa, un local muy bien acondicionado para atender a sus clientes. 

Las ganancias que genera ayuda al ingreso económico D. su familia. En la actualidad, es muy querida por sus clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su bodega a comprar, porque ella cuenta con todo los productos  que el ama D. casa necesita y es ella, quien les brinda su atención con el carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas D. pescado en cajas y en variedad D. marcas, huevos en javas y artículos D. higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Hermelinda, se siente con mucha fuerza para continuar trabajando, día a día agradece a la vida, por brindarle una gran oportunidad D. salir adelante como mujer, igualmente al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por   iniciarla a convertirse en una mujer empresaria.
texts.en:
Ms. Hermelinda belongs to the Corazón D. Jesús [heart of Jesus] Communal Bank, located in the District of San Jose D. Sisa, Province of El Dorado, Department of San Martin. She is thirty-six years old, married, and a mother of three children, all of whom are dependents and studying.

Her drive and desire to see her children become professionals motivated her to start her own business selling groceries. Her business is located in her house, which is very well equipped for attending to her customers.

Her earnings contribute towards her family’s income. Nowadays, she is greatly loved by her regular customers, who frequent her shop daily because they can count on her to have all of the products that a housewife needs and for her captivating character and charisma.

With this loan of S/.1,000.00, she will be able to purchase sacks of rice and sugar , packets of noodles, milk, and a variety of different brands of boxes of fish preserves, "javas" of eggs, and personal hygiene products in order to continue to proviD. the best service to her customers.

Hermelinda is enthusiastic about continuing her work. Every day she is thankful for her life for giving her the amazing opportunity to move forward as a woman, and likewise for the Manuela Ramos Movement (“Movimiento Manuela Ramos”) that pushed her to become a business woman.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grocery items to increase merchandise.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es:
Alexander A. R., tiene la edad de 39 años, es casado, y tiene 2 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Los hijos tiene 8 y 2 años respectivamente. El quiere alquilar pasto en otro lugar y asi se ahora ese dinero. Además, él trabaja como peon algunas veces y el resto del tiemp la ganadería. Tiene varios años que se dedica a su finca y quiere crecer. Es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no tenía problemas en su propiedad, pero si tiene el deseo de sea una finca productiva. FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja. El también tiene el deseo de tratar de obtener un mejor futuro para todo su familia. 
About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Alexander A. R., 39, is married and has two children, who are his first priority in life. The children are 8 and 2-years-old respectively. He wants to lease pasture land somewhere so that he can save money. He works as a laborer sometimes and the rest of the time he raises cattle. He has worked his farm for many years and would like to expand. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR. He had no problems with his property but does want to see his farm be productive. FUDECOSUR offered the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate. He hopes to provide a better future for his entire family. The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To lease additional pasture land.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es: María del Carmen L. de 42 años de edad reside en Apasteque, departamento de San Vicente, vive junto a sus dos hijos. María es una mujer muy trabajadora la cual se esfuerza día con día por llevar el sustento a su hogar, ya que ha sido ella la que siempre ha trabajado por sus dos hijos. Ella posee una venta de ropa para niños y adultos, negocio el cual esta ubicado en las cercanías del mercado Municipal de Sensuntepeque. María solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más ropa y de esta manera poder surtir su negocio y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
María del Carmen L., 42, lives with her two children in Apasteque, San Vicente department. María is a very hard-working woman who daily makes the effort to provide sustenance for her home since it has always been her responsibility to support her children. She sells children and adult clothing near the Sensuntepeque Municipal market. She requests funding to buy more clothing to stock her store in order to increase her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Noemy

texts.es:
Noemy M. B., tiene la edad de 34 años, es casada, tiene 2 hijos.Ella quiere el préstamo para invertir en la tienda de costura y el bazar que tiene, sobre todo para comprar material (telas) para sus trabajos de costura, esto le ayudaría a percibir ingresos no solo por las costuras que realiza sino también podría obtener ingresos vendiendo a sus clientes las telas.Ella se dedica  a la costura desde hace más de 15 años, pero el negocio propiamente lo formó hace aproximadamente 3 años,las costuras las realiza por encargo y se siente muy feliz por su proyecto.
Es la primera vez que doña Noemy realiza un préstamo con FUDECOSUR, y manifiesta estar muy contenta pues las condiciones del préstamos son muy buenas y accesibles para ella.
Las metas y aspiraciones  que ella tiene para el futuro es el de progresar para poder ayudar con el estudio de sus hijos y el tener una mayor estbilidad económica.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Noemy M. B., 34, is married and the mother of 2 children. She wants financing to invest, mostly in fabrics for her creations, in a dressmaking supplies store and bazar she has. This will help her earn income not only by the sales of her creations but also by selling fabric directly to her customers. She has been a seamstress for the last 15 years but has only had the business itself for the last 3 years. She sews items based on prior orders and is happy with her project. This is the first time that Noemy negotiates a loan with FUDECOSUR and she states that she is very happy because the loan terms are very good and accessible to her. Her goals and hopes for the future is to pogress so that she can help with the schooling of her children and have better economic stability. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in dressmaking supplies and a bazaar.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: Reina Isabel V. Ramírez de 33 años de edad, reside en Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad, vive junto a su esposo y sus cinco hijos todos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Reina posee una tienda y panadería en su casa, en la cual su esposo le ayuda, debido a que este es la única entrada económica con la que cuentan, ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar productos como refrescos y golosinas para la tienda y así mismo comprar materia prima para la panadería. Reina y su esposo cuentan con una familia muy extensa, la cual les impulsa a seguir adelante cada día y a esforzarse más por brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Reina Isabel V. Ramírez, 33, lives in Arce city in the La Libertad department. She lives with her husband and their five minor children who attend school. Reina has a store and a bakery in her house. Her husband helps her because this is the only economic income they have. She is asking for a loan to buy products like soft drinks and sweets for her store. She will also buy raw materials for her bakery. Reina and her husband have a very extensive family. This drives them to get ahead everyday and to put forth more effort to give their children the best.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material to make bread

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis R. A. V., tiene la edad de 35 años, es casado, y tiene 4 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. El quiere comprar mas inventario para ofrecer mas cosas a los clientes y obtener mas ganancia. Además, él tiene un negiocio de abarrotes, bazar y pulpería. Tiene varios años que se dedica a su negicio y quiere crecer. El no tenía problemas en su propiedad, pero si tiene el deseo de sea una negocio productiva. Es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja. El también tiene el deseo para darles un mejor porvenir a sus hijos. 
About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Luis R. A. V. is 35, married, and has four children who are his greatest priority. He wants to buy more inventory to offer more things to his customers and get more earnings. His business is a grocery store, a bazaar, and a mini market. He has had the business for several years, and he wants it to grow. He did not have problems with his ownership, but he does have the desire for the business to be productive. This is the first loan that he has received from Fudecosur. Fudecosur gave him the loan with greater ease and the interest rate is much lower. He also has the wish to give his children a better future. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more inventory

loans.name: Santos Aída

texts.es: Santos Aída R. B. de 53 años de edad, reside en Armenia, vive junto a sus tres hijos, los cuales trabajan. Ella posee una pupusería cerca de la Unidad de Salud de Armenia, lo cual le beneficia ya que las personas que pasan consulta vienen a comer a su puesto. La señora Santos solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar verduras, carne, bebidas, ya que dentro de sus metas esta ampliar su negocio y hacer un comedor. Santos se destaca por ser una señora muy visionara la cual desea seguir mejorando cada día más para su propio sustento.
texts.en:
Santos Aída R. B., 53, lives in Armenia with her three children. The children work. She has a “pupusa” (corn tortillas stuffed with cheese, beans, and pork, then grilled) stand near the Health Unit of Armenia. The location is beneficial because the people who have appointments come to eat at her stand. Santos is asking for a loan to be able to buy vegetables, meat, and drinks. One of her goals is to expand her business and have a restaurant. Santos stands out as being a very visionary woman who wants to keep improving more every day for her own sustenance.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic grains and other perishables

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es:
Wilson G. R., tiene la edad de 20 años, es soltero y vive con sus padres y 4 hermanso. El quiere comprar de abono y asistencia de cafe para tener una mejor cosecha. Tiene 4 años que se dedica a su finca y su familia quiere crecer. La familia no tenía problemas en su propiedad, pero si tiene el deseo de sea una finca productiva. Es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja. Él también tiene el deseo de mejorar la calidad y así generar mas ingresos, para una mejor calidad de vida de su familia. 
About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Wilson G. R. is 20, single, and he lives with his parents and his four siblings. He wants to buy fertilizer and cover coffee expenses to have a better harvest. He has been devoted to his farm for four years, and his family wants it to grow. The family has not had problems with the property, but they do have the desire for it to be a productive farm. This is the first loan he has received from Fudecosur. Fudecosur offered the simplest loan, and the interest rate is much lower. He also has the desire to improve the quality and generate more income in order to improve his family’s quality of life. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer, coffee expenses

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La socia ISABEL pertenece al banco comunal “HATUN SONCCO”. El nombre del banco comunal es de origen del idioma Quechua, “HATUN” significa “Grande” y “SONCCO” significa “Corazón” que traducido al español significa “Corazón grande”. 

La socia tiene 34 años de edad, es madre soltera y es padre y madre para sus dos hijas. La mayor tiene doce años y la menor tiene siete años, las dos estudian en el mismo colegio. Ellas viven en la ciudad Imperial del Cusco. La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la enseñanza particular de cursos. Nuestra socia dicta clases particulares de reforzamientos de las materias de razonamiento matemático, razonamiento verbal, idiomas, físicas, etc. Ella dicta clases por las tardes a estudiantes que están bajos en sus notas del colegio. Ya son varios años con esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo, nuestra socia es una madre luchadora y emprendedora pues con mucha voluntad se dedica a la enseñanza. La socia requiere el préstamo para la educación, para la alimentación y mensualidad del colegio de sus hijas.       
 
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Isabel belongs to the Atún Soncco Communal Bank. The name of the communal bank is from the Quechua language. “Hatun” means big, and “Soncco” means heart. Translated into Spanish (and then into English) it means Big Heart. She is a 34 year old single mother. She is father and mother to her two daughters. The oldest is 12, and the youngest is 7. They both go to the same school. They live in the Imperial city of Cusco. She alternates her activities between the household and private courses that she teaches. She teaches private classes that reinforce mathematical reasoning, verbal reasoning, languages, and physics, etc. She teaches classes in the afternoons for students who are getting low grades in school. She has been doing this for several years. It has gone very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work. She is a fighter, and she is enterprising. She devotes herself to teaching with much joy. She needs the loan for the education, food, and the monthly school charges for her daughters. She is very grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Food and monthly school fees for her two daughters

loans.name: Ana Lorena

texts.es:
Ana Lorena V. C., tiene la edad de 37 años, es casada, tiene 2 hijos.Ella quiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra de una máquina y telas para la costura, esto le ayudaría a percibir ingresos no solo por las costuras que realiza sino también podría obtener ingresos vendiendo a sus clientes las telas.Ella se dedica a la costura desde hace varios años, manifiesta que tiene experiencia y que la ha complementado con cursos que ha aprobado con satisfacción.
Es la segunda vez que doña Ana Lorena realiza un préstamo con FUDECOSUR, y manifiesta estar muy contenta pues las condiciones del préstamos son muy buenas y accesibles para ella.Ella se había financiado hace algún tiempo con Coopealianza, pero e solicitaron muchos requisitos y el trámite era un poco más lento.
Las metas y aspiraciones que ella tiene para el futuro es el de progresar para poder ayudar con el estudio de sus hijos y el tener una mayor estabilidad económica.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Ana Lorena V. C. is 37 years old. She is married with two children. She will use the loan to purchase a sewing machine and fabrics. This will help her increase her income through selling sewn products and fabric. She has worked as a seamstress for several years. She has experience and has passed courses in sewing too. This is the second time that Ana Lorena has applied for a loan with FUDECOSUR and is very happy with the loan conditions; they are very good and accessible for her. She had received a loan a while ago with Coopealianza, but they asked her to fit many requirements and the process was a little slow. The goals that she has for the future are to be able to help with her children's studies and to have more economic stability. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a sewing machine and fabric

loans.name: Zivamuntuuyo, Jinja Group

texts.en: N. Rose is the leader of her lending group in Jinja. She is 38 years old and married with four children between the ages of 10 and 18. The first-born recently joined the University. She is a hard working lady with a tailoring and textile business that she has been running for 15 years. She is able to make 40,000/= profit every week. Her major challenge is that the vendors take most of their customers since they move from place to place yet Rose’s business is just stationed in one place. She ensures that she makes very good designs to her customers’ satisfaction so she can keep the customers coming to her business. She hopes to expand her textile business and continue to educate her children. She needs a loan to be able to buy more clothing for tailoring.

loans.use: To buy fabric for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Cécile

texts.fr: G. Cécile est née en 1965 à Adjohoun dans le département de l'Ouémé au Bénin. Mariée à DOSSA Michel, un chauffeur, Cécile est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Cécile a un autre enfant à charge. C'est depuis 12 ans que Cécile vit à Dowa à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Cécile vit dans ce quartier avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Cécile n'a jamais été à l'école. Il y a 20 ans de cela que Cécile vend de l'huile de palme à son domicile et au marché Ouando à Porto-Novo. C'est à Adjohoun que Cécile s'approvisionne. Cécile est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé ayant déjà obtenu deux crédits et qui ont été bien remboursés. Afin d'agrandir davantage son activité et d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaire, Cécile sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
G. Cécile was born in 1965 in Ouémé county in Benin.  Married to DOSSA Michel, a chauffeur, she is the mother of four children who are all in school.  She has another child to support.  For twelve years, Cécile has been living in Dowa in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin.  She lives in this district with her children and husband.  The couple provides for the family jointly.  Cécile has never been to school.  For twenty years, she has sold palm oil out of her home and at the Ouando market in Porto-Novo.  She gets her supplies in Adjohoun.  She is a previous ALIDé client, having obtained two loans, which were repaid.  To expand her business further and to increase her sales, she's requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Containers of palm oil to sell

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.es:
Mauricio C. M. tiene la edad de 26 años, es soltero, no tiene  hijos y vive con su familia. El quiere comprar terneras para la produción de leche y crías así generar mas ingresos. Tiene 6 años que se dedica a ganadería y quiere crecer. Su familia no tenía problemas en su propiedad, pero si tiene el deseo de sea una finca productiva. Es el segundo préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades. Él también tiene el deseo de invertirlo lo mejor posible y así hacer que crezca el negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. 

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Mauricio C. M. is 26 years old. He is single with no children, and he lives with his family. He wants to buy cows for milk production and to birth calves to increase his income. He has worked as a dairy farmer for six years and wants to grow his operation. His family does not have any problems on their property, but he wants it to be a more productive farm. This is the second loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. FUDECOSUR offered him a loan with better terms. He hopes to make the best investment possible and thus grow the business and improve his family's quality of life. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cows

loans.name: Audilio

texts.es:
Audilio R. C., tiene la edad de 53 años, es casado, tiene 6 hijos.El quiere el préstamo para invertirlo en el mantenimiento del café y de un almácigo que tiene, para así poder tener una mayor producción en la próxima cosecha.Don Audilio se dedica a la producción del café desde hace muchos años, tiene el café sembrado en dos hectáreas y medias.El desea poder tener el próximo año una buena cosecha por lo que desea darle el mantenimento necesario para conseguirla.
No es la primera vez que don Audilio se financia con FUDECOSUR, y manifiesta estar muy contenta pues las condiciones del préstamos son muy buenas y accesibles para el, además, el siente que esta modalidad de crédito le genera un ahorro.
Las metas y aspiraciones que el tiene para el futuro es el de progresar para poder ayudar con el estudio de sus hijos y tener una mayor estabilidad económica.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Audilio R. C. is 53 years old. He is married with six children. He applied for the loan to invest in maintaining his coffee farm and a tree used for transplanting new trees. He hopes to increase production for the next harvest. Don Audilio has worked as a coffee producer for many years; he has two and a half hectacres planted with coffee. He hopes to have a good harvest next year which is why he needs to keep his farm well maintained. It is not the first time that Don Audilio has received a loan from FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the terms of the loans, which are accessible for him. He feels that this form of credit has allowed him to save. His goals and aspirations for the future is to be able to help with his children's education and to be more stable economically. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintaining coffee farm

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
Gerardo Pérez C., tiene la edad de 47 años, es casado, tiene 4 hijos.El quiere el préstamo para la compra de cerdos, ganado y la agricultura. La idea es invertir el dinero además en comprar unos cerdos y unas novillas, desea hacer más corralitos para aumentar la cantidad de cerdos para el engorde, y para ello necesita la comprar los materiales necesarios para la contrucción. Don Gerardo tiene 9 hectáreas de pasto para la agricultura y desea aumentar su productividad. 
Para don Gerardo es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR, y está muy contento porque el tramite no ha sido complicado y la tasa de interes es accesible para él.
El desea tener con este proyecto una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Gerardo Pérez C., 47, is married and has 4 children. He wants financing to buy pigs, cattle and for farming. The idea is to invest the money in a variety of ways: to buy a few pigs and heifers, to buy building materials to build additional pens to raise the pigs and, in addition, to increase production of pasture on his 9 hectares of pasture land. This is Gerardo's first loan with FUDECOSUR and he's very happy because the paperwork wasn't complicated and the interest rate is accessible for him. He hopes this project will provide a better quality of life and better economic stability. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs, cattle and for farming.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en:
When Ramon was laid off from his job in 2005, he decided to become a taxi driver in order to earn enough income to support his family. He has successfully made a steady income since then, but he says one of the main challenges of being a taxi driver is keeping his vehicle in good shape. Since he drives it all day, it is constantly breaking down. Now, he is going to use his loan from ACCION USA to pay for repairs to his car. He is a return client, but has also used credit cards to pay for repairs in the past. With credit cards, he tries to pay his full balance at the end of the month because of the high interest charges.

Ramon does not want to be a taxi driver forever - he has big dreams to open his own business one day, in an entirely different industry - a restaurant! He hopes that when he decides to do this and has saved enough money, he will be able to get help from ACCION USA to start up the business.

More about ACCION USA and the underbanked in the United States

Have you ever thought about how the cute new café on your corner or the salon you frequent on a monthly basis got the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated 10 million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis.” Microfinance institutions like ACCION USA, support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education. Small businesses also help stabilize low-income neighborhoods and rebuild the U.S. economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides low to moderate income workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and provide employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

loans.use: Repairs to his taxi

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier E. V., tiene la edad de 23 años, vive en union libre, y tiene un hijo que es su mayor prioridad. El hijo tiene 3 años. El quiere comprar fertilizantes y otros qumicos para los cultivos.  Este credito va a aumentar la calidad de los productos y así tener mas ingresos.  Además, su finca es de 2hectáreas, y tiene maiz y frijoles. Tiene varios años que se dedica a su finca y quiere crecer. El no tenía problemas en su propiedad, pero si tiene el deseo de sea una finca productiva. Es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. No ha tenido creditos en otras entidades financieras ya que no cumple con los requisitos. FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades. Finalmente, él tiene el deseo de tener mayores cosechas para tener mas ingresos y así poder mandar a estudiar a los hijos y poder tener una vivienda mejor. 

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Javier E. V., 23, lives with his common-law wife and his 3-year-old son, who is his highest priority in life. He wants to buy fertilizers and other chemicals for his crops. This financing will increase the quality of his products thereby producing higher earnings. He grows corn and beans on his 2-hectare farm. He has farmed for several years and wants to expand. He had no problems with his property but does want to see his farm be productive. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR. He hasn't had any loans with other financial entities because he didn't meet requirement to qualify. FUDECOSUR granted the loan with better terms. Finally, he wishes to have larger crop yields so that his earnings will increase in order to be able to send his children to school and have a better dwelling. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesus S. U., tiene la edad de 41 años, es casado y tiene 3 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Los hijos tiene 16, 12 y 2 años respectivamente. El  quiere comprar fertilizantes y otros materiales para la producion para mejorar su finca. Además, su finca es de 3.5 hectárea. Dos hectarías son de cafe y el otro es de maís y frijoles. Tiene varios años que se dedica a su finca y quiere crecer. Es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR.  También, el ha realizados otros préstamos en bancos estatales pero hace varios años que no lo hace. El no tenía problemas en su propiedad, pero si tiene el deseo de sea una finca productiva. El también tiene el deseo de tener mas ingresos economicos para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y poder mandar sus hijos a estudiar. 

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Jesus S. U., 41, is married and has three children, who are his main priority in life. His children are 16, 12, and 2-years-old, respectively. He wants to buy fertilizer and other supplies to improve his farm's production. His farm is 3.5 hectares of which two are planted with coffee and the rest with corn and beans. He has farmed for several years and wants to see his farm grow. This is his first loan received from FUDECOSUR. He has negotiated loans in the past with state banks but hasn't done so in several years. He had no problems with his property but does wish to see his farm be productive. He also hopes for increased earnings in order to improve his family's economic condition and to be able to send his children to school. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other supplies for his crops.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama C. est une femme de 64 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 5 ans et demi et a capitalisé une bonne expérience en matière de crédit. Elle fait un petit commerce de légumes et ses bénéfices lui permettent de prendre en charge sa famille.
texts.en:
Mariama C., aged 64, is married and the mother of seven children. She has been a member of a village bank for five and a half years and gained a good experience with the credit process. She runs a small vegetable store and the profit enables her to provide for her family.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To boost her business

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr: Adama MANE est âgée de 42 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SINTHIANG COUNDARA depuis 3 ans, elle fait de la transformation et vente de pâte d'arachide. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Adama Mané, aged 42, is married and the mother of six children. She has been a member of the village bank Sinthiang Coundara for three years. She produces and sells peanut butter. She participates in the improvement of the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To boost her business

loans.name: Robert Edwin

texts.es:
El Sr. Robert Edwin P. Pérez, tiene 20 años de edad vive en la Asociación de Vivienda Keiko Sofía Fujimori D-11.
Actualmente cuenta con un módulo de material noble y lo demás se encuentra por construir. Vive con su padre el Sr. Robert P. Matta de 41 años de edad quien esta separado de su esposa y con sus hermanos. Apoya con los gastos familiares.
Es soltero, trabaja como serenazgo ( vigilancia municipal) 8 horas diarias en horarios rotativos, en su horario de descanso trabaja en la mototaxi de su padre un promedio de 4 horas, él es una persona con buenas referencias de parte de los vecinos.
En su trabajo es bien dedicado y ahí también su jefe inmediato da buenas referencias de su persona.
Solicita un financiamiento para poder sacar su brevete que le ayudará a trabajar mejor en el transporte además de no seguir trabajando como serenazgo este documento le ayudará para desempeñarse como chofer en cualquier unidad de transporte. Invertirá el dinero en arreglos de la mototaxi.
Tiene muchas ganas de superación, es emprendedor y sobretodo bien responsable.
texts.en:
Sr. Robert Edwin P. Pérez is 20 years old, single, and lives at the Keiko Sofía Fujimori Housing Association, D-11. His residential unit is well-built and made of solid materials. He lives with his father Sr. Robert P. Matta, who is 41 years old and separated from his wife. Robert Edwin has siblings, but they do not live with him. He helps contribute to the family expenses.

Robert Edwin works for the city as a security patrolman on an eight-hour rotating schedule. When he is not at this job, he drives his father’s motorcycle taxi for approximately a four-hour shift. His neighbors have provided him with excellent references. Robert Edwin is dedicated to his work and his supervisor has also provided a good recommendation.

He is requesting a loan so that he can pay to upgrade his driver’s license, which will enable him to operate any type of vehicle. As a result, he will be able to find better work in the transportation sector and quit his job as a patrolman. Part of the money will also be used for motorcycle taxi repairs. Robert Edwin has demonstrated that he is enterprising, responsible, and eager to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Upgrade his driver's license & pay for motorcycle repairs

loans.name: Ilmer

texts.es: Ilmer V.  es una mujer perseverante  y trabajadora, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa región D. Ucayali, tiene 48 años, es madre D. cuatro hijos D. los cuales dos son mayores D. edad, Ilmer se dedica a la venta D. prendas D. vestir, ella tiene este negocio en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo que se dedica al sector educación. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Divinas” desD. hace tres años,  el primer préstamo que recibió fue D. 300 soles que le permitió invertir en golosinas. Actualmente necesita un préstamo D. 2500 soles que será utilizado en la compra D. ropas para damas y caballeros para luego venderlas a sus vecinos y conocidos. La meta D. Ilmer es  construir su casa.
texts.en:
Ilmer V. is a persevering and hard working woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She is 48 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are adults.

Ilmer sells clothing at her home with the support of her husband who is a teacher. She has been a member of the Community Bank "Las Divinas" for the last three years; the first loan she received was for 300 soles which were invested in candy.

She is asking for a loan of $875 that will be invested in the purchase of clothing for men and women that she will sell to her neighbors and friends. Mrs. Ilmer's goal is to build a house.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou C. est une femme de 35 ans, elle est mariée et sans enfants mais elle a la charge de ses deux neveux et deux nièces. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 6 ans et demi ce qui lui a doté d'une bonne expérience en crédit. Elle fait de la transformation et vente de pâte d'arachide. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de prendre en charge ses neveux et nièces.
texts.en:
Fatou C., aged 35, is married without children, but she takes care of her two nephews and two nieces. She has been a member of a village bank for six and a half years, which gave her a good experience of the credit process. She produces and sells peanut butter. The profit enables her to provide for her nephews and nieces.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand her activity

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
La señora  ANDREA A. D. M., tiene  56 años, vive en el distrito D. la BUENOS AIRES provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS II. Ella presenta estudios hasta 3ero D. primaria, refiere que ella es D. Julcan y que desD. niña se dedicó a trabajar en el campo o a cuidar y dar D. comer a los animales y por falta D. recursos económicos sus padres no le dieron más educación, tiene 3 hijos todos mayores quienes la apoyan eventualmente. La socia se dedica  a la preparación D. tortas y bocaditos para cumpleaños, matrimonios, quinceañeros, bautizos, primera comunión, etc. Y con sus primer crédito D. 300.00 nuevos soles compró: harina al por mayor, pasas, guindones, vainilla, moldes, mantequilla, grageas, para la preparación D. sus tortas y bocaditos.
Con este crédito D. 300.00 nuevos soles comprará un horno pequeño para así poder hornear sus tortas y bocaditos y no pagar un adicional por mandarlos a hornear a una panadería.
Andrea sueña con ambientar un lugar en su casa en donD. pueda vender tortas  y postres.
texts.en:
Sra. Andrea A. D. M. is 56 years old and lives in the Buenos Aires District, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Emprendedoras II” (Enterprising Women II). Andrea has a third graD. education because her parents lacked the financial resources to continue her schooling. As a child growing up in Julcan, she learned how to work in the fields and take care of the farm animals. She now has three adult children who currently support her.

Andrea prepares cakes and snacks for weddings, quinceañeras, baptisms, first communions, and other occasions. With her first loan of 300 soles, she bought flour at wholesale, raisins, plums, vanilla, baking molds, butter, and gelatin for preparing cakes and snacks.

She is now requesting another loan of 300 soles to buy a small oven so that she can bake cakes and appetizers herself without having to pay to send them to a bakery. Andrea dreams of establishing a store in her home where she can sell cakes and pastries.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase an oven

loans.name: Rutilio

texts.es: Rutilio Z. O. de 38 años de edad, reside en Colón en el departamento de La Libertad, vive junto a su compañera de vida la cual le ayuda en el negocio y junto a sus dos pequeños hijos. El posee una venta en la cual comercializa relojes, batería, brazaletes, y todo tipo de accesorios relacionados con relojes. Rutilio solicita un préstamo para poder comprar más accesorios para reloj y así mismo extender su negocio, ya que para el es muy necesario percibir mayores ganancias para brindarle a su familia todo lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
Rutilio Z. O. is 38 years old and a resident of Colón in the department of La Libertad. He lives with his life partner who helps with his business and raising their two small children. Rutilio has a vendor stand where he sells watches, batteries, wristbands, and other types of accessories related to watches. He is requesting a loan so that he can buy more watch accessories, which will enable him to continue his business. It is necessary for him to generate better earnings so that he can provide his family everything they need.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase watch accessories

loans.name: Rosa Cefelmira

texts.es:
La señora ROSA CEFELMIRA, tiene 65 años, vive en el distrito del Porvenir, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal SEMILLITAS CREATIVAS. La socia  presenta estudios hasta 5to D. secundaria, tiene 5 hijos quienes no dependen económicamente D. ella. ROSA se dedica a  la fabricación y perfilado D. calzado en un pequeño taller que tiene en su domicilio. Con su primer crédito D. 300.00 nuevo soles, compró cuero, cuerina, hilos, pegamentos, etc.  Con este crédito D. 1,700 nuevos soles, comprará cuero, plantillas al por mayor, pegamento , hilos, hebillas, etc. 
Ella sueña con exportar su calzado a las diferentes provincias del Perú.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa Cefelmira is 65 years old and lives in the District of El Porvenir, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She belongs to the Communal Bank “Semillitas Creativas” (Little Seeds of Creativity). Rosa completed her education through the 5th year of secondary school. Her five adult children are all financially independent.

Rosa designs and manufactures shoes in the small workshop in her home. With her first loan of 300 soles, she bought natural and artificial leather, thread, glue, and other supplies.

She is now requesting a loan of 1700 soles to buy leather, insoles in bulk, glue, thread, buckles, and other items. Rosa dreams of exporting her shoes to different provinces in Peru.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials & supplies for making shoes

loans.name: Joel Alberto

texts.es: Joel Alberto A. R. de 32 años de edad, reside en Colón en el departamento de La Libertad, vive junto a su esposa y su pequeño hijo. Joel posee una venta de ropa, la cual la comercializa de manera ambulante por las calles de Colón. A pesar que es un trabajo bastante pesado y arriesgado, el tiene el deseo de mejorar sus ganancias y es por esto que solicita un préstamo con el fin de poder comprar más ropa, en especial pantalones y camisetas para hombre lo cual vende más. A pesar que su familia es pequeña Joel trabaja arduamente y se esfuerza mucho para que su hijo y su esposa gocen de todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
Joel Alberto A. R. is 32 years old and a resident of Colón in the department of La Libertad. He lives with his wife and their young son. Joel sells clothing as a traveling merchant through the streets of Colón. Even though his work can be both tiring and dangerous, he desires to improve his earnings. Therefore, he is requesting a loan to buy more clothing, especially trousers and men’s shirts since he is able to sell more of these items. Even though his family is small, Joel works extremely hard to provide his wife and son everything they need.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase trousers & men's shirts

loans.name: Lizbeth

texts.es: Lizbeth G. es una socia dinámica y optimista, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 35 años, es madre de una niña (menor de edad). Lizbeth se dedica a la venta de jugos y desayunos,  cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es comerciante. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Juntas hasta el final” desde hace cinco años, el primer préstamo que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue utilizado en la compra de una batidora. Ahora Lizbeth necesita un crédito de 1600 soles, que será utilizado en la compra de otra batidora y accesorios para la implementación de su negocio. La meta de Lizbeth es llegar a construir habitaciones para dar el servicio de hospedaje donde se de una buena atención a los clientes.
texts.en:
Lizbeth G. is one of our dynamic and optimistic members who lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She is 35 years old and the mother of a young daughter.

Lizbeth sells breakfasts and juices and has the support of her husband, who works as a merchant. She joined the Communal Bank “Juntas hasta el Final” (Together until the End) five years ago. The first loan she received was in the amount of 300 soles and was used to purchase a blender.

At the moment, Lizbeth is requesting a loan of 1600 so that she can buy another blender and accessories to continue her business. Her goal is to eventually construct boarding rooms and offer hospitality services. In this future endeavor, she hopes to provide good service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a blender & other accessories

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La Sra. Celia tiene 40 años de edad, se casó a los 25 años de edad, es madre de 04 hijos menores de edad, el mayor tiene 13 años y el menor 02 años de edad, estudió hasta 2do. de secundaria, vive en el Distrito de Ilave, Provincia de el Collao, Departamento de Puno.

Hace 01 año integra el Banco Comunal “Jesús de Nazaret”, con su primer crédito de 500.00 nuevos soles compró productos de la región (papa, haba, chuño), negocio al que se dedicó por 01 año, actualmente se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado vacuno conjuntamente con su esposo.

Con este crédito de 1,500.00 nuevos soles comprará 01 ganado vacuno.

Su sueño es comprar más ganado vacuno mejorado, para obtener más ganancias y poder ayudar a sus hijos para que ellos estudien y sean profesionales.

Doña Celia nos indica le gusta participar en las reuniones del Banco Comunal, porque no necesita hacer mucho trámite para obtener crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Celia is 40 years old and got married when she was 25. She is the mother of four dependent children, ranging in age from 2 to 13. Celia completed her education through the second year of high school. She lives in the District of Ilave, El Collao Province, Department of Puno.

Celia joined the Jesus of Nazareth Communal Bank one year ago. Her first loan of 500 soles was used to buy regional products such as potatoes, broad beans, and chuño. She has been in business for one year. Celia currently buys and sells cattle with her husband.

She is requesting a new loan of 1500 soles to buy one head of cattle. Her dream is to buy more well-bred cattle so that she can obtain better earnings. This will enable her to support her children’s studies in hopes that they will become professionals.

Doña Celia says she enjoys participating in her Communal Bank meetings because they are required in order to obtain future loans.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 1 head of cattle

loans.name: Maria Eulalia

texts.en: Maria Eulalia J. is 43 years old. She has been married for 24 years and has four children aged 21, 19, 12, and 2 years old. All of them live at home. 16 years ago, Maria began her business. She has done very well and continued to grow her enterprise thanks to her loyal customers who keep coming back because of her care and good service. With the loan, Maria plans to buy a hair dryer and two chairs, with which she can make her hairdressing salon even better and have more customers.

loans.use: Hair dryer and chairs

loans.name: Suguey Yulissa

texts.es:
La señora SUGUEY YULISSA, tiene  30 años, vive en el distrito Huanchaco de la provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal  FUENTE DE VIDA. Ella presenta estudios superiores inconclusos de informática, pero está planificando, el próximo año, en retomar y culminar sus estudios, tiene 2 hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella. La socia se dedica ha atender sus cabinas de Internet y también los juegos de play station que tiene en su domicilio. Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compro teclados y mouse que le hacia falta para sus maquinas.
Con este crédito de 1,000 nuevos soles comprará juegos para los play station.
Sugey sueña con ampliar su negocio y tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Sra. Suguey Yulissa is 30 years old and lives in the District of Huanchaco, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Fuente de Vida” (Fountain of Life). Suguey started her college degree program in computer science, but did not finish. She plans to return to school next year to complete the requirements for her degree. Suguey has two children who are financially dependent on her.

She manages Internet booths and also has Play Station games available for use in her home. With her first loan of 300 soles, she bought keyboards and computer mice in order to make her machines operable. This new loan of 1000 soles will be used to buy Play Station games. Suguey dreams of growing her business so that she can generate more revenue.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Play Station games

loans.name: Nuria Elizabeth

texts.es: Nuria Elizabeth M. G. de 35 años de edad, reside en el departamento de La Libertad, vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos menores de edad. Nuria posee una tienda de productos perecederos, venta a través de la cuál logra solventar los gastos del hogar junto a su esposo. Es por ello que Nuria solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más productos como jabón, golosinas, refrescos y otros más, los cuales le permitan percibir mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Nuria Elizabeth M. G. is 35 years old and a resident of the department of La Libertad. She lives with her life partner and their three dependent children. Nuria has a store where she sells perishable goods. She started this business as a means of helping her husband cover the household expenses.

Nuria is requesting a loan so that she can buy additional products such as soap, candy, soft drinks, and other items to generate better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La señora  ANA MARIA L. C., tiene  37 años, vive en el distrito de BUENOS AIRES provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS II.  Ella presenta estudios hasta 3ero de secundaria, refiere que dejó de estudiar porque se casó a la edad de 18 años, es conviviente y  tiene 2 hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella. La socia se dedica  a la venta de leche y de menús (alimentos).
Este es su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles y lo utilizará para comprar arroz, azúcar, fideos y alimentos para las vacas para que así produzcan mayor cantidad de leche y aumentar  sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana Maria L. C. is 37 years old and lives in the District of Buenos Aires, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Emprendedoras II” (Enterprising Women II). Ana Maria completed her education through the third year of secondary school. She left school because she got married when she was 18 years old and now has two children who are financially dependent on her.

Ana Maria sells milk and prepared foods. She is receiving her first loan in the amount of 300 soles and will buy rice, sugar, noodles, and feed for her cows so that they can continue producing large quantities of milk. This will enable her to increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, noodles, and feed for her cows

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David M. is married and lives in his own home in the city of Villa Elisa. He has five children who are all in school or college. 
David has a truck he uses to provide delivery and freight services in the biggest market in the center of Villa Elisa. David has been running his freight-delivery business for the past 23 years. He previously worked with his parents in the market, selling fruits and vegetables from a stall. He saved up enough money to buy a truck and begin his business. 
David gets up very early in the morning to deliver goods to the market. The vendors open their stalls early and need their merchandise on time. Sometimes, during the summer months, David travels throughout Paraguay transporting goods between cities, such as seasonal fruits – watermelons, melons, oranges and pineapples. David needs a loan to repair parts of his truck so that it functions well and is reliable.

loans.use: To Repair his delivery vehicle

loans.name: Carmen Luz

texts.es:
La señora CARMEN LUZ V. Z., tiene  26 años, vive en el distrito Huanchaco de la provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal  FUENTE DE VIDA. Ella presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria, tiene 1 hijo de 2 años de edad quien depende económicamente de ella. La socia se dedica  a la venta de joyas como aretes, pulseras, anillos, etc. de oro de 14k.
Este es su primer crédito, ella requiere 300.00 nuevos soles y lo utilizará para la compra más joyas como aretes, pulseras y anillos.
texts.en:
Sra. Carmen Luz V. Z. is 26 years old and lives in the District of Huanchaco, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Fuente de Vida” (Fountain of Life). Carmen completed her studies through the 5th year of secondary school. She is the mother of a two year old child who is financially dependent on her.

Carmen sells jewelry such as earrings, bracelets, rings, and other items made of 14 karat gold. She is requesting her first loan in the amount of 300 soles to purchase more jewelry such as earrings, bracelets, and rings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase earrings, bracelets, and rings

loans.name: Melvin Adonai

texts.es: Melvin Adonai C. G. de 30 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Ahuachapán, vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos de 7 y 4 años respectivamente. Melvin posee  una tienda y un molino el cual es la única entrada económica que posee para solventar los gastos de su familia. Melvin solícita un préstamo con el fin de poder comprar maíz, golosinas, jugos, pan y muchos otros productos más los cuales contribuirán a que las ventas de su tienda suban, lo cual es muy beneficioso para el y toda su familia.
texts.en:
Melvin Adonai C. G., 30, lives with his wife and two children, 7- and 4-years-old, respectively, in Ahuachapán department. He has a store and a mill which are the only sources of income for the family. Melvin requests financing to buy corn, sweets, juices, bread and many other products, which will contribute to his store's increased sales earnings and thus benefit himself and his entire family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perishables.

loans.name: Maria Gregoria

texts.en: Maria Gregoria is 59 years old and is a vendor. She has eight children, all of whom are fully grown and independent. She worked in a market for 15 years, running her own stall.
