She decided to sell her stall and, together with her husband, invested in the purchase of property to open a bigger store. Now she works from home and from her store, and can sell double the amount of produce. She serves lunch to many of the workers that work in her neighborhood. Maria will use her loan to buy more ingredients and meat to make better quality food and better profit.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients and meat.

loans.name: Zully

texts.es: Zully C. es una socia perseverante y muy trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 27 años, es madre de un pequeño, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de sacos de arroz,  su esposo quien la apoya constantemente es chofer de camión. Ella forma parte del Banco Comunal “Juntas hasta el final” desde hace dos años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que utilizó en insumos para preparar comida y vender a sus conocidos. En la actualidad Zully  necesita en crédito de 1200 soles que será utilizado para comprar en la ciudad de Tarapoto los sacos de arroz y luego venderlo a sus clientes. La meta de Zully es tener una tienda comercial bien surtida de productos comestibles y seguir apoyando a su esposo para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Zully C. is one our hardworking and persevering members. She lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. Zully is 27 years old and the mother of a small child. She buys and sells sacks of rice. Her husband works as a truck driver and provides her with constant support.

Zully joined the Communal Bank “Juntas Hasta el Final” (Together until the End) two years ago. The first loan she received was in the amount of 300 soles and was used to buy supplies for preparing meals that she sold to acquaintances. At the moment, Zully needs a loan of 1200 soles to buy sacks of rice in the city of Tarapoto. She will later sell them to customers. Her goal is to have a well-stocked retail store full of food products so that she can continue supporting her husband and get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sacks of rice at wholesale

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.es:
La señora CRESENCIA JERÓNIMO I., tiene 50 años, vive en el distrito del Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal SEMILLITAS CREATIVAS. La  socia presenta estudios hasta 6to de Secundaria, tiene 5 hijos y ninguno depende económicamente de ella.
CRESENCIA se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza como: talcos, cremas, colonias, labiales, etc. y con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles invirtió en la compra de mas productos de belleza como labiales, cremas, talcos, colonias, perfumes, etc. 
Con este crédito de 200.00 nuevos soles comprará labiales, colonias, cremas, talcos, etc. para estar  abastecida en campaña  navideña.
Ella sueña con alquilar un stand en un centro comercial en donde vender sus productos con mayor frecuencia y facilidad.
texts.en:
Sra. Cresencia Jeronimó I. is 50 years old and lives in the District of El Porvenir, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Semillitas Creativas” (Little Seeds of Creativity). Cresencia completed her studies through the 6th year of secondary school. She has 5 children who are all independent.

Cresencia sells beauty products such as talcum powders, crèmes, colognes, lipsticks, and other items. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to purchase more beauty products such as lipsticks, crèmes, talcum powders, colognes, perfumes, etc.

With this new loan of 200 soles, she will purchase lipsticks, colognes, crèmes, talcum powders, and other products for the Christmas season. She dreams of renting a stand at a shopping center where she can sell her products more frequently and easily.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products to sell for the Christmas season

loans.name: Modesto

texts.en:
Modesto P. is 53 years old and is married to Teresa de Jesús Sosa who is 53 years old. They have four children, a son who is married and has a business in vehicle equipment, and three daughters who are still in school. 
Modesto has a small restaurant where he serves seafood and mostly fish-based dishes. He has been running his restaurant since 1983 and is the only restaurant in the area that serves fish. Modesto needs a loan to purchase higher quality fish – it is very expensive as Paraguay is a land-locked country – so he can make higher profit. He will also use it to buy a new freezer and tables and chairs.

loans.use: Freezer, tables, chairs.

loans.name: Adelitas Group

texts.es:
Adelitas, así se hacen llamar un grupo de 8 mujeres y 1 varon que muy alegres desarrollan su reunión, en el Centro Focal Collpani además  les gusta la capacitación que imparten en Pro Mujer y durante el anterior préstamo ellas  se capacitaron en un 20% en temas de Fortalecimiento (Mora, Central de Riesgo), 20% en temas de Salud y 10% Negocios.  

Todas tienen diversos negocios como la venta de conservas, lana, detergentes, llantas, bordado de prendas de vestir y transporte. Ellas necesitan el préstamo para comprar  mercadería y materia prima según el negocio que tengan.
texts.en:
Adelitas, which this group of eight women and one man call themselves, happily meet in the Collpani regional branch. They enjoy the training that is given at Pro Mujer. During the previous loan, they trained themselves, dedicating 20% on topics about financial strengthening (default payments, banking risks office), 20% about health, and 10% about business. All of them have distinct businesses, such as the sale of canned goods, wool, detergents, tires, embroidered clothing, and transportation. They need this loan to purchase merchandise and raw materials according to the businesses that they own.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise and raw materials.

loans.name: Carmen Lisseth

texts.es: Carmen Lisseth E. F. de 24 años de edad, reside en Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad, vive junto a su pequeño hijo de 3 años de edad. Carmen posee una venta de tortillas en su casa, trabajo el cual le permite darle el sustento a su pequeño hijo, ya que Carmen es madre soltera, debe esforzarse el doble por brindarle todo lo necesario a su pequeño. Ella solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más maíz para la elaboración de las tortillas.
texts.en:
Carmen Lisseth E., 24, lives in Ciudad Arce, which is in the La Libertad department, with her little 3-year-old son. She sells tortillas from her home, a line of work that allows her to support her small son since Carmen is a single mother. She must work twice as hard to provide everything her child needs. She asks for financing to buy corn with which to make tortillas.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn.

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Zain Elizabeth

texts.es: Zain es una socia trabajadora y perseverante, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali, tiene 33 años, es madre de dos niños, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, su esposo es motocarrista. Zain forma parte del Banco comunal “Mujeres perseverantes II” desde hace dos años, tiempo que ha sabido desarrollarse económicamente, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que le permitió invertir en repuestos para su motocar. En la actualidad ella necesita un crédito de 700 soles que será utilizado para comprar productos de belleza y vender a sus diferentes clientes. La meta de Zain es llegar a tener un bazar bien implementado.
texts.en:
Zain is a working woman and is persistent. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the region of Ucayali. She is 33 and is the mother of two children. She is dedicated to selling beauty products and her husband is a driver. Zain has been part of the communal bank "Mujeres perseverantes II" for the last two years. In that time she has been learning to develop economically. The first loan she received was for 300 soles that allowed her to invest in parts for their car. At present she needs a loan for 700 soles that she will use to buy beauty products and sell to her clients. Zain's goal is to have a well set up stall.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will used the loan to buy beauty products to sell to her clients

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
Rufina D. G. is 50 years old and is married to Diosnel Arrua, who works as a construction worker. 
They have 2 children, one who is 30 and a mathematics teacher, and one who is 15 and enrolled in secondary school. Rufina has operated a pantry out of her home since 1990, where she sells groceries and haberdashery. 
Rufina would use her loan to purchase goods wholesale, such as sugar, noodles, rice – which would decrease the cost and increase her profits. She would also be able to have a greater variety of merchandise to offer her customers.
texts.en:
Rufina D. G. is 50 years old and is married to Diosnel Arrua, who works as a construction worker. They have 2 children, one who is 30 and a mathematics teacher, and one who is 15 and enrolled in secondary school. Rufina has operated a pantry out of her home since 1990, where she sells groceries and haberdashery. Rufina would use her loan to purchase goods wholesale, such as sugar, noodles, rice – which would decrease the cost and increase her profits. She would also be able to have a greater variety of merchandise to offer her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Foodstuffs

loans.name: Hilian Ernec

texts.es: Hilian Ernec C. Mejía de 35 años de edad, reside en Colón en el departamento de La Libertad, vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos. Hilian posee una panadería desde hace ocho años negocio el cual ha ido creciendo poco a poco. El solícita un préstamo a través del cuál el pueda comprar toda la materia prima para la elaboración del pan, así mismo desea poder comprar utensilios los cuales se utilizan para hornear el pan. Hiliac es una persona muy trabajadora la cual ha enseñado a sus hijos el valor del trabajo y es por esto que desea seguir creciendo en el negocio y poder brindarles una vida mejor a sus hijos y su esposa.
texts.en:
Hilian Emec C. Mejia is 35 years old and lives in Colón in the La Libertad neighborhood. He lives with his wife and 2 children. He has run a bakery for 8 years, which has been growing. He requests a loan so that he can purchase more raw materials to make more bread, and purchase enamelware to bake the bread. Hiliac is a hardworking person who has shown his children the value of work, and because of this he wants to continue to build his business to be able to give his children and wife a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raw materials to make bread

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La señora Lidia es socia del Banco Comunal “Jesús de Nazaret”, en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno, tiene 35 años, es casada,  tiene 07 hijos: 05 son varones y 02 mujeres,  ella tiene estudios de primaria completa.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 1 año, se dedica a  la compra y venta de ganado vacuno, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 con el que compró 02 ovinos porque no alcanzaba para comprar ganado vacuno, paralelo a ello también realiza actividades agrícolas para su autoconsumo.

Con este crédito de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará 01 toro para engordarlo en 03 meses para luego venderlo en la feria de ganado.

Indica que en su  Banco Comunal las socias son puntuales y ello le agrada.

Su anhelo es que sus hijos terminen de estudiar y su negocio siga creciendo para poder apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Lidia is part of the communal bank “Jesús de Nazaret.” She lives in the main district in the province of El Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 35 years old and is married. She has seven children: five sons and two daughters. She has finished elementary school.

For the past year Lidia has worked with el Movimiento Maunela Ramos where she has dedicated herself to the buying and selling of cattle. Her first loan was for 500 Nuevos Soles which she used to buy two sheep because she was not able to buy cattle. At the same time she also farms for personal consumption.

With this credit of 1,000 Nuevos Soles, she will buy one bull to fatten for three months to then sell in the cattle market.

In her communal bank all the woman are punctual and that pleases her.

Lidia wants her children to finish their studies and she wants her business to continue growing so she can help her children in their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a bull

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 51 years old and has seven children. Maria sells milk from her three dairy cows, and has a small garden where she grows vegetables. Maria would like to diversify her small farm and raise pigs for pork. She needs a loan to pay for pig food to fatten up the pig and for the services of a pig butcher. Maria’s husband, who sells hamburgers and drinks from a stall, has also taken out a loan from the Fundacion Paraguaya and it has helped his business enormously.

loans.use: Pig food and butcher services

loans.name: Nelis Yamileth

texts.es: Nelis Yamileth M. D. A. D. 39 años D. edad, resiD. en Ahuachapán, vive junto a su esposo y cuatro hijos menores D. 14, 12 10 y 3 años D. edad, los tres hijos mayores se dedican a estudiar mientras que el pequeño esta al cuidado D. ella durante todo el día. Nelis posee una venta D. ropa en el mercado D. Ahuachapán, en este lugar ella comercializa ropa para niños y adultos. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más ropa y poder aprovechar la temporada naviD.ña en la cual sus ventas se incrementan, es por esto que ella desea surtir su negocio y tener gran variedad D. tallas y colores.
texts.en:
Nelis Yamileth M. D. A., 39, lives with her husband and four minor children, 14-, 12-, 10, and 3-years-old, in Ahuachapán. The three older children are all students and the youngest is still at home under her care all day. Nelis sells clothing for children and adults in the Ahuachapán market. She is requesting financing to buy more clothing to stock her stall with items in a wiD. variety of sizes and colors so that she can take advantage of the Christmas season when sales rise.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La Señora Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal “Azangarinas Valientes” del distrito y provincia de Azángaro, es  madre soltera y tiene a su cuidado a sus 02 hijos.  Tiene 60 años de edad y viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 01 año y medio, estudió hasta el tercer año de secundaria.

Ella actualmente se dedica a  la venta de productos de pasamanería como ganchos, detergentes, jabones, etc. y tiene una puesto en el mercado de Azángaro.
El primer préstamo que solicitó fue de S/. 500.00, el cual invirtió en la compra de productos para incrementar su mercadería

Con este crédito de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de más productos como ganchos, jabón, detergente y así poder seguir vendiendo, para generar sus propios ingresos.

Su visión  para el futuro es poder viajar y poder visitar a sus familiares.

Lo que mas le gusta  son los encuentros deportivos que se realizan a nivel de Bancos Comunales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Victoria is a member of the communal bank "Azangarinas Valientes" from the district and province Azangaro. She is a single mother and takes care of her 2 children. She is 60 years old and began working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos one and a half years ago. She studied up to her junior year of high school. She currently sells trimmings or decorative fringes such as hooks, detergents, soaps, etc. She has a stall in the Azangaro market. The first loan she requested was S /. 500.00, which she invested in purchasing products to increase her merchandise. With this credit of S /. 1,000.00 nuevos soles, she will invest in buying more products, such as hooks, soap, and detergent, and thus, will be able to continue selling to generate her own income. Her vision for the future is to be able to travel and visit her relatives. What she likes most are the sport matches that are taking place at the communal banks.

Translated from Spanish by Elycia Mulholland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase hooks, soaps, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Fidelina

texts.en: Fidelina is 30 and has two children. She is a vendor selling meat. Fidelina previously worked in a pharmacy. She met a butcher who she decided to partner with to sell his meat. She is doing very well, because she is a very successful saleswoman. Fidelina needs a loan to buy more meat from the butcher to sell, so she can keep the profits.

loans.use: To buy more meat to sell.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: Reina Isabel S. C. de 44 años de edad, reside en San Martín junto su esposo y sus dos hijos los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Ella posee una tienda en su casa, en la cual vende todo tipo de productos perecederos y de primera necesidad. Reina solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar productos al por mayor, así de esta manera obtener mejores precios. Reina desea mejorar sus márgenes de ganancias y poder brindarles una ayuda extra a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Reina Isabel S. C., 44, lives in San Martín with her husband and two sons, who are students. She runs a general store in her house where she sells all kinds of perishable and basic household products. She requests financing to buy products at wholesale so that she can improve her profits. Reina wants to improve her profit margin so that she can giver her husband extra help with household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perishables.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La señora Nancy es socia del banco comunal “Las Brisas del Río Blanco” del distrito de Pilcuyo , provincia de El Collao; ella tiene 26 años de edad, es casada, no tiene hijos. Estudio en el pedagógico (Instituto).
Nancy  trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 04 años; tiene una tienda de abarrotes, también se dedica a la crianza de vacas.
Nos cuenta que con su primer préstamo, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, compró azúcar, fideos, arroz, etc.
Ella requiere un nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, con los cuales comprará azúcar, arroz, fideos, etc.
 Su visión hacia el futuro es, ejercer su profesión (profesora) y dejarle a su mamá su negocio.
Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro que se realiza al interior del Banoc comunal, de esta manera sirve de reserva.
texts.en:
Sra. Nancy is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Brisas del Río Blanco” (The Breezes of Río Blanco), which is located in the District of Pilcuyo, El Collao Province. She is 26 years old, married, and does not have children. Nancy earned a teaching degree at a local institute.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 4 years. Nancy manages a grocery store and also raises cows. She says her first loan was in the amount of 300 soles and was used to buy sugar, noodles, rice, etc.

Nancy is requesting a new loan in the amount of 500 soles to buy sugar, rice, noodles, etc. Her vision for the future is to allow her mother to manage her business so that she can pursue teaching. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank is the group savings account which enables her to set aside money as a reserve.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es: Ana Gloria H. D. N. D. 54 años D. edad, resiD. en San Martín en el departamento D. San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos. Ella posee una panadería desD. ya hace bastantes años, negocio el cual Ana Gloria desea que crezca aún más ya que es muy rentable. Ella solicita un préstamo con el cual pueda comprar al por mayor, leña, harina, azúcar y otros productos más para la elaboración del pan. Ana gloria es una mujer muy trabajadora la cual se esfuerza por seguir adelante en la vida y poder mejorar su economía familiar.
texts.en:
Ana Gloria H. D. N., 54, lives in San Martín, San Salvador department, with her husband and two children. She has had a bakery for several years and Ana Gloria hopes that it will grow still more because it is a very profitable business. She requests financing to buy firewood, flour, sugar and other bread-making ingredients at wholesale. Ana Gloria is a very hard-working woman who makes the effort to get ahead in life and to improve her family's income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood, flour and sugar.

loans.name: Ines Veronica

texts.es:
La señora Inés es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Brisas del Río Blanco” del distrito de Pilcuyo, provincia de El Collao; ella tiene 22 años de edad, es casada, tiene 01 hijo que viven con ella. Estudió secundaria completa. 
Inés trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 02 años; se dedica a la compra y venta de productos regionales los cuales lleva a Arequipa a vender.
Nos cuenta que con su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que invirtió en la compra de queso y pan.
Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, los cuales invertirá en comprar mas mercadería, productos de la región (papa, chuño) y luego los venderá en Arequipa.
Su visión a futuro es, comprarse un trailer.
Lo que mas le gusta de su banco comunal son las charlas y conversar con las socias.
texts.en:
Sra. Inés is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Brisas del Río Blanco” (The Breezes of Río Blanco), which is located in the District of Pilcuyo, El Collao Province. She is 22 years old, married, and has one dependent child. Inés has a high school education.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for two years. Inés buys regional products and travels to Arequipa to sell them. She says her first loan was in the amount of 500 soles and was used to buy cheese and bread.

At the moment, she is requesting a loan of 3000 soles to buy more merchandise, such as potatoes and chuño, to sell in Arequipa. In the future, she would like to buy a trailer. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the seminars and the discussions among the members.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase potatoes & chuño

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es: Candida tiene 3 hijos, una mayor de edad, y 2 que tiene a cargo, el mayor trabaja como pintor, el otro hijo estudia 3 er  año de educación secundaria, y la hija menor estudia 3 er año de educación secundaria, trabaja para el Ministerio de educación  como docente primaria desde hace 15 años,  está solicitando su 7mo credito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda, como es cambirle el zinc a la casa que se encuentra en mal estado y con las lluvias se le mojan algunas cosas,  es importante mencionar con los creditos anteriores otorgados por AFODENIC a mejorado su vivienda y ha mejorado sus condiciones de vida,  es una mujer que sueña con tener un porvenir mejor y que sus hijos tengan siempre lo basico y que estudien para que lleguen hacer excelentes profesionales, trabajo y sobre todo estar bien con Dios, profesan la religión evengélica.
texts.en:
Candida has three children, one an adult, and two under her care. The eldest is a painter, the other son is in 9th grade, and the youngest daughter is in third grade. She has been employed by the Ministry of Education as an elementary school teacher for the last 15 years. This is her 7th loan request which will be used for home improvements, specifically to replace the zinc metal sheeting on the roof which is in such bad state, that during the rainy season much of her belongings are water damaged. It bears mentioning that with her previous loans from AFODENIC she has improved her home and her living conditions. She is a woman who dreams with having a better future, that her children always have their basic needs met, that they study to become excellent professionals, that she have work, and above all, to be in good standing with God; they profess the evangelical faith.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To replace the roof.

loans.name: Sonia Del Carmen

texts.es: Sonia del Carmen G. de 20 años de edad reside en el departamento de Morazán, vive junto a su esposo y su pequeña hija. Ella posee una venta de cosméticos y ropa en el parque de osicala en el departamento de Morazán. Ella solicita un préstamo para poder invertir más en ropa, sobre todo para personas adultas. Sonia es una joven muy emprendedora la cual anhela mejorar su negocio, ya que desea mejorar las ventas y así seguir progresando en la vida, y brindarle todo lo necesario a su hija.
texts.en:
Sonia del Carmen G., 20, lives with her husband and small daughter in Morazán department. She sells clothing and cosmetics in Osicala's park, Morazán department. She asks for financing to buy more clothing, especially for adults. Sonia is an very enterprising young woman who wishes to improve her business because she wants to increase sales to continue to make progress in life and thus provide everything necessary for her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Iliana Lisseth

texts.es: Iliana Lisseth T. G. de 23 años de edad, reside en Sensuntepeque en el departamento de Cabañas, vive junto a sus dos hijos de ocho y cinco años, su esposo reside en Los Estados Unidos. Ella posee una tienda de productos perecederos, la cual con muchos esfuerzos ha logrado sacar adelante. Ella solicita un préstamo para poder comprar productos como pan, leche y jugos, productos los cuales son más solicitados y generan mayores ganancias. A pesar que su esposo reside en Los Estados Unidos, Iliana recibe pocas remesas, es por esto que debe trabajar mucho para poder mantener a flote su negocio.
texts.en:
Iliana Lisseth T. G. is 23 years old, and lives in Sensuntepeque, in the Cabañas State. She lives with her 2 sons of eight and five years old. Her husband lives in the United States. She owns a store of perishables (fresh foods), which with a great deal of effort, she has managed to get ahead. She is asking for a loan to enable her to buy products like bread, milk, juices, and products which are in high demand and generate the most earnings. In spite of that fact that her husband lives in the USA, Iliana receives only a little income, and for that reason she works a lot to be able to keep her business afloat.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase food and products

loans.name: María Sandra

texts.es: María Sandra D. L. O D. 43 años D. edad, resiD. en Sensuntepeque, departamento D. Cabañas, vive junto a sus tres hijos los cuales se dedican a estudiar. María posee una tienda D. productos perecederos en su casa, negocio el cual ha ido tratando D. mejorarlo e irlo surtiendo a través del tiempo. Es por esto que elL. solicita un préstamo con el cuál pueda comprar más productos para su tienda sobre todo productos los cuales son más solicitados por las personas. María es madre soltera, L. cual desea mejorar su negocio y así obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
María Sandra D. L. O is 43 years old and resides in Sensuntepeque, in the Cabañas State. She lives with her three children who are studying in school. María has a store and sells perishables in her home. The business has has been trying to better itself and over time. For this reason, she's asking for a loan with which she can buy more products for her store; above all products that are most popular among her clients. María is a single mother, who wants to improve her business and thereby obtain greater earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of perishable products

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en: Josefina is 44 years old and has two grown and independent children with her husband. Josefina has been in the business of selling toys, sunglasses and electronic items for more than five years. She began selling basic products, and then with her savings, she increased her supply of products with a higher margin of profit. Recently she bought a stall in front of a large shopping center, where it can attract many customers. Josefina would like a loan for the purchase of merchandise.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Mariama Siré

texts.fr: Mariama Siré C. est une femme de 24 ans et mère de trois enfants dont une fille. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis trois ans et demi. Elle détient une boutique et son crédit lui servira à la renforcer en marchandises afin de générer des bénéfices assez consistants pour pouvoir aider son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Mariama Siré C., aged 24, is the mother of three children, of whom one is a girl. She has been a member of a village bank for three and a half years. She owns a convenience store. Mariama will use her loan to increase her inventory. She expects to generate enough profit to help her husband to provide for their family.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her business

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es: José Luis A. R. de 51 años de edad Reside en el departamento de Chalatenango, vive junto a su esposo y tres hijos menores de edad los cuales se dedican a estudiar. El posee una panadería, en la cual trabaja junto a su esposa, con el fin de brindarles a sus hijos la oportunidad de tener una vida mejor, llena de todas las necesidades básicas. José Luis solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar materia prima para la elaboración del pan, el junto a su esposa son una pareja muy alegre los cuales comparten no solo el mismo trabajo sino también el mismo deseo de brindarles a sus hijos una vida mejor.
texts.en:
José Luis A. R. is 51 years old. He reside in the Chalatenango State. He lives with his wife and three young children who are still in school. He owns a bakery, in which he works with his wife, to provide their children with a better life, full of the basic necessities. José Luis is asking for a loan with which he can buy raw ingredients for making bread. Together with his wife, they are a happy couple who share not only in the same work, but also in the same desires to provide a better life for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of basic ingredients for making bread

loans.name: José Cristóbal

texts.es:
En el municipio de El Viejo en la ciudad de Chinandega, el señor Cristobal H. se dedica arduamente a su actividad de siembra de sorgo al que se dedica con mucho esfuerzo con el fin de beneficiar a su familia para su propio desarrollo.

Él ha acudido a Ceprodel con el fin de solicitar el crédito para invertirlo en el riego para el cultivo de sorgo y el pago de mozo para el corte y almacenamiento. La actividad la lleva a cabo por medio de su maquinaria de riego. Es por esta razón que espera que su crédito sea otorgado a lo inmediato para dar lugar al riego del cultivo de sorgo en su localidad.
texts.en:
In the community of El Viejo in the city of Chinandega, Sr. Cristobal H. devotes his time to growing sorghum in order to support his family. He has approached CEPRODEL to request a loan to pay for the irrigation, harvesting, and storage of his sorghum crop. He hopes this loan will be granted immediately so that he can proceed with the watering of his fields.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for the irrigation, harvesting, and storage of his sorghum crop

loans.name: Marco Vinicio

texts.es: Marco Vinicio Z. H.  de 36 años de edad, vive en Sonsonate, junto a su esposa y sus dos pequeños hijos. Marco posee una venta de celulares y accesorios para estos, así mismo vende recargas de saldo y repara celulares. El solícita un préstamo ya que desea poder comprar nuevos modelos de celulares y accesorios para estos. Para marco el crecimiento de su negocio es de mucha importancia, ya que es la única fuente de ingresos que posee, es por ellos que solicita un préstamo con la esperanza de poder mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Marco Vinicio Z. H. is 36 years old and lives in Sonsonate with his wife and two small children. He manages a vending post where he sells cellular phones and accessories. In addition, he sells phone chargers and provides phone repair services. He is requesting a loan in order to buy new phone models and related accessories. Growing his business is important to Marco since this is his only source of income. Therefore, he hopes this loan will help improve his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cellular phones & accessories

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos C. de 48 años de edad, reside en Nahuizalco en el departamento de Sonsonate, vive junto a su esposa y tres hijos. El posee una carpintería en su casa, en la cual trabaja por encargo elaborando diferentes productos hechos de madera. Carlos se ha dedicado a este trabajo gran parte de su vida y cuenta con una amplia experiencia es por ello que cuenta con muy buenas referencias. Carlos solicita un préstamo para poder comprar madera, pintura, clavos y otras cosas más las cuales utiliza para realizar su trabajo.
texts.en:
Carlos C. is a resident of Nahuizalco in the department of Sonsonate. He lives with his wife and three children. Carlos operates a carpentry workshop out of his home, where he is contracted to produce different items made of wood. He has dedicated much of his life to this line of work and has gained extensive experience. Carlos presents excellent references and will use his loan to buy wood, paint, nails, and other items he needs to complete his work.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood, paint, nails, and other supplies

loans.name: Téning

texts.fr: Téning AWGUE est âgée de 37 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 6 ans et demi et a bénéficié de 13 prêts qu'elle a bien gérés et remboursés. Son crédit lui servira à développer une activité de petit commerce; elle vend sur table divers produits tels que du tabac, du sucre, du thé, quelque effets de beauté etc. Elle participe environs à 50% à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Téning Wagué, aged 37, is married and the mother of five children. She has been a member of a village bank for six and a half years and received 13 loans which she managed well and repaid on schedule. This loan will help her to boost her convenience store. She sells on a table various products, such as tobacco products, sugar, tea and a few beauty products. She contributes to approximately half of the improvement of the living conditions of her family.

See Téning's previous Kiva loans here and here.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her convenience store

loans.name: Julián Apolinar

texts.es:
Julián Apolinar G. G. es un señor de 53 años de edad el cual vive en  una comunidad llamada Hernández localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa con grandes paisajes, presenta una gran humedad y además se encuentra sobre la carretera muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, tubérculos y  naranja.

Don Julián se dedica a la agricultura, desde hace aproximadamente un año se dedica a la siembra de yuca, un tubérculo de agradable sabor, rico en nutrientes, de procesamiento agroindustrial amplio y de gran demanda tanto en Costa Rica como en otros países.

Actualmente Don Julián está solicitando un préstamo de ¢670,000 (seiscientos setenta mil colones), para ampliar su siembra y así ayudarse con  la preparación del suelo, compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos entre otros insumos que sean necesarios para garantizar la siembra óptima de la yuca. 

Don Julián es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Unidos por un Desarrollo, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su segundo  préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Julián Apolinar G. G. is 53 years old and lives in the community of Hernández located in Los Chiles, Alajuela Province. This community is in a mountainous area that experiences great humidity. It is on the road that is closest to the northern border of the country. The principal economic activities of the region are livestock breeding and agriculture, specifically the cultivation of basic grains, tubers, and oranges.

Don Julian is a dedicated farmer. For about a year he has been growing cassava, a tuber that is rich in nutrients and has a pleasant flavor. It is processed for a wide variety of uses and has great demand in Costa Rica as well as from other countries.

Don Julian is currently requesting a loan of 670,000 colones to increase his crop yield and prepare his land for planting. He will purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other supplies necessary to ensure optimum conditions for growing cassava.

Don Julian is a member of the United Community Credit Enterprise for Development, one of the 100 partner organizations affiliated with EDESA in Costa Rica. This is his second loan and he hopes to grow personally and financially. He would like to offer his thanks to these types of organizations and credit facilitators that enable him to devote more time to productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other supplies for growing cassava

loans.name: Claudia Ivonne

texts.es: Claudia tiene 21 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene una hija de 2 años de edad. Vive en la casa de su abuela quien ya falleció. Ella vive juntamente con su madre. Claudia se dedica a la venta de cerveza y alquiler de mesas de billar en su domicilio. Claudia se dedica a este negocio hace 2 años. La apoyó su madre para tener el capital de trabajo. Tiene muchos objetivos y metas que cumplir ya que es una persona muy joven. Uno de ellos es incrementar su capital de trabajo e implementar su negocio para darle mejor nivel de vida a su hija. A Claudia le gusta mantener limpia y ordenada su negocio. Con el dinero que solicita realizará mejoras del piso de su negocio.
texts.en:
Claudia is 21 years old and a single mother of a two year old daughter. She and her mother live in the house of her late grandmother.

Claudia sells beer and operates a billiard hall inside of her house. She started this business two years ago with the help of her mother, who provided the startup capital. Being a young woman, she has many goals and objectives that she wants to achieve. One of them is to increase her working capital so that she can grow her business and provide her daughter with a better quality of life. Claudia likes to keep her business neat and clean. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to repair and remodel the floors of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair and remodel the floors of her billiard hall

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Marta A. G. es una señora de 49 años de edad la cual vive con su hijo en  una comunidad llamada Hernández localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa con grandes paisajes, presenta una gran humedad y además se encuentra sobre la carretera muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, tubérculos y  naranja.

Doña Marta se dedica a la avicultura específicamente a la cría de pollos para engorde y quiere ampliar su proyecto incluyendo gallinas ponedoras - para la producción de carne y huevos respectivamente -. Ella vende sus productos a los vecinos de la comunidad, quienes se muestran muy satisfechos por la calidad. Su esposo le ayuda ocasionalmente con el transporte. 

Actualmente doña Marta está solicitando un microcrédito de ¢670,000 (seiscientos setenta mil colones) para la compra de más pollos para engorde y gallinas ponedoras, así como compra de concentrado para su alimentación y productos para la prevención y  tratamiento de enfermedades.  Con esta inversión espera que su microempresa se fortalezca y crezca más, para poder atraer a más clientes y ofrecerles mejores productos.

Doña Marta es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Unidos por un Desarrollo, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer  préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Marta A. G. is 49. She lives with her son in the Hernández community located in Los Chiles in the Aljuela province. This community stands out for its mountainous regions with great scenery. It is very humid, and it is very close to the northern border of the country. Its primary economic activities are livestock and farming. Specifically, they plant basic grains, tubers, and oranges. Marta raises and fattens chickens. She wants to expand her project by including laying hens. This is for the production of meat and eggs. She sells her products to the neighbors in her community, and they are very satisfied with the quality. He husband helps occasionally with the transport. Marta is currently asking for a small loan for ¢670,000 (six hundred seventy thousand colones) to buy more chickens to fatten and to buy laying hens. She will also buy concentrated food for them and products to prevent and treat illnesses. With this investment she expects that her small business will become strong and grow more. Then she will be able to attract more customers and offer them better products. Marta is a member of the United Community Credit Enterprise for Development, one of the 100 partner organizations affiliated with EDESA in Costa Rica. This is her first loan and she hopes to grow personally and financially. She would like to offer her thanks to these types of organizations and credit facilitators that enable her to devote more time to productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy hens and chickens

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es:
La socia BRIGIDA pertenece al banco comunal “HATUN SONCCO”. El nombre del banco comunal es de origen del idioma Quechua, “HATUN” significa “Grande” y “SONCCO” significa “Corazón” que traducido al español significa “Corazón grande”. 

La socia tiene 44 años de edad, es madre soltera y es padre y madre para sus tres hijos. El mayor tiene veinte años y estudia para ser técnico electricista en el Instituto Superior “Senati” del Cusco. Los menores estudian en el colegio. Ellos viven en la ciudad Imperial del Cusco. La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta de comida. Nuestra socia tiene su restaurante llamado “Nuevo Horizonte” donde prepara desayuno , almuerzo y cena. Ya son varios años con esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo, nuestra socia es una madre luchadora y emprendedora pues con mucha voluntad se dedica a la enseñanza. La socia requiere el préstamo para la educación, para la alimentación, mensualidad del colegio de sus hijas y para aumentar el capital del negocio.       
 
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Brigida is a member of the “Hatun Soncco” communal bank. The name of the communal bank comes from the Quechua language: "Hatun" means "big" and "Soncco" means "heart," so that the name translates to "Big Heart." Brigida is 44 years old and a single mother, serving as both father and mother to her three children. The eldest is 20 years old and is currently studying to be an electrical technician at the Senati Institute of Higher Learning in Cusco. The younger children are still in school. They live in the Imperial City of Cusco. Brigida divides her time between her work in the home and her business selling food. She operates a restaurant called “Nuevo Horizonte” [New Horizon], where she offers breakfast, lunch and dinner. She has carried out this work for several years, and it has gone very well for her, thanks to all of the effort and dedication she puts into it. She is a determined and entrepreneurial mother, and she is strongly focused on her children's education. She currently needs a loan for education, nutrition, school fees for her daughters, and to increase the capital available for her business. Brigida expresses her appreciation for the opportunity provided to her in this manner, and she has committed herself to making her payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding food sales by preparing more meals during the Christmas holidays

loans.name: Henry

texts.es:
Henry A. G. es un señor de 39 años de edad el cual vive con sus 5 hijos y su esposa en  una comunidad llamada Hernández localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa, presenta una gran humedad y además se encuentra muy sobre la carretera cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, tubérculos y  naranja.

Desde hace 4 años que don Henry se dedica a la cría y venta de Tilapia, tiene un lugar adecuado para tal fin; comenta que el negocio  ha ido creciendo poco a poco y que en estos momentos le va muy bien, ya que  su producto es muy  aceptado en su comunidad. 

Debido a que tiene bastante demanda de tilapia don Henry desea solicitar un micro crédito por ¢ 670,000 (seiscientos setenta  mil colones) para comprar crías, alimento, entre otros insumos que necesita; ya que quiere agrandar su negocio, brindar un mejor servicio, y por supuesto mejora la calidad de vida de su familia. 

Don Henry es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Unidos por un Desarrollo, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer  préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Henry A. G. is 39 years old and lives with his wife and five children in the community of Hernández located in Los Chiles, Alajuela Province. This community is in a mountainous area that experiences great humidity. It is on the road that is closest to the northern border of the country. The principal economic activities of the region are livestock breeding and agriculture, specifically the cultivation of basic grains, tubers, and oranges.

Don Henry has been raising and selling tilapia for four years. He has a place set aside specifically for this purpose. His business has been growing steadily and is doing very well at the moment since his products are widely accepted in the community.

Because the demand for tilapia is growing, Don Henry is requesting a microloan of 670,000 colones in order to buy hatchlings, fish food, and other necessary supplies. His goals are to expand his business, provide better service, and improve the quality of life for his family.

Don Henry is a member of the United Community Credit Enterprise for Development, one of the 100 partner organizations affiliated with EDESA in Costa Rica. This is his first loan and he hopes to grow personally and financially. He would like to offer his thanks to these types of organizations and credit facilitators that enable him to devote more time to productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tilapia hatchlings, fish food, and other supplies

loans.name: Bélgica Vanessa

texts.es:
Bélgica Vanessa C. M. es una joven señora de 23 años de edad la cual vive con su pequeño hijo y con su madre en  una comunidad llamada Hernández localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa con grandes paisajes, presenta una gran humedad y además se encuentra sobre la carretera muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, tubérculos y  naranja.

Desde muy joven Bélgica se ha dedicado a la cría de cerdo para engorde. Ella vende sus productos a los vecinos de la comunidad, quienes se muestran muy satisfechos por la calidad de estos. Comenta que desde que inició el proyecto se ha sentido muy bien.

Actualmente Bélgica está solicitando un microcrédito de ¢ 670,000 (seiscientos setenta mil colones)  para la compra de más cerdos para engorde, así como compra de alimento entre otros insumos necesarios para que su negocio salga adelante Con esta inversión espera que su microempresa crezca más, para poder atender a más clientes y ofrecerles mejores productos. Todo esto ayudará a mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia. 

Bélgica es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Unidos por un Desarrollo, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer  préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Bélgica Vanessa C. M. is a 23 year old young woman. She lives with her small child and her mother in the Hernández community located in Los Chiles in the Aljuela province. This community stands out for its mountainous regions with great scenery. It is very humid, and it is very close to the northern border of the country. It primary economic activities are livestock and farming. Specifically, they plant basic grains, tubers, and oranges. Ever since she was a young girl, Bélica has raised pigs to fatten them. She sells her products to the neighbors in the community. They are very satisfied with her products. She says that since she started this project she has felt very good. Bélica is currently asking for a small loan for ¢ 670,000 (six hundred seventy thousand colones) to buy more pigs to fatten. She will also buy food and other supplies necessary to get her business ahead. With this investment she expects her small business to grow in order to take care of more customers and offer them better products. All of this will help improve living conditions for her and for her family. Bélica is a member of the United Community Credit Enterprise for Development, one of the 100 partner organizations affiliated with EDESA in Costa Rica. This is her first loan and she hopes to grow personally and financially. She would like to offer her thanks to these types of organizations and credit facilitators that enable her to devote more time to productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pigs to fatten

loans.name: Karlet

texts.es:
Karlet R. G. es una joven señora de 21 años de edad la cual vive con su pequeño hijo y su esposo en  una comunidad llamada Hernández localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa con grandes paisajes, presenta una gran humedad y además se encuentra sobre la carretera muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, tubérculos y  naranja.

Desde hace poco más de seis meses que Karlet se dedica a la cría de cerdo para engorde. Ella vende sus productos a los vecinos de la comunidad, quienes se muestran muy satisfechos por la calidad de estos. Comenta que desde que inició el proyecto se ha sentido muy bien ya que ha visto como su arduo trabajo poco a poco a hecho que su negocio crezca.

Actualmente Karlet está solicitando un microcrédito de ¢ 670,000 (seiscientos setenta mil colones)  para la compra de más cerdos para engorde, así como compra de alimento y compra de materiales para mejorar el local donde están los animales y si es posible agrandarlo un poquito más. Con esta inversión espera que su microempresa crezca más y se fortalezca, para poder atraer a más clientes y ofrecerles mejores productos. Todo esto ayudará a mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia. 

Karlet es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Unidos por un Desarrollo, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer  préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Karlet R. G. is a 21 year old young woman. She lives with her small child and her husband in the Hernández community located in Los Chiles in the Aljuela province. This community stands out for its mountainous regions with great scenery. It is very humid, and it is very close to the northern border of the country. It primary economic activities are livestock and farming. Specifically, they plant basic grains, tubers, and oranges. A little over six months ago Karlet started raising pigs to fatten. She sells her products to the neighbors in the community, and they are very satisfied with the quality of her products. She says that since she started her project she has felt very good because she has seen how her hard work, little by little, has made her business grow. Karlet is currently asking for a small loan for ¢ 670,000 (six hundred seventy thousand colones) to buy more pigs to fatten. She will also buy food and other materials to improve the location where the animals are, and, if possible, make it a little bigger. With this investment she expects her small business to grow more and become stronger in order to attract more customers and offer them better products. All of this will help improve living conditions for her and for her family. Karlet is a member of the United Community Credit Enterprise for Development, one of the 100 partner organizations affiliated with EDESA in Costa Rica. This is her first loan and she hopes to grow personally and financially. She would like to offer her thanks to these types of organizations and credit facilitators that enable her to devote more time to productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pigs to fatten

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Josè tienen 30 años de edad. Es casado y tiene 3 hijos menores de edad. Toda su familia vive en la casa de su suegra quien le proporcionò unos cuartos. Èl  se desempeña como operario de construccion hace 10 años. Se inicio en esta actividad desde muy joven. Su conyuge se dedica como trabajadora del hogar para apoyar en los gastos de la unidad familiar. José es una persona responsable y puntual en el trabajo. Actualmente está trabajando encofrando una casa muy cerca a su domicilio. Su esposa cuenta con experiencia en la venta de juguetes por campaña navideña.  Por ese motivo, se están financiando para capital de la venta de juguetes para aumentar sus ingresos durante esta temporada y mejorar la calidad de vida.

Josè tiene muchas metas y objetivos, uno de ellos es darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is 30 years old. He is married and has 3 minor children. His whole family lives in the house of his mother-in-law, who provides them with some rooms. He has worked as a laborer in construction for 10 years. He began this activity when he was very young. His wife works as a domestic worker to support the expenses of the family. Jose is a person who is responsible and punctual in his work. Currently, he is working putting up formwork (for pouring concrete) for a house very close to his home. José's wife has experience selling toys during the Christmas season. The couple has decided to use this loan for working capital in order to increase their income during this season and improve their quality of life. Jose has many goals and objectives; one of these is to give a better quality of life to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital for the sale of toys

loans.name: Francis

texts.es:
Francis J. M. es una joven señora de 21 años de edad la cual vive con su esposo en  una comunidad llamada Hernández localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa con grandes paisajes, presenta una gran humedad y además se encuentra sobre la carretera muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, tubérculos y  naranja.

Desde hace aproximadamente  seis meses que Francis se dedica a la cría de cerdo para engorde. Ella vende sus productos a los vecinos de la comunidad, quienes se muestran muy satisfechos por la calidad de estos. Comenta que desde que inició el proyecto se ha sentido muy feliz puesto que su negocio día con día crece.

Actualmente Francis está solicitando un microcrédito de ¢ 670,000 (seiscientos setenta mil colones)  para la compra de más cerdos para engorde, así como compra de alimento y otros insumos necesarios para este fin y compra de materiales para mejorar el local donde están los animales y si es posible. Con esta inversión espera que su microempresa se fortalezca y crezca más, para poder atraer a más clientes y ofrecerles mejores productos. Todo esto ayudará a mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia. 

Francis es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Unidos por un Desarrollo, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer  préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Francis J. M. is a young 21 year old woman who lives with her husband in Hernández, a community located in Los Chiles, in the province of Alajuela. This area stands out for being a mountainous area with great landscapes and a lot of humidity. It’s situated near the highway located near the northern border of the country. The primary economic activities are ranching and farming of primarily basic grains, tubers and oranges.

For the last six months, Francis has been raising pigs. She sells her products to community neighbors who seem to be very satisfied with the quality of the products. She mentions that since she started this project she has felt very happy since her business is growing every day.

Francis is requesting a loan of ¢ 670,000 colones to buy more pigs as well as to buy food and other supplies needed for this project as well as to buy materials to improve the animals’ shelter if possible. With this investment, she hopes her micro business will get stronger and grow more, attract more clients and offer them better products. All of this will help her quality of life and the quality of life of her family.

Francis is a member of “por un Desarrollo” Community Credit Enterprise, one of EDESA’s 100 member organizations in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan and she hopes to grow more at both a personal and an economic level. She also stresses that she is thankful for this organization and the way it facilitates loans so she can dedicate more time to productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Juana Alejandrina

texts.es: Juana tiene 67 años de edad, es casada y  vive en casa propia ubicado en el Distrito de la Tinguiña.  Su conyugue  se encuentra laborando como maestro de obra fuera de la ciudad donde le gira de manera semanal el monto de S/.150 para cubrir los gastos en la unidad familiar. Tienen 2 hijos mayores de edad los cuales cuentan con familia y apoyan a sus padres de manera economica. No cuenta con carga familiar. Posee casa propia de material de concreto con acumulacion de bienes.  La Sra. Juana  su mayor  esperanza es que sus hijos sean profesionales y tengan una mejor calidad de vida. Su actividad principal y de mayor rentabilidad es la venta de ropa solo para damas.Se incicio en este negocio mas de 20 años. Su primer punto de venta estaba ubicado en la calle Amazonas como ambulante.Debido al desalojo por la municipalidad fue reuvicada en la calle Lambayeque donde actualmente funciona su negocio.  Solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de mercaderia por campaña navideña para surtir su mercaderia  de ropa para damas.
texts.en:
Juana, 67, is married and lives in her own house in the Tinguiña district. Her spouse works as a construction site supervisor in another city; he sends her 150 soles per week to cover household expenses. They have two adult children who have their own families but they help out their parents economically. She does not have children to support. She owns her own concrete house with its equity. Juana's greatest wish is that her children become professionals and have a better quality of life. Her main and most profitable activity is selling womens' clothing. She started this line of work over 20 years ago. Her first point of sales location was a sales stand on Amazonas Street. The city evicted her from that location and relocated her to Lambayaque street where she currently operates. She requests financing to buy merchandise to stock up on womens' clothing for the Holiday shopping season.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up on womens' clothes for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es: Doña Consuelo A. S., Casada  de  cuarenta años de edad con tres hijos  su actividad principal es  comercio , que dicho negocio día a días crese pero la dificultad que se tiene actualmente que su capital es pequeño con ello no puede satisfacer la necesidad de sus cliente  por eso visita las oficina de asidr para solicitar un crédito que le servirá para surtir su mercadería con ello poder cubrir la demanda además se aproxima la fiesta de fin de año y con los ingresos que obtiene le permite mejorar su nivel de Vida.
texts.en:
Consuelo A. S., 40, is married and has three children. She is a merchant. Her business grows daily but she lacks sufficient funds to properly stock merchandise to meet the demand of her customers. This is the reason she has called upon Asdir to request financing to buy stock inventory so that she can meet customer demand during the approaching end-of-year holiday season and therby earn profits with which to improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital increase.

loans.name: Union Group

texts.es:
Bethzabe C. de 30 años es integrante del grupo Unión que  realiza sus reuniones cada dos semanas en el Centro Focal German Busch, ella conjuntamente con su esposo se dedican a la elaboración de muebles o mejor conocido como carpintería,  su esposo antes de casarse con ella, ya trabajaba en el taller de su padre, una vez que se ha independizado decidieron juntos poner el taller de carpintería y así han estado trabajando hace 4 años, tienen dos puntos de venta una ubicada en la 16 de Julio y otra en la zona Ballivián, ambos tienen las ganas de seguir con el negocio y mejorar por lo que necesitan el préstamo para comprar material como madera y clavos al por mayor.

Las demás integrantes del grupo tienen el negocio de venta de accesorios de celulares, plásticos, productos de belleza y antigüedades y necesitan el negocio para incrementar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Bethzabe C. is a member of the Union Group, which meets every two weeks at the German Busch Community Center. She and her husband work together to manufacture furniture. Her husband is known for his carpentry skills and worked in his father’s shop before they got married. As soon as they decided to work independently, Bethzabe and her husband opened their own woodworking shop and have now been in business for four years. They operate two vending locations, one in the July 16th district and the other in the Ballivián district. Both of them desire to continue and improve their business, so they need a loan to purchase materials in bulk such as wood and nails.

The other group members have businesses selling mobile phone accessories, plastics, beauty products, and antiques. They need a loan to increase their operating capital.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Kadiatou

texts.fr: Kadiatou N. est une femme de 47 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DIAOBE depuis 7 ans et y a acquière une bonne expérience en matière de crédit. Elle développe un petit commerce en vendant divers produits alimentaires au marché tels que de l'huile de palme, des légumes, de la pâte d'arachide etc. Elle soutien son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Kadiatou N., aged 47, is married and the mother of seven children. She has been a member of the village bank Diaobé for seven years and gained a good experience in the credit process. She develops her business at the market, where she sells various grocery products such as palm oil, vegetables, peanut butter, etc. She supports her husband with the family expenses.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Nadia Stephani

texts.es: Nadia tiene 21 años  de edad y es soltera. Vive en la casa de su abuela juntamente con sus hermanas. Su madre  viene temporalmente de la sierra. Sus padres son de la sierra. Nadia tiene una pequeña tienda surtida de abarrotes y verduras. Ella se inició en este negocio con apoyo de sus padres motivos por el cual las boletas de compra estan a nombre de la madre pero quien administra el negocio en Nadia. Ella es una persona responsable con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales.  Cuenta con metas y objetivos uno de ellos es realizar estudios Universitarios. Con el dinero que solicita desea adquirir y surtir su mercaderia de productos navideños.
texts.en:
Nadia, 21, is single. She and her sisters live in their grandmother's house. Her parents are mountain people and her mother comes down to visit occasionally. Nadia runs a small grocery and produce store. Her parents helped her set up this business so the purchase orders are in her mother's name. However, Nadia is who actually runs the business. She is a responsible person with very good personal and work references. She has goals and objectives, one of which is to finish university studies. With the requested financing she wants to stock up on Christmas merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy Christmas merchandise.

loans.name: Rosario Cristina

texts.es:
La Srta. Rosario Cristina Gonzáles C. tiene 31 años de edad vive con sus padres y con su hermana en Pueblo Joven Sr. De Los Milagros – Ica. 
Se dedica a la venta de periódicos y revistas hace 10 años aproximadamente en el horario de 7:00 am hasta las 3:00 pm ya que sus padres siempre se han dedicado a este negocio pero por motivos de salud tuvieron que dejarlo y ella continuó. También vende golosinas y gaseosas en su mismo kiosco  el cual queda ubicado fuera del mercado Toledo en la Av. Arenales Ica.
Este mercado es bien transitado y por eso le rinde diariamente lo cual le permite ayudar a sus padres quienes en la actualidad no trabajan.
Fueron afectados por el terremoto y solo a podido levantar su cuarto de adobe que es donde habita. 
La joven tiene buenas referencias de parte de los vecinos quienes manifiestan que es bien trabajadora y buena hija.
Está solicitando el apoyo para así poder invertir mas en su negocio; es decir, comprar revistas y todo lo relacionado a navidad pero también desea incrementar mas en la venta de golosinas y otros ya que es algo que le rinde y le ayuda a cubrir otras necesidades familiares.
texts.en:
Ms Rosario Cristina G. C. is 31 and lives with her parents and sister in Pueblo Joven Sr. De Los Milagros, in Ica. For approximately the past 10 years she has been selling newspapers and magazines between 7 am and 3 pm. Her parents had always been in this business but they had to stop because of health reasons but Rosario is continuing. She also sells candy and soft drinks in the same kiosk that is located outside the Toledo market on Arenales Avenue in Ica. This market has a lot of traffic and thus she does well every day, enabling her to help her parents who are currently not working. They were affected by the earthquake and have only been able to rebuild one room in their adobe house which is where she lives. Her neighbors give her good references saying that she is hard-working and a good daughter. She is asking for the help so that she can invest more in her business. That is, to buy magazines and Christmas items. She also wants to increase her sales of candy and other things since they sell well and help her cover the family’s expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of magazines and candy for her business

loans.name: Maria  Laura

texts.es: La Señorita Maria Laura T. Es originaria de la comunidad del paraje Chiyax un lugar muy visitado por persona nacionales e internacionales por su ubicacion geografica la vista panoramica de la ciudad procer de Totonicapan  de sus edificios  de su iglesia, ella manifiesta que su actividad lo aprendio de su querida madrecita cuando tenia trece años hasta la fecha sigue con este artes de la confeccion de delantales y cortes para damas necesita de un capital por las fietas de navidad y año nuevo para surtir su mercaderia.
texts.en:
Maria Laura T. lives in Chiyax, a very popular place that, because of its location, receives many visitors, both international and national, who come to enjoy its panoramic view of the great city of Totonicapan, its buildings, its church. She tells us that she learned her craft at the age of thirteen from her dear mother and continues with it to this day. She makes aprons and women's clothes. She needs financing to stock up on merchandise for the end-of-year festivities.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital increase.

loans.name: Ana Claudia

texts.es: Ana tiene 20 años de edad y es madre soltera de una hija de 2 años de edad. Vive en la casa de su madre quien la apoya economicamente en algunos gastos de su menor hija. La casa donde ella habita esta en recontruccion y comparte cuerto con su madre.  Ella es su ultima hija. Ana se dedica desde hace un año a la venta de ropa como recorredora. Sus principales clientes son amigos y vecinos del lugar donde vive. Se inició en este negocio con el apoyo de su madre. Ana tiene muchos objetivos y metas uno de ellos es poder crecer en su negocio. Es una joven muy responsable con buenas referencias personales y laborales. Con el dinero que solicita incrementará su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Ana, 20, is a single mother of a two-year-old daughter. She lives with her mother who helps out financially with some of her youngest daughter's expenses. The house they share is being rebuilt and she shares her mother's bedroom. She is the youngest daughter. For a year, Ana has sold clothes door-to-door. Her main customers are friends and acquaintances from her neighborhood. She started this business with help from her mother. Ana has many goals and objectives, one of which is to see her business grow. She is a very responsible young woman with good personal and work references. The financing requested will be used to increase her working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Juana Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Juana M. trabaja como docente desde hace veinte años, durante el cual ha logrado hacer mejoras a su vivienda, logro poner una pulpería que con ayuda de su esposo y ahorro comenzó, luego con prestamos en  Afoenic para incrementar el inventario y vender con la variedad de productos. Tiene 62 años y su esposo es guarda de seguridad, procreo tres hijos de los cuales trabajan y ayudan con los gastos básicos del hogar como: agua, luz, teléfono. Con este préstamo quiere comprar zinc y cambiar el viejo ya que en invierno se le pasa mucho el agua y desea mejorar esta necesidad en su casa, solo gracias al financiamiento de la institución ha logrado poder hacer todos estos logros por el plazo y sus bajos intereses que ha muchos hogares le ha cambiado para una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Juana M., 62, has been a teacher for 20 years. During this time she has managed to make improvements on her house. She set up a small, general store with which she helps her husband with household expenses and she began to have some savings. Then, with loans from Afodenic she managed to increase stock and sell a variety of products. Her husband is a security guard. They have three children who are employed and help pay household utilities. With this loan she wants to buy zinc metal sheeting to replace her roof because in Winter it leaks and she wants to improve this aspect of her house. It has been solely thanks to help from the institution that she has managed to meet her goals because the terms and interest rates are such that they have helped many homes change for the better.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy zinc metal sheeting to replace roof.

loans.name: Diana

texts.es: Diana es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora que lucha por sus sueños, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región de Ucayali, tiene 26 años, madre de dos hijos menores de edad, ella  tiene un taller de mecánica que funciona en su domicilio, su esposo trabaja allí y juntos estan saliendo adelante. Diana agradece al movimiento Manuela Ramos porque le permitió empezar un negocio propio y con el tiempo pudo tener un capital para poder poner su taller y arreglar su casa. Diana forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Lomas de Yarina” desde hace cinco años, el primer crédito que obtuvo fue de 300 soles, que fue para comprar golosinas y vender en la vereda de su casa. En la actualidad ella necesita un crédito de 1000 soles, que será utilizado para comprar herramientas para su taller. La meta de Diana es poder ampliar y dar mejoras en su negocio y aumentar su cartera de clientes.
texts.en:
Diana is an enterprising and hardworking woman who fights to fulfill her dreams. She lives in the District of Yarina Cocha, Ucayali region. Diana is 26 years old and the mother of two dependent children. She manages a welding shop out of her home. Her husband works there and together they strive to get ahead.

Diana thanks Manuela Ramos for helping her start her own business. She was provided capital that allowed her to remodel her house so that she could establish her shop. Five years ago, she joined the Communal Bank “Las Lomas de Yarina”. The first loan she received was in the amount of 300 soles and used to buy candy that she sold on the sidewalk in front of her house.

Today she is requesting a loan of 1000 soles to buy tools for her shop. Diana’s goal is to expand her business so that she improve her revenues and increase her customer base.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tools for her welding shop

loans.name: Hipolinaria

texts.es:
La señora Hipolinaria es socia del banco comunal “Las Brisas del Río Blanco” del distrito D. Pilcuyo, provincia D. El Collao; ella tiene 57 años D. edad, es casada,  tiene 06 hijos. Estudió secundaria incompleta. 
Hipolinaria trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 02 años; se dedica a la compra y venta D. animales menores y a la venta D. abarrotes.
Nos cuenta que con su primer préstamo que fue D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, invirtió en la compra D. 3 ovejas, las que vendió después D. engordarlas..
Ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, los cuales invertirá en comprar artefactos para luego vender.
Su visión hacia el futuro es, ser mayorista y generar mejores ganancias.
Lo que mas le gusta D. su Banco Comunal son los bajos intereses y el plan D. ahorro
texts.en:
Sra. Hipolinaria is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Brisas del Río Blanco” (The Breezes of Río Blanco), which is located in the District of Pilcuyo, El Collao District. She is 57 years old, married, and has 6 children. Hipolinaria did not finish her high school education.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 2 years. Hipolinaria buys and sells animals, as well as groceries. She says her first loan was in the amount of 500 soles and was used to buy 3 sheep for fattening. The animals were eventually sold.

Hipolinaria is now requesting a loan of 3000 soles to purchase appliances to sell at a later time. Her vision for the future is to become a wholesaler so that she can generate better earnings. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the low interest rates and her savings plan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase appliances to sell (radios, televisions, etc.)

loans.name: Marilú

texts.es: Marilú C. es una socia emprendedora y trabajadora, vive en el distrito de calleria región de Ucayali, tiene 38 años, madre soltera de un menor el cula es su motivo para seguir adellante con sus objetivos, ella se dedica al alquiler de cuartos y venta de desayuno. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Juntas hasta el final” desde hace cinco años, el primer préstamo que recibió fue de 300 soles, invirtió su crèdito para la venta de comida. En la actualidad Marilú necesita un crédito de 1000 soles, que será utilizado en la compra de madera para arreglar un cuarto el cual alquila. La meta de Marilú es tener una fuente de soda amplia para todos sus clientes.
texts.en:
Marilú C. is one of our enterprising and hardworking members who lives in the District of Calleria, Ucayali region. She is 38 years old and a single mother of a dependent child. Marilú is motivated to succeed in her objectives in order for her family to get ahead.

She manages rental rooms and sells breakfasts. Marilú joined the Communal Bank “Juntas hasta el Final” (Together until the End) five years ago. The first loan she received was in the amount of 300 soles and was used to buy food.

At the moment, Marilú is requesting a loan of 1000 soles to buy wood for remodeling one of her rental rooms. Her goal is to expand her business by adding a soda fountain for all of her customers to enjoy.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood to remodel a rental room

loans.name: Kouta
