texts.fr: Kouta C. est une femme de 42 ans elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 6 ans et demi et a 13 expériences avec le crédit. Avec son prêt elle fait de la transformation et vente de pâte d'arachide, cette activité lui procure des bénéfices qui lui permettent de participer à la prise en charge de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kouta C., aged 42, is married and the mother of four children. She has been a member of a village bank for six and a half years and received 13 loans. She will use her loan to produce and sell peanut butter. The profit from this activity will enable her to contribute to the family expenses.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her investment capital

loans.name: Florinda Juana

texts.es: Doña Juanita como es conocidad en su comunidad final de la zona palin  su actividad el la siembbra y crianza de animales, plantas medicinales, y flores lo viene realizando desde hace 15 años con ello se ha ganado la vida y la educacion de sus cuatro hijos, ya que ella es madre soltera hoy necesita de la ayudad de Asdir para un credito  para ampliar su negocio y aprovechar la época de navidad y año nuevo en la venta y compra de pollos, con los ingreso poder mejora su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Juanita, as she is known in her community of Palin, farms and raises animals, medicinal plants and flowers. She has been involved in this line of work for 15 years and has earned her livelihood and her children's education this way since she is a single mother. She needs Asidr's help in order to enlarge her business and take advantage of the Christmas and New Year's season selling chickens. With the earnings she will improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital increase.

loans.name: Leydis Lisbeth

texts.es: La joven Leydis U. tiene una pulpería  que desde hace un año administra con ayuda de su esposo la logro poner,  el vende queso de varios sabor, crema, el cual distribuye en las diferentes restaurantes del país, pulpería, y empresas han logrado vender al personal da al contado y al crédito. Su propósito es aumentar el inventario para obtener mejores ganancias, vendiendo una variedad de productos como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, jabón, pote de leche, lo que mas compra el cliente para el día. Tiene 24 años de edad, y con una bebe de 6 meses. Por casarse no  logro terminar su carrera lo cual espera entrar el año que viene para lograr una mejor estabilidad social y económica para dar a su hijita lo mejor. Lo cual espera lograr ya que por falta de dinero no termino y por su bebe que se le complico. Contenta con la institución por la oportunidad de aumentar su negocio lo cual traerá mejores ingreso y poder recoger para sus estudios.
texts.en:
Leydis U., 24, has run a small general store, that she was able to set up with help from her husband, for a year. He sells various kinds of cheese and cream which he distributes to different restaurants, grocery stores and employees of companies in the country; they sell for both cash and credit. Her goal is to increase stock with such things as rice, beans, sugar, oil, soap, milk, which are the items most sold on a daily basis, so that her profits will improve. She has a 6-month-old baby and, because she got married, was unable to finish her studies which she plans to restart next year in order to attain better social and economic stability so that she can give her daughter the best. She hopes to accomplish this since lack of funds and the arrival of her baby complicated things and she did not finish. She is happy with the institution for the opportunity to enlarge her business which will bring increased earnings and savings to earmark for her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, beans, oil to stock her store.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
La señora Flora es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Brisas del Río Blanco” del distrito de Pilcuyo, provincia de El Collao de la Región Puno, tiene 39 años de edad, es casada, tiene 03 hijos, los tres viven con ella porque son menores de edad. Estudió hasta tercero de secundaria, se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa usada como: casacas de cuero. Flora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 04 años.

Nos cuenta, que el primer préstamo que solicitó fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, en ese tiempo tenia una tienda de abarrotes e invirtió el dinero comprando productos para la tienda.  Ahora se dedica a la venta de ropa de segundo uso.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00  (Nuevos Soles, comprará mas fardos de casacas de cuero, los cuales venderá en Juliaca y Cuzco.
Su sueño para el futuro es abrir un restaurante pues sabe cocinar, y ver a sus hijos profesionales con trabajos seguros.
 
Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los préstamos ,porque sus intereses son bajos y también sus socias son amigables.
texts.en:
Flora is a member of the Las Brisas del Río Blanco Communal Bank in the Pilcuyo district, El Collao province, Puno region. She is 39, married, and has three children. The three children live with her because they are still minors. She attended school until the third year of high school. She buys and sells used clothes like leather jackets. Flora has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for four years. She tells us that the first loan she requested was for 300 PEN. At the time she had a grocery store, and she used the money to buy products for the store. Now she sells used clothes. She will use this loan for 3,000 PEN to buy more bundles of leather jackets, which she will sell in Juliaca and Cuzco. Her dream for the future is to open a restaurant; she knows how to cook. She also dreams of seeing her children become professionals with secure jobs. What she likes best about her communal bank are the loans because the interest is low. Also, the members are very friendly.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy leather jackets

loans.name: María Ricardina

texts.es:
María tiene 38 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos en el caserío El Romero, distrito de Mórrope, ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace dos años se dedica a la confección artesanal de alforjas (accesorio utilizado por los agricultores de la zona para cargar alimentos y utensilios durante las horas de trabajo) y manteles de hilo. Ella nos comenta que tuvo que empezar a trabajar en este negocio debido a que los ingresos que su esposo percibía como agricultor no bastaban para sostener la economía familiar.

María hace su trabajo en base a pedidos que llegan a hacerle los vecinos de su caserío y de caseríos aledaños. Elaborar una sola alforja le toma cerca de 20 días. Su negocio ha ido creciendo y ella desea ampliarlo pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para comprar los materiales que necesita, por este motivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de hilos, lanas y lanillas para lograr su objetivo.

Su más grande anhelo es seguir apoyando a la educación de sus hijos y verlos convertidos en excelentes profesionales. María es muy conocida por sus vecinos los que la consideran una mujer responsable, alegre y amable.
texts.en:
María, 38, is married and lives with her husband and three children in the El Romero settlement, Mórrope district, which is 45 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo. For the past two years she has crafted knapsacks (an accessory used by the local farmers to carry their lunch and eating utensils during their work periods) and woven tablecloths. She tells us that she had to start this line of work because the income her husband earned as a farmer was insufficient to meet the family's basic needs. María works based on orders she gets from her neighbors and from residents of adjacent settlements. To make a single knapsack takes her 20 days. Her business has been growing and she wants to expand it even more but lacks sufficient funds to buy the necessary supplies so she is requesting funds, for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa, in the form of a 1000 new sol loan, which will be used to buy thread, wool and flannel in order to reach her goal. Her greatest wish is to continue to provide for her children's education and see them become excellent professionals. María is very well-known by her neighbors who consider her to be a responsible, cheerful, and kind woman.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy thread, wool and flannel to make knapsacks.

loans.name: Guila

texts.es:
La señora  GUILA R. E., tiene  36 años, vive en el distrito de la BUENOS AIRES provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS II. Ella presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria, es conviviente y  tiene 3 hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella .La socia se dedica  a la venta de menús (alimento) en su domicilio.  Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró: arroz, papas, fideos, azúcar, aceite, pollo, etc. para la preparación de sus menús.
Con este crédito de 800.00 nuevos soles comprará platos, cubiertos, ollas, vasos, azúcar, fideos, papas, etc. para implementar mejor su negocio.
Guila sueña con tener su restaurante para lo cual esta ahorrando y trabajando arduamente.
texts.en:
Guila R. E. is 36 and lives in the Buenos Aires district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She belongs to the Mujeres Emprendedoras II Communal Bank. She attended school until the fifth year of high school. She is in a common law marriage, and she has three children who are still economically dependent upon her. She sells prepared meals from her home. She used her first loan for 300 PEN to buy rice, potatoes, noodles, sugar, oil, and chicken, etc. to prepare the meals. She will use this loan for 800 PEN to buy plates, cutlery, pots, glasses, sugar, noodles, and potatoes, etc. to better equip her business. Guila dreams of having a restaurant, which she is saving for and working arduously to have.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy plates, cutlery, pots, glasses, sugar, noodles, and potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Souadou

texts.fr: Souadou B. est une femme de 46 ans, elle est veuve et mère de 7 enfants dont elle a la charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DIAOBE où elle a fait de bonnes performances depuis 7 ans. Elle est vendeuse de fruits et de pâte d'arachide au grand marché hebdomadaire de sa localité. Ses bénéfices lui servent à assurer la nourriture, la santé et la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Souadou B., aged 46, is a widow and the mother of seven children for whom she cares. She is a member of the village bank Diaobé, in which she performed well for the past seven years. She sells fruit and peanut butter at the weekly great market of her town. The profit enables Souadou to provide food, health and schooling for her children.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her investment capital

loans.name: Trinidad Esperanza

texts.es:
Trinidad P. es una mujer dinámica y colaboradora, vive en el distrito de Calleria región de Ucayali, tiene 62 años de edad, es madre de 10 hijos, todos mayores de edad, se dedica a  la venta de prendas de vestir.  Paralelamente vende gaseosas, chupetes, hielo y todo esto lo realiza en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es motocarrista. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Divinas” desde hace seis años. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que le permitió invertir en la compra de insumos para venta de comida, negocio que tenía anteriormente. 
Actualmente ella necesita un crédito de 2000 soles que le permitirá invertir en prendas de vestir para luego venderlas. La meta de Trinidad es llegar a tener un local propio donde pueda exhibir sus productos.
texts.en:
Trinidad P. is a dynamic and collaborative woman. Se lives in the Calleria District, of the Ucayali region. She's 62 years old, mother of 10 children, all grown. She sells various clothing items. At the same time, she sells sodas, jackets, ice--everything is made in her home. She relies on her husband's support who is a motor car driver. They formed part of the Communal Bank "Las Divinas" (the divine ones) six years ago. The first loan she received was for 300 soles that allowed her to invest in the purchase of staples for selling food for a business she previously had. At the moment she needs a loan of 2000 soles that will let her invest in the clothing purchases to later sell. Trinidad's goal is to have an area of her own to exhibit her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for the purchase of clothing items

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Don Miguelito como es conocido en su comunida ser una persona lider de su comunidad de Pacho a quince Kilometros  del municipio de Totonicapan una comunidad muy abandonado por el gobierno los vecinos lucha para poder sobre salir para poder satisfacer la necesidad de su familias, como don miguelito, ve que el desarrollo trae grandes beneficios, el aprendio el arte de la capinteria cuando tenia diez años, como operario trabajo quince años el decidio iniciar su propio negocio hasta la fecha todo marcha muy bien el escucho un anuncio por una emisora locas que asdir da credito, el visita la oficina para dicho credito que le servira para la compra de madera,herramientas,clavos, pinturas, cola blanca.
texts.en:
Don Miguelito is known in his community as a leader of the Pacho community, fifteen kilometers from the municipality of Totonicapan, a community abandoned by the government snd the neighbors struggle to get ahead to satisfy the needs of their families. As don Miguelito realizes that development brings many benefits he learned the art of carpentry when he was ten. He worked as a worker for fifteen years and then decided to start his own business which is doing fine so far. He heard an anouncement on the local radio that Asdir provides loan, he visited the office and the loan will be spent on buying wood, tools, nails, paint, and glue.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Las Marianitas Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal “Las Marianitas” está formado por un grupo de 10 mujeres dinámicas y perseverantes, la mayoría vive en el distrito de Campo verde región de Ucayali, la presidenta, Lina del pilar C. G., es madre de tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de comida, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es docente pedagógico. Las socias que forman este Banco Comunal trabajan en diferentes labores como; venta de pescado, abarrotes, carnes, frutas, golosinas, verduras, bebidas, etc. Este Banco forma parte del Movimiento Manuela Ramos,  Credi-mujer desde hace cuatro meses, donde siempre han demostrado ser unas socias puntuales. En la actualidad este banco necesita un crédito de 4800 soles que será utilizado en los diferentes negocios en las que ellas se desempeñan. Este grupo está agradecido por la confianza que depositaron en ellas porque gracias a los préstamos ellas pueden invertir en sus negocios y salir adelante.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Las Marianitas” (the MaryAnns) is formed by a group of 10 dynamic and persevering women, the majority of whom live in the Campo Verde (Green Field) District of the Ucayali region. The President, Lina del Pilar C. G., is a mother of three children. She sells food and relies on the support of her husband who is a school teacher/docent. The members are part of the Communal Bank working in different fields; selling fish, groceries, meat, fruit, tidbits, vegetables, drinks, etc. This Bank is part of the Manuela Ramos Movement--for Women's Loans, formed four months ago, and the associates have been punctual in their payments. Presently, this Group needs a loan of 4800 soles that will be used in the different businesses in which the various members are employed. This group appreciates the confidence placed in them because thanks to these loans, they can invest in their businesses and move forward in their lives.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: use the loan for different businesses: selling fish, groceries, meat, fruit, tidbits, vegetables, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Adji Penda

texts.fr: Adji Penda DRAME est une femme de 33 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DIAOBE depuis 4 ans et y a eu une bonne expérience avec le crédit. Elle est vendeuse d'huile de palme, elle achète des barils de 200 litres et revend au détaille. Elle soutien son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Adji Penda Dramé, aged 33, is married and the mother of five children. She has been a member of the village bank Diaobé for four years, which gave her a good experience in the credit process. She sells palm oil, which she buys in 200-liter barrels and retails. She supports her husband with the family expenses.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her investment capital

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es: El señor Esteban M. es un hombre trabajador y responsable con su familia, su negocio es una pulpería que administra junto con su esposa desde hace varios años. Anteriormente trabajaba como mecánico pero tuvo un accidente en el pie el cual no puede ejercer bien ahora. Lo cual invirtió más en la pulpería para poder ayudar a su familia, dos hermosos hijos que tiene los cuales cursan sus estudios. Vive en el barrio Healeah, a mucho esfuerzo logro hacer su casa parte todavía es de zinc pero piensa cerrarla toda de concreto para mejor seguridad de su familia, por invertir en la venta que es su sustento no ha podido avanzar con su casa. Y como las ventas han estado bajas no ha podido recoger mucho dinero. Con este financiamiento comprara: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, golosinas, verduras y juegos artificiales por la temporada de navidad el cual se vende mucho aun que muy peligroso pero con cuidado lo cual espera mejorar las ventas y poder cumplir sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Mr. Esteban M. is a hard-working and responsible man, he has administered a grocery store together with his wife for several years. Prior he worked as a mechanic but he had an accident in his foot which did not allow him to continue and therefore he invested more in the grocery store to be able to help his family, two beautiful school-going children. He lives in the neighborhood Healeah. With a great effort he succeeded in building his house, part of which is still made of zinc, but he plans to finish building all in concrete for the security of his family. As he has invested in his business which provides his income, he has not moved forward with his house, and as sales have been poor he has not been able to save a lot of money. With this loan he will buy rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, candies, vegetables and firecrackers for the Christmas season as they are very popular even if very dangerous, but using them carefully he hopes to improve sales and be able to reach his goals.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, beans, sugar, candy, vegetables and firecrackers.

loans.name: Maria Consuelo

texts.es: La Señora Consuelo S. Es originario de la comunidad de Coxom del municipio de activida ella manifiesta  que cuando tenia quince años sus familiares lo llevaron ha Tapachula Mexico atender un negocio, trasncurrie el tiempo  ell contrae matrimonio  y regresa a su comunidad de origen ya conjuntamente con su esposo decide iniciar su propio negocio en la venta de productos Mexicanos ella solicita de un credito para la compra de mercaderia para surtir su negocio y aprovechar la época de frio en el municipio de Totonicapan
texts.en:
Mrs. Consuelo S. is from the community of Coxom. She tells us that when she was fifteen years old her relatives took her to Tapachula, Mexico to look after a business. Time goes by, she gets married and returns to her community of origin and together with her husband she decides to set up her own business selling Mexican products. She requests a loan to buy merchandise to supply her business and take advantage of the cold season in the municipality of Totonicapan.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase work capital.

loans.name: Digno Mateo

texts.es: Digno tiene 51 años de edad, es casado, y tiene 2 hijos de 16 y 11 años de edad. Estudian en colegio estatal muy cerca de su domicilio. Cuentan con casa propia de material noble el cual esta en mejoras. Digno se dedica como chofer de vehiculo pesado hace 10 años. Trabaja realizando transporte de fletes a la ciudad de Huancavelica. Cuentan con buenas referencias personales y laborales. Son una familia muy unida. Digno es una persona responsable en el trabajo y con su familia. Con el credito que solicita realizará  mejoras de su vivienda. Después del terremoto, ellos perdieron su casa y actualmente están construyendo de nuevo por partes, por motivos que no cuentan con el dinero total para la construcción de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Digno is 51 years old, married and has two children who are 16 and 11 years old. They study in the state school very close to their home. The family has their own home made of solid materials, on which they are making improvements. Digno has worked as a heavy vehicle driver for 10 years. He transports freight to the city of Huancavelica. He has good personal and work references. His family is very united. Digno is a responsible person, with his work and with his family. With the loan that he requests he will make improvements on his house. After the earthquake, his family lost their home. They are currently rebuilding their house little by little, since they don't have all of the money necessary to rebuild the house completely.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to make improvements on his house

loans.name: Gerald Jose

texts.es: El joven Gerald trabaja en un hospital privado en bodega hace dos años pero su ingresos son bajos a mucho esfuerzo se graduó en Administración de Empresa por las noche estudiaba. Tiene 25 años de edad, cuando era mas joven entro en grupo de danza el cual adquirió mucha experiencia y da clases lo cual son ingresos a su bolsillo poco a poco ahorro y puso una pequeña pulpería y parte librería para atraer a los clientes en la variedad, este negocio lo tiene en la casa de sus padres en donde vive hasta hoy, quien lo administra su mama. Su mama alquilas sillas plásticas para evento ambos se ayuda  para cada día salir adelante con el negocio. Con este préstamo quiere invertir en útiles escolares como: bolso, cuadernos, lapiceros y otros para tener surtido su venta. Como todo joven es tener compromiso y el mes de    Diciembre se casara, lo cual desea tener su propia casa es por eso espera que con esta inversión lograr mejores ganancias para ir ahorrando para construir ya que su mama le dio un terreno.
texts.en:
Young Gerald has been working in a private hospital in Bodega for the last two years, but his income is low. With a lot of effort and studying at night, he graduated in Business Administration. He is 25 years old. When he was younger he became part of a dance group, where he gained a lot of experience. He taught dance lessons, which provided him with an income. Little by little, he saved and opened a small grocery store and bookstore, to attract customers by offering variety. This business is located in his parents' house, where he lives up to this day, and is administered by his mother. His mother rents out plastic chairs for events. They help each other every day to continue with their businesses. With this loan, he wants to invest in school supplies such as bags, notebooks, pens and other assorted items. He's engaged and will be getting married in December, and for this reason wants to own his home. He hopes to achieve better earnings through this investment, so he can save up money to build his home, since his mother gave him a piece of land.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriela Urricariet, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase school supplies such as bags, notebooks, pens and other assorted items

loans.name: Flamboyan Group

texts.es:
L. UD. “Flamboyan” Ubicado en el Barrio San Sebastián Municipio D. Tecpatán Estado D. Chiapas, México. Integrada por 5 acreditadas. Dentro D. este grupo se encuentra L. señora Orfanel Pérez Sánchez, es originaria D. Tecpatán Mezcalapa Chiapas, dice: “tengo un nombre talvez no muy popular, pero me gusta, mis padres decidieron llamarme así en reposición D. una tía muy querida”. Tiene 38 años D. edad, solo estudió L. primaria, su esposo se llama Rigoberto Bautista Narváez y trabaja en una mueblería. Poseen 3 hijos quienes aun van a L. primaria del mismo municipio.

Orfanel Pérez Sánchez, se dedica a confeccionar ropa como son: pantalones, vestidos, faldas y blusas. DesD. hace 18 años, aprendió por medio D. unos cursos que le impartieron en su misma localidad. Hoy lo hace con gran orgullo por que ayuda a sostener a su familia económicamente.

Por no contar con las herramientas necesarias, ha dejado pasar muchos trabajos, así que, decidió ingresar a Fundaciòn Realidad para hacer un préstamo y mejorar su establecimiento. 

Ya cuenta con sus clientes, generalmente los D. las escuelas primarias y jardín D. niños y niñas, para estos, les fabrica sus uniformes escolares. Una experiencia muy bonita que tuvo fue cuando realizó los trajes D. una graduación D. L. escueL. secundaria donD. recibió muchos halagos.

El sueño mas granD. que tiene es D. tener un establecimiento con maquinas actualizadas que le permita imprimir logotipos para así dar el servicio completo.

Las otras 4 mujeres que a continuación se mencionan también tienen su negocio, a excepción D. L. señora MariceL. García A., quien iniciará L. venta D. frutas y legumbres. Ma Isabel González Nañez, tiene un establecimiento donD. venD. telas para fabricar ropa. Maria Leida López D. L. C., venD. órdenes D. comida casa por casa en su misma comunidad. Maria Magdai Vázquez González, se dedica  a bordar bolsas y tapetes para venderlos.
texts.en:
The communal bank, "Flamboyan," is located in the San Sebastián neighborhood in the city of Tecpatán in the state of Chiapas, México. There are 5 members in the group. Among them is señora Orfanel Pérez Sánchez, who is a native of Tecpatán Mezcalapa in Chiapas, who says, "I have a name that might not be very popular, but I like it. My parents decided to name me this after a very beloved aunt." She is 38 and only completed primary school. Her husband is named Rigoberto Bautista Narváez and works at a furniture store. They have 3 children who are all still in primary school in the same city. Orfanel Pérez Sánchez makes a living by making clothing like pants, dresses, skirts, and blouses. She has done this for 18 years and learned through some courses that she took in her area. Today she does this work with great priD. because it helps her sustain her family economically. Because she doesn't have the necessary tools, she has had to pass on a lot of work, so she decided to join Fundación Realidad to get a loan and improve her business. She already has customers, and generally she makes school uniforms for primary school and preschool students. She had a lovely experience when she maD. some suits for a high school graduation where she received a lot of praise. Her biggest dream is to have a business with updated machines that will let her make logos and offer complete service. The other 4 women who are mentioned next also have their own businesses, except for MariceL. García A., who will start selling fruits and vegetables. Maria Isabel Nañez has a business where she sells fabric to make clothing. Maria Leida López D. L. C. sells food from door to door in her community. Maria Magdai Vázquez González embroiders bags and tablecloths to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabrics to be able to make clothing like pants, dresses, skirts, and blouses to later sell.  Also to make school uniforms and to improve their businesses.

loans.name: Aura Estela

texts.es:
La señora Aura Estela R. tiene su propia pulpería la que se ubica en el departamento de Chinandega donde ofrece todo tipo de productos comestibles como pan, huevos, arroz, galletas, golosinas, entre otros. También vende productos de uso domestico como jabones, shampoo y ase.
Ella está solicitando el crédito porque necesita comprar los productos para la pulpería y es por este motivo que espera en que Ceprodel le brinde el crédito para adquirir dichos productos. Es importante destacar que ella ha sido fiel cliente de la institución habiendo pagado sus anteriores créditos satisfactoriamente.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aura Estela Rios has her own convenience store in the Chinandega Department where she sells all types of food such as eggs, rice, cookies, candies, and more. She also sells household products such as soaps, and shampoo. She is asking for a loan because she needs to buy products for the store. She is hoping that Ceprodel will offer her the loan for these products. It’s important to emphasize that she has been a loyal client of the institution since she has paid her previous loans satisfactorily. .

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products for her convenience store

loans.name: Esperanza María

texts.es:
La señora Esperanza O. se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajadora y por tener su propio negocio de venta de recordatorios y adornos ofrecidos en su establecimiento en el departamento de Chinandega donde es visitada por clientes que compran los recordatorios.
Es de suma importancia destacar que ella comenzó este negocio con el apoyo de sus padres aportándole para su inversión inicial y hoy lo ha desarrollado cabalmente gracias a sus esfuerzos.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de los recordatorios y adornos y de esta manera continuar ofertándolos en su establecimiento.
texts.en:
Sra. Esperanza O. is known for being a very hard worker. She has a business selling souvenirs and ornaments from her store in the department of Chinandenga. Her customers visit her whenever they want to buy mementos.

It is important to note that Esperanza started her business with the help of her parents, who provided the initial investment. Today her business is now fully developed thanks to all of her efforts. She is requesting a loan to purchase more souvenirs and ornaments to offer from her store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase souvenirs and ornaments

loans.name: Elvis Axamir

texts.es: El señor Elvis L. trabaja como cadete de un taxi que es propio el cual desde hace cinco años lo trabaja, anteriormente tenia un negocio de venta de sorbete, también trabajaba como cargador en una bodega, con ahorros y ayuda de sus hermanos logro comprar el vehiculo. Ya que dos de sus hermanos están en los Estados de América el cual con remesas logro recoger y ponerse a trabajar. Como todo trabajo la clientela ha bajado, debido al desempleo en nuestro país, pero hay día buenos y también hay que recorrer varios kilómetros para poder hallar cliente. Tiene 36 años de edad, con tres hijos los cuales estudian para un mejor futuro. Su esposa vende ropa, cosmético el cual lo apoyo con los gastos básicos del hogar como: agua, luz, teléfono entre otros gastos de los niños. Con este financiamiento quiere dar mantenimiento al vehiculo, comprar llantas, pintura y enderezado en la parte de atrás que tiene malo el taxi para poder dar un mejor servicio de carrera al cliente. Contento por l aprobación del crédito el cual será para bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Elvis L. works as a taxi driver, with his own taxi. He has had this business for five years. Previously, he had an ice cream business and also worked as a stock clerk in a small shop. With his savings and the help of his brothers, he managed to buy his vehicle. Two of his brothers are in the U.S., and sent money to help him start his business.

Now, the number of customers is down as in all businesses, due to the unemployment problem in the country. Still, there are good days, though he often has to drive farther to find customers.

Elvis is 36 years old, with three children who are studying for a better future. His wife sells clothes and cosmetics, which helps with household expenses like water, electricity, telephone, and expenses for the children.

This loan will go toward maintenance of the taxi: tires, paint, and body repair in the back. This will give better service to the customers. Elvis is happy he was approved for this loan which will help the well being of his family.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tires, body repair, and paint for taxi

loans.name: Ivania De La Cruz

texts.es:
La señora Ivania de la Cruz Martínez muy esforzadamente se dedica a atender su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa tales como ropa interior, calcetines y toallas para baño siendo ofrecidos estos productos en su localidad en el mercado El Bisne de Chinandega donde no cuenta con un buen local porque dicho local está a la intemperie pero esto no le impide de que se siga esforzando cada día más.
Solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de mercadería como lo es la ropa y para esto espera que su solicitud sea aprobada y así continuar luchando por mejorar las condiciones de su negocio y por ende las condiciones de su hogar.
texts.en:
Sra. Ivania de la Cruz Martínez works very hard managing her small clothing business. She sells undergarments, socks, and bath towels from her vending location at El Bisne Market in Chinandenga. Her post is not in a good space because it is out in the open, but that does not stop her from working hard each day.

Ivania is requesting a loan to purchase more merchandise. She hopes that her loan will be approved so that she can continue fighting to improve the conditions of her business. As a result, her living conditions will also improve.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Jose Pedro

texts.es: Don chepito como lo conocen en su comunidad el es originario del cantón Chotacaj su actividad principal es maestro de educacion primaria en la escuela oficial del canton Juchanep el necesita del apoyo de la institucion para un credito que le servira para la remodelacion de su vivienda con el unico objetivo de mejora la calidad de vida de sus hijos
texts.en:
Don Chepito is originally from the district of Chotacaj and is known in his community. He is an elementary school teacher in the district of Juchanep. He needs the assistance of the Institution and is requesting a loan for a home remodeling project. His sole objective is to improve the quality of life for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for remodeling his house

loans.name: Juana Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Juana M. es propietaria de su propio negocio de venta de cristalería como son platos, vasos, picheles, cafeteras, entre otros.  El negocio lo posee desde hace doce años habiéndose dedicado directamente a este ya que por medio de sus ventas genera los ingresos para el mantenimiento de su hogar.
Ella actualmente está solicitando su crédito para la compra de los electrodomésticos y así continuar ofreciéndolos en su localidad en el departamento de Chinandega.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana Martinez owns a business selling glassware such as plates, drinking glasses, pitchers, coffee pots, and other items. She has been devoted to her business for twelve years. The sales she generates enables her to maintain her household.

Juana is now requesting a loan in order to buy household appliances to offer from her store in the department of Chinandega.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase household appliances to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase cosmetics and calendars to sell

loans.name: Juana Antonia

texts.es:
En el departamento de Chinandega, la señora Juana N. dedica su tiempo a la actividad de venta de ropa la que es comercializada por ella misma con mucho entusiasmo para continuar llevando el sustento a su casa de habitación que tanto necesita de ella.
Solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de la mercadería a sus proveedores la que adquiere ropa para damas, caballeros y niños. Es de importancia destacar que por ser viuda, sus esfuerzos son dobles en el negocio y por esta razón requiere a lo inmediato del crédito para continuar la venta de ropa en su localidad.
texts.en:
In the department of Chinandenga, Juana N. sells clothes as a means of sustaining her household. She is requesting a loan so that she can acquire more merchandise from her suppliers. Juana will buy clothing for men, women, and children. It is important to note that she is a widow, so she invests twice as much as effort into her business. She needs immediate access to this loan so that she can continue selling clothes from her vending post.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire more merchandise

loans.name: Jesus Miguel

texts.es: Don Jesús Miguel es originario de la zona 4 del municipio de Totonicapan su principal actividad es la artesania en la elaboracion de sandalias para damas dicho oficio lo aprendio  de su querido padre hace mas de veinte años hoy se ve la necesida de remodelar un pequeño taller ya que ha planificado ampliar su taller para el dos mil diez, la cual necesita de mayor espacio para poder contar con tres operario con ello aumenta su produccion y mejor su nivel de vida y la de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Don Jesús Miguel is originally from District 4 of the town of Totonicapan. He is a craftsman who manufactures women’s sandals. He learned this trade more than 20 years ago from his beloved father. He needs to remodel and enlarge his small workshop, and hopes to have the project completed by 2010. Jesús Miguel needs the additional space to make room for three more workers so that he can increase production and provide a better standard of living for his entire family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to expand his workshop

loans.name: Migdalia Argentina

texts.es: Doña Migdalia M. trabaja como costurera y hace cajeta para obtener ingresos desde hace 17 años apoya a su esposo con los gastos básicos como: agua, luz y otros gastos, procreo cinco hijos  tres trabajan y dos estudian para poder tener un futuro mejor. Tiene 43 años de edad, su esposo trabaja en la mecánica, en los últimos meses las costura ha estado baja se ha estado ayudando mas con la venta de cajeta. Desde joven aprendió las costura el cual apoyaba a su mama, luego se caso y lo ha venido ejerciendo ya que comenzó a tener mucha clientela para esta época de navidad  tiene mucho trabajo ya que por promociones las mama dan hacer sus trajes elegantes. Con este préstamo comprara tela, bordados, hilos para sus trabajos de costura a si como azúcar, canela y mucha leche para hacer la rica cajeta que dia a día se vende. Contenta con la institución por apoyar el pequeño comercio.
texts.en:
Doña Migdalia M. has worked as a seamstress for 17 years. In addition, she makes and sells caramel syrup as a way of helping her husband with basic expenses such as water, electricity, etc. They have five children, three of them work while the other two are studying for a better future. Doña Migdalia is 43 years old and her husband works as a mechanic. In recent months, her sewing business has been slow so she has been supplementing her income by selling caramel syrup. She learned how to sew as a young girl by working as her mother’s assistant. When she got married, Doña Migdalia continued to engage in sewing.

Her sewing business is starting to pick up again because of the Christmas season and also many mothers want to buy dress clothes for their children’s school promotion ceremonies. With his loan, Doña Migdalia will buy fabric, lace, and thread for making clothes. In addition, she will buy sugar, cinnamon, and plenty of milk for making caramel syrup that she can sell every day. She is happy to have the support of the Institution behind her small business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sewing materials & ingredients for making caramel syrup

loans.name: Alberto Alonso

texts.es: Don Alberto trabaja como cadete de un taxi  que tiene desde hace cinco años, anteriormente solo trabajaba en soldadura tiene 22 años trabajando en este ramo ya que abecés le da más ganancia que el taxi por que las carreras están malas y solo los día de pago le queda mucha ganancias. Ya que los usuarios optan más por la ruta por el bajo costo del pasaje debido que muchas gente esta sin trabajo, los salarios son bajos y la economía afectado mucho al país. Don Alberto tiene 49 años de edad, vive junto con su esposa e hijos. Sus planes ha sido terminar su casa toda de concreto contento por que a muchos esfuerzo con sus dos trabajo lo ha logrado el cual ya bonita. Con este préstamo quiere comprar las ventanas y puertas para poder cerrarla por completo y poder gozar de su nueva casa. A agradece a la institución por el apoyo de lograr  una vivienda digna para su familia.
texts.en:
Don Alberto has worked as a taxi driver for five years. Previously he had only worked in welding, which he has done for 22 years, but sometimes this provides him greater earnings than the taxi, because the roads are bad. Also, many people opt for the bus route because of the low cost. Due to the fact that many people are unemployed, salaries are low and the economy has greatly affected the country. Don Alberto is 49 years old and lives together with his wife and children. His plans are to finish his house with concrete, and he is content because through a lot of effort with his two jobs, he has managed to make it look really nice already. With this loan he wants to purchase windows and doors to be able to completely seal it and enjoy his new house. He is grateful to this institution for the support in attaining a decent home for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase doors and windows to finish his house

loans.name: Angelica Maria

texts.es: La señora Angélica Pérez mujer trabajadora y esforzada, desde joven estudio para docente el cual lo ejerce con doce años de experiencia a los jóvenes de primaria. Anteriormente trabajo en estudio fotográfico, es madre soltera de una hija de 8 años de edad, estudia, y la instruye mucho en los estudios. Su casa es sencilla de madera y zinc, lo que mas desea es poder hacerla toda de concreto para mejor seguridad. Con el préstamo anterior compra parte de los materiales como: piedra y hierro pero no le alcanzo es por eso quiere con este financiamiento comprara el resto de materiales para comenzar a construir su pequeña casa, para esto comprara arena, cemento, zinc y otros para hacer la obra y pode gozar de un techo digno y bonito. Contenta por la oportunidad del plazo del préstamo ya que solo mediante el financiamiento ha logrado estas mejoras en su vida ya que su salario es bajo y no le ha permitido poder hacerla.
texts.en:
Señora Angélica Pérez is a very hardworking and disciplined woman who has studied to be a teacher since she was young. She now has 2 years experience teaching primary school; previously she worked in a photographic studio. She is a single mother of an 8 year-old daughter. Her daughter is in school, and she helps her with her studies. Her house is made of simple wood and zinc, and what she most desires is to be able to make it entirely of concrete for better security. With the previous loan she bought some of the materials, including stone and iron, but not enough to complete the work. For this reason she wants this loan to buy the rest of the materials so that she can begin to build her small house. She will buy sand, cement, zinc and other materials to do the work so that she can enjoy a decent and attractive home. She is happy to have this opportunity for a short term loan, since her salary is low and she would not otherwise be able to make these improvements in her home and in her life.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: she will buy sand, cement, zinc and other materials to build her house

loans.name: Gioconda Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Gioconda se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y prendas de plata en horarios libres ya que trabaja como conserje  desde hace cinco años, por gracias  a Dios tiene un trabajo fijo. Ya que abecés los clientes que le da crédito le atrasan su dinero y tiene que cumplir con sus gastos personales y gastos básicos. Tiene 38 años, procreo cuatro hijos, tres de los cuales trabajan dos en servicios domésticos y uno como ayudante de mecánica, el de 17 años es el único que estudia debido a que no cuenta con los recursos económicos para ayudar a sus hijos en la educación ya que es madre soltera y a mucho esfuerzo ha logrado salir adelante. Su casa es mitad piedra y el resto de zinc el cual espera poder terminarla ahora que sus hijas trabajan ya que todo esta caro para la construcción y su salario es bajo y con las ganancias de sus ventas cubre las necesidades personales. Con este préstamo comprara muchos cosméticos y prendas variada para la temporada de navidad ya que sus cliente le encargan mucho para hacer los regalos de amigo secreto que las mayoría juegan en las empresas. Da las gracias a la institución por el préstamo ya que se beneficiara para aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
Señora Gioconda sells cosmetics and silver jewellery in her free time and has worked as a receptionist for five years. She thanks God that she has a steady job because sometimes clients that have credits are late paying back their money and she has to pay for her personal and basic expenses. She is 38 and has 4 children. Three of them work, 2 in domestic services and one as a mechanic's assistant. Her 17-year-old is the only one that is in school because she doesn't have the economic resources to help her children with their education since she is a single mother and has worked very hard to get ahead. Her house is half stone, and the rest is metal. She hopes to be able to finish it now that her children are working since everything in construction is expensive and her salary is low. She covers her personal needs with the profits from her sales. With this loan, she will buy a lot of cosmetics and various jewellery for the Christmas season since her clientele orders a lot from her to give Secret Santa gifts, which is done at most of their companies. She is thankful to the institution for this loan because it will benefit her so she can expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and various silver jewellery

loans.name: Maroum

texts.fr: Maroum KEBE est une femme de 28 ans elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 3 ans et demi et a eu 7 expériences avec le crédit. Elle fait de la transformation et vente de pâte d'arachide, cette activité lui donne des bénéfices qui lui permettent de prendre en charge sa famille.
texts.en:
Maroum Kébé, aged 28, is married and the mother of three children. She has been a member of a village bank for three and a half years and received seven loans. She produces and sells peanut butter. The profit from this activity enables her to provide for her family.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her investment capital

loans.name: Aura Irma

texts.es: Doña Aura  Es originaria  del paraje final de la zona 4 del municipio de Tonic ella es casada con dos hijo su principal fuente de ingreso es la venta de ropa los dias martes y sabado en el corredor del mercado municipal de Totonicapan. dicho negocio se lo regalo su querida madre hoy necesita de un credito para surtir su mercaderia princilamente, gorras, chalinas esclusivo para la época de frio del municipio de Totonicapán
texts.en:
Doña Aura is a native of zone 4 in the city of Tonic. She is married with two children, and her principal source of income is selling clothing on Tuesdays and Saturdays in the Totonicapán city market. Her beloved mother gave her this business. Today she needs a credit to stock her merchandise, mainly hats and scarves exclusively for the cold season in the city of Totonicapán.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand her capital

loans.name: Rosa Ivania

texts.es: La señora Rosa L. mujer que se dedica ala venta de ropa, cosméticos trabaja con catálogos de la Avon, ropa variada para dama, caballeros, niños mucho de ello por encargo. Lleva siete años en este negocio que lo inicio con dinero que su esposo dio, comenzó trabajando con poquito pero luego con préstamo el cual compro mas lo que le ha generado mejores ganancias lo que espera en un futuro tener una tienda con muchas variedades de productos en su propia casa. Tiene 40 años de edad, vive en Laureles Norte, su esposo trabaja como conductor y con dos hermosos hijos mayores. Con este financiamiento  comprara pantalones de hombres y mujeres, vestidos, faldas, camisa también perfúmenes, cremas, pinturas, y muchos más para mejorar las ventas.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa L. is a woman who makes a living by selling clothing and cosmetics. She works with Avon catalogs and sells various clothing for women, men, and children, much of which she does by taking orders. She has had this business for 7 years and started it with money that her husband gave her. She started working with little but later on she bought more through a loan, which has generated better profits for her. What she hopes for in the future is to have a store with a lot of variety of products in her own home. She is 40 and lives in Laureles Norte. Her husband works as a driver, and they have 2 beautiful older children. With this financing, she will buy men's and women's pants, dresses, skirts, shirts, perfumes, creams, makeup, and much more to improve her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing like pants, dresses, skirts, perfume, creams, and other products

loans.name: Yessenia Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Yessenia Solórzano tiene un pequeño negocio en el mercado Mayoreo uno de los mercados bien visitados. Vende productos ferreteros desde hace doce años, que junto con su esposo venden,   inicio con pequeños préstamos su venta. Tiene 32 años  de edad, vive en el barrio Laureles Norte junto a sus tres hijos los cuales están estudiando. Sus planes es poder seguir mejorando su casa ya que quisiera embaldosar el piso por que es de tierra para mejor higiene y mejor comodidad para su familia. Con este préstamo invertirá en la compara CD, dvd y productos ferreteros para elevar el volumen de las ventas. Contenta por el apoyo del financiamiento por que gracias a estos préstamo eleva su inventario.
texts.en:
Señora Yessenia Solórzano has a small business at the Mayoreo market, which is one of the most frequented markets. She has sold hardware for 12 years along with her husband. She started selling with small loans. She is 32 and lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood with her three children who are in school. Her plans are to be able to continue improving her home since she would like to tile her dirt floor so it will be more hygenic and more comfortable for her family. With this loan, she will invest in the purchase of CDs, DVDs, and hardware to increase her sales volume. She is happy for this financial support and is thankful for this loan that will let her increase her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase CDs and DVDs to vary her sales and to sell hardware

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Luis Antonio L. Urbina ha trabajado con Ceprodel durante seis años y en ese lapso ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda con los 8 créditos que ha trabajado con Ceprodel.

El crédito solicitado es para  Mejoramiento de vivienda cambio de techo, con el fin de darle un mejor estilo de vida a su Familia.
texts.en:
Señor Luis Antonio L. Urbina has worked with Ceprodel for 6 years, and during this time, he has managed to improve his living conditions with the 8 credits that he has had with them. This credit that he is requesting will go towards improving his home by replacing its roof, with the goal of giving a better lifestyle to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Grupo Los Paisanos Group

texts.es: El grupo los paisanos con de la comunidad de Chimente San Jose a 42 kilometros de municipio de Totonicapan una comunidad muy pobre en donde los gobiernos   ha abandonado a dicha comunidad dicho grupo se dedica ha la venta de ropa  en los mercados municipales de Patzite y Santa Cruz del Quiche ellos manifiesta que ha querido siempre un credito por ser personas muy pobres no tiene acceso a los bancos, hoy necesitamos del credito para poder mejor su nivel de vida y las de sus hijos con el credito poder surtir su mercaderia para poder cumplir la demanda de sus clientes
texts.en:
The "Los Paisanos" (The Compatriots) group is from the Chimente San Jose community which is 42 kilometers from the city of Totonicapan. This is a very poor community that has been abandoned by the different governments. The group sells clothing in the municipal markets of Patzite and Santa Cruz del Quiche. They state that they have always wanted financing because they are very poor people with no access to banks. They need the financing to improve their quality of life and that of their children. With the funds they intend to stock up on merchandise so that they can meet the requests of their customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital increase.

loans.name: Claudia De Los Angeles

texts.es:
La Señora Claudia de los Ángeles G.  ha trabajado con Ceprodel durante 2 años y en ese lapso ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda con los 2 créditos que ha trabajado con Ceprodel.

El crédito solicitado es para  Mejoramiento de vivienda construcción de habitación en el hogar, con el fin de darle un mejor estilo de vida a su Familia.
texts.en:
. Claudia de los Ángeles G. has worked with Ceprodel for the last two years. During that time she has managed to improve the conditions of her dwelling with two loans that she has negotiated with Ceprodel. The funds requested now are to improve her house by building an additional bedroom in order to improve her family's living condition.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To enlarge and improve her dwelling.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
Dominga tiene 44 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a su madre y dos hermanos en el caserío Hornitos, distrito de Mórrope, ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Durante casi tosa su vida se ha dedicado a criar animales en casa de su madre y desde hace tres años empezó a comercializarlos en la ciudad de Chiclayo. Ella cría pavos, patos, cuyes y carneros. Usualmente viaja dos veces por semana a la ciudad para ofrecerlos en venta. 

Dominga nos cuenta que la demanda por los animales que ofrece ha ido creciendo pero que los animales que posee no son suficientes por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por pirmera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para invertirlos en la compra de animales para ampliar su negocio y satisfacer a sus clientes.

Su más grande anhelo es hacer crecer su negocio y con las ganancias que obtenga darle a su madre una mejor calidad de vida. Ella es una mujer alegre, responsable y muy entregada a su familia y a su trabajo.
texts.en:
Dominga, 44, is single and lives with her mother and two brothers in the Hornitos settlement, Mórrope district, which is 45 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo. During most of her life she has raised small farm animals in her mother's house and three years ago began to sell them in the city of Chiclayo. She raises turkeys, ducks, guinea pigs, and mutton. She usually travels to the city twice a week to sell them. Dominga tells us that demand for her animals has been growing but that she does not have enough animals to meet it. For this reason she has called upon Edpyme Alternativa for the first time asking for a 1000 new sol loan to buy more animals so that her business will expand and she can meet her customers' demand. Her greatest wish is to see her business grow and to use her profits to be able to give her mother a better quality of life. She is a cheerful, responsible woman who is very dedicated to her family and to her work.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy animals to sell.

loans.name: María Olinda

texts.es:
María tiene 27 años de edad, es madre soltera, y vive junto a su hijo de dos años de edad y una tía en el anexo Los Alamos, en el caserío La Colorada, distrito de Mórrope, ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

La necesidad por mantener a su hijo hizo que empezara a comercializar animales. Usualmente va a venderlos dos veces por semana a la ciudad de Chiclayo. Eventualmente también los vende a los negociantes que frecuentan la zona.

Ella desea ampliar su negocio, nos cuenta que algunos  vecinos le han ofrecido animales en venta y quiere comprarlos para negociarlos  pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción, por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Su más grande anhelo es seguir trabajando para salir adelante y sacar adelante a su hijo. Ella es una madre luchadora y que dia a dia da todo de sí para lograr sus metas. En la fotografía aparece junto a un caballo que pronto ofrecerá en venta.
texts.en:
María is 27, is a single mother, and lives with her 2-year-old son and her aunt in Los Alamos in a town called La Colorada in the district of Mórrope, which is located 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. The need to support her son made her start selling animals. Usually she goes to sell them twice a week in the city of Chiclayo. She also sometimes sells to businesspeople who frequent the area. She hopes to expand her business. She tells us that some neighbors have offered to sell her animals, and she wants to buy them, but she doesn't have enough capital to do this. This is why she thinks it's necessary to request her first loan for 1000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa. Her biggest wish is to keep working to get ahead and to take good care of her son. She is a hard-working mother who gives all of herself day after day to accomplish her goals. In the picture she appears with a horse that she will soon offer for sale.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy animals to sell

loans.name: César Carlos

texts.es:
César es un padre de familia de 49 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos en el sector San Martín de la ciudad de Lambayeque, ubicada a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace cuatro años de dedica a la carpintería. Nos comenta que aprendió este oficio de un amigo. Usualmente trabaja en base a pedidos aunque también trabaja independientemente en algunas ocasiones. Esta actividad es el único ingreso con el que sustenta a su familia por lo que siempre da todo de si para sacar su negocio adelante

César nos comenta que desea ampliar su negocio con la venta de mesas y sillas, pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para comprar la madera que necesita para elaborarlas, por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad se solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Su sueño es seguir haciendo crecer a su negocio para terminar de construir su casa y brindarle una mejor educación a sus hijos. El ya ha trabajado con nuestra Institución anteriormente y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos por lo que es considerado un cliente excelente.
texts.en:
César is a 49-year-old father who lives with his wife and two children in the San Martín neighborhood in the city of Lambayeque, which is located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For four years now César has made a living as a carpenter. He tells us that he learned this trade from a friend of his. He usually works on a custom-order basis, though he also makes furniture independently on occasion. This activity is his only source of income and is how he supports his family, and that is why he does everything he can in order for his business to get ahead. César tells us that he wants to expand his business by selling tables and chairs, but he does not have enough capital to purchase the wood that he needs to make them. That is why he has asked Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 soles. César’s dream is to keep growing his business so that he can finish construction on his house and provide his children with a better education. He has already worked with this lending institution before—he demonstrated punctuality and responsibility in making his payments, and for that reason is considered an excellent client.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing wood for making and selling chairs and tables

loans.name: Jhony Heriberto

texts.es:
Jhony tiene 38 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos en el sector El Capote, ubicado en el distrito de Picsi, a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 20 años trabaja como maestro de ceremonias de una orquesta de la ciudad de Ferreñafe los fines de semana, pero como los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad no son suficientes para mantener a su familia, se dedica durante la semana a trabajar como obreroh en los fundos de la zona, donde ejecuta labores agrícolas y de albañilería.

Jhony se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de calaminas para techar su casa, ya que las contínuas lluvias que se presentaron el año pasado dejaron debilitado su actual techo y este no resisitiría las lluvias de este verano.

Jhony es un padre de familia responsable, es muy alegre y servicial. Su más grande anhelo es poder brindarle a sus hijos las oportunidad de estudiar una carrera con la que se ganen la vida en el futuro. En la fotografía aparece junto a un pozo que está excavando en un fundo de la zona.
texts.en:
Jhony, 38, is married and lives with his wife and two sons in the El Capote sector, Picsi district, which is 30 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo. For the past 20 years he has worked weekends as the master of ceremonies for an orchestra in the city of Ferreñafe. But, since income from this activity is not sufficient to support his family, during the week he works as a hired hand at local estates doing general farming and masonry chores. Jhony is requesting help from Edpyme Alternativa for the first time. He needs 1000 new soles to buy metal sheeting to build a roof for his house because the continuous rains of last year greatly weakened his present roof and it will not stand up to the rains this Summer. Jhony is a responsible, very cheerful and helpful father. His greatest wish is to be able to see that his children can go to school and study a career with which they can support themselves in the future. In the photo he appears next to a well he's digging on a local estate.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy metal sheeting to build a roof.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita A. is from the village of Camarahan, Pagatpat Cagayan De Oro City. She is 50 years old. Lolita is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Lolita operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 3,500 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lolita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Lolita from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Camarahan, Pagatpat, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Orien

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario S. is from the village of Balanlinao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old. Rosario is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Rosario owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Rosario has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosario joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosario is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers and feed. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rosario from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and feed

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada C. is from the village of San Isidro, Talakag Bukidnon. She is 51 years old. Diosdada is separated from spouse and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Diosdada owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products in the local community. Diosdada has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Diosdada joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Diosdada successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Diosdada is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Diosdada from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products to sell

loans.name: Chhang

texts.en:
Chhang K., 40, is married with three children. She resides in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, with her husband and children. To make a living, she runs a business selling various kinds of groceries, earning an income of US $4 per day. Her husband always helps his wife in the business every day. Also, he sells rice, earning an income of US $4.5 per day.

K. and her husband are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, K. is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase more rice for resale. She hopes that she will be able to make more profit when she retails the rice back to her customers. This is her second loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner.

loans.use: To buy rice for resale

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia G. is active and has good leadership as member of ASHI (Ahon SA Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines. She is 36 years old and the mother of two children, both of whom are high school students. She is married to Leonard G., a 37-year-old jeepney driver.

Cecilia joined ASHI 2004 and she is grateful having ASHI-KIVA as a partner in her life. Cecilia began selling goods little by little, and used whatever money she made to buy more items to sell. She is now on her seventh loan, which she plans to use to purchase grains amounting to Php 20,000.00 and sacks worth Php 350.00 for storing goods.

Cecilia's main goal is to save for the future of her children and send them to school until they finish college and find stable jobs. She is also working hard on the success of her business. She is looking forward to having space in the local market, which would give her easier access to customers. She also wants to buy a utility jeep for the transport of goods for her business so she can easily gain more income, and she also wants to have her own rice milling business some day.

loans.use: To purchase grains and 50 sacks for storing it

loans.name: Sea

texts.en:
Sea K., 47, is a widow with two school-aged children. She resides in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, with her parents and children. To make a living, she runs a business of selling Cambodian traditional foods made from fish. This kind of food can be kept for a very long time over the year. She is able to earn an income of US $5.9 per day.

K. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, K. is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase more traditional food to expand her business. She hopes that she will be able to make more profit when she retails the food to her customers. This is her second loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner.

loans.use: To buy more food for resale

loans.name: Horng

texts.en:
Horng S., 44, is married with four children. She resides in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, with her husband and children. To make a living, she is engaged in the agriculture sector as a farmer, earning an income of US $2 per day. Her husband always helps his wife in the work at the field. Also, he is often hired to dig wells for people in the province, earning an income of US $5 per day.

S. and her husband are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, S. is asking for a loan of US $1100 to purchase a machine to help her husband in digging wells. This is her first loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner.

loans.use: To buy a machine to dig wells

loans.name: Cerila

texts.en:
Cerila O. is from the village of Kuguita, Mambajao Camiguin Province. She is 48 years old. Cerila is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Cerila owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products in the local community. Cerila has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Cerila joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cerila is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Cerila from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI:

About HSPFI:

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn M. is from the village of Maac, Guisiliban Camiguin Province. She is 28 years old. Ailyn is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Ailyn owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Ailyn has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ailyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ailyn is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ailyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa C. is from the village of Tagdo, Mambajao Camiguin Province. She is 49 years old. Teresa is widowed and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Teresa owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Teresa has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Teresa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresa is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure, and additional seedlings to raise. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Teresa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and additional seedlings to raise

loans.name: Poah

texts.en:
Poah S., 29, is married with five children. She resides in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, with her husband (pictured) and children. To make a living, her husband is engaged in the business of selling car and motorbike tires, earning an income of US $12 per day, which is the primary source of income for the family. This income helps cover the family expenses, especially the children’s education.

S. and her husband are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, S. is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase more tires for resale. This is her first loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner.

loans.use: To buy car and motorbike tires for resale

location.town: Tboung Kmum district, Kampong Cham province, Cambo

loans.name: Bebina

To make a living, Bebina owns and operates a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Bebina has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Bebina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bebina is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Bebina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.
