The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: to increase the spare parts stock

loans.name: Saiid

texts.en: Saiid is a 35-year-old married man and father of 4 children. He has been working as a furniture maker for the past 15 years. Over the years, thanks to his business income, he has been able to meet his children's needs. Today, Saiid is applying for a loan of US$ 1,200 to buy necessary merchandise for his shop to develop his work.

loans.use: to buy necessary merchandise

loans.name: Jawhara

texts.en: Jawhara is a 28-year-old married woman and mother of 2 young children. She has been working as a home-based tailor since 2006 and has 8 years of experience in this field. She is requesting a loan of US$ 1,200 to buy a new sewing machine to be able to make more products for her clients.

loans.use: buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Loukman

texts.en: Loukman is a single man living with his parents. He's 19 years old. In 2006, he opened his own business in carpentry to earn his own income and help his family. Today, Loukman is asking for a loan of US$ 1,000 to buy merchandise such as wood, etc. to produce a variety of products and satisfy the requirements of his clients.

loans.use: produce a variety of products

loans.name: Bader

texts.en: Bader is a 23-year-old single man. Back 5 years ago, he decided to open a computer repair shop to service the neighboring villages. Today, Bader is asking for a loan of US$ 1,000 to purchase tools and accessories needed for the computers.

loans.use: purchase tools and accessories

loans.name: M. Célestine

texts.fr: O. M. Célestine est née en 1966 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Célestine est mariée à AGUIAR Edouard, un technicien en bâtiment. Le couple a cinq enfant qui sont tous scolarisés. La famille vit ensemble au quartier Gbodjè, dans le 4è arrondissement à Porto-Novo, depuis environs 8 ans. Célestine vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Célestine a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au cours secondaire. C'est depuis environs 20 ans que Célestine vend des divers (pâtes alimentaires, bouteilles d'arachides, lait, conserves, savons, bougies, boîtes de craie, piles, boîtes d'allumettes, etc.) et également des mèches et des produits pour cheveux, à son domicile. C'est au marché de Ouando à Porto-Novo que Célestine fait ses achats. Célestine a obtenu une fois déjà de crédit à ALIDé, et l'a bien remboursé. Célestine sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé afin d'agrandir son activité et de satisfaire davantage les besoins de ses clients.
texts.en:
M. Célestine O. was born in 1966 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. Célestine is married to Edouard Aguiar, a building technician. The couple have five children, all of whom are in school. The family has lived together in the Gbodjè area in the 4th arrondissement of Porto-Novo for about 8 years. Célestine helps her husband provide for the family. Célestine attended school up to the secondary level. For about 20 years, Célestine has sold various items (pasta, bottles of peanuts, milk, canned goods, soaps, candles, boxes of chalk, batteries, matchboxes, etc.) and also hair extensions and hair products, all at her home. It is at the Ouando market in Porto-Novo that Célestine makes her purchases. Célestine has already obtained one previous loan through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), and repaid it properly. Célestine is seeking a second loan through ALIDÉ in order to enlarge her business and further satisfy the needs of her customers.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various items (boxes of pasta, canned food) and hair extensions

loans.name: Maen

texts.en: Maen is a 23-year-old single man. After 7 years, he decided to open his own carpentery and furniture shop to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Today, Maen is requesting to borrow US$ 1,200 to buy more merchandise so he can increase his sales and therefore his income.

loans.use: buy more merchandise

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a single man. He's 22 years old. He has been working in furniture since 2005 to provide, along with his father, better living conditions for the family. Today, Ali is asking for a loan of US$ 1,200 to buy merchandise needed for his business so he can satisfy the heavy demands of the market and help increase his income.

loans.use: buy merchandise

loans.name: Menepakai Group

texts.en:
Winston B. is the leader of a group of 5 borrowers called Menepakai. He is 48 years old, married with 4 children aged 10-29 years old. Their educational levels are 1st -10th grade. He also cares for a nephew. Winston is a high school drop-out due to lack of financial support.

Winston and his family live on the Dementa Road, Gbarnga city, the capital of Bong county, Liberia. His business is the sales of plastic materials. He buys plastic materials wholesale and sells them retail to residents of his community.

Winston has been running this business for 5 years and is hoping to improve business by establishing a shop. He sells new designs in goods in order to encourage them to continue buying from him.

Winston faces problems with customers buying on credit and not paying on time which hinders his business. He needs this loan to purchase new designs in goods to improve business. Winston dreams of advancing his family to have a good future.

loans.use: purchase new designs in goods to improve business

loans.name: Feryal

texts.en: Feryal is a married woman and mother of 8 children. She has been working in clothing sales since 1995 to help her husband in the household. Today, Feryal is applying for a loan of US$ 1,200 to buy more clothes to increase her sales and make good income for the family.

loans.use: buy more clothes

loans.name: Sleiman

texts.en: Sleiman is a 25-year-old married man. He has been working as a farmer since 2005 providing dairy products and vegetables to the neighboring villages. Today, Sleiman is requesting to borrow US$ 1,000 to purchase specialized tools for agriculture to make a variety of products.

loans.use: purchase specialized tools

loans.name: Kwapagar Group

texts.en:
Karbeh R. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called “Kwapagar”. She is 32 years old and is married with three children 2-9 years old with educational levels of kindergarten through 3rd grade. Karbeh is illiterate due to lack of financial support. She and her family live in the Belefania community, Gbarnga city, the capital of Bong county, Liberia.

Karbeh’s business is the sale of general goods. She buys general goods wholesale and sells retail to residents of her community. She has been running this business for three years and is hoping to improve the business to establish a shop. She sells new goods in order to encourage her customers to continue buying from her.

Karbeh faces a problem with the cost of transporting goods from wholesalers to her business site which reduces profits. She needs this loan to purchase new goods to improve her business.

Karbeh dreams of educating her children so that they have a better future.

loans.use: To purchase new goods to improve her business

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en: Khalil is a farmer working in the agriculture sector since 2000 and has 15 years of experience in this field. He is married with one child. Today, Khalil is requesting to borrow $1,000 to buy tools and merchandise for his business.

loans.use: buy tools and merchandise

loans.name: Samir

texts.en: Samir is 31 years old and engaged to be married. He has owned a bakery since 2004 and has more than 14 years baking experience. Samir works hard to make enough income to be able to meet his needs. Today, Samir is applying for a loan of $1,200 to purchase more merchandise so he can increase his sales and therefore his income.

loans.use: purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Dilovar

texts.ru: Диловар Шарипов проживает в городе Душанбе. Возраст 24 года. Женат, детей не имеет. Диловар имеет экономическое образование. Но он более 3 лет занимается услугой маршрутного такси. Услугу такси предоставляет по городу Душанбе. Кредит просит для ремонта автомашины, т.к. эта автомашина является единственным источником дохода.
texts.en:
Dilovar S. lives in Dushanbe. He is twenty-four years old, married with no children. He has an education in economics but for more than three years, he has been a shuttle taxi driver. His taxi service covers the whole of Dushanbe. He is asking for a loan to repair his automobile, because it is the sole source of income.

Translated from Russian by Susan Savkov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair Automobile

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase larger quantities of fish for her business.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en: Omar is 45 years old and married with ten children. He has been working as a fisherman since 1989. Over the years, he has been able to meet his children's needs thanks to his business income. Today, Omar is requesting to borrow $1,000 to buy special tools for his job.

loans.use: to buy special tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more ingredients for her café business

loans.name: Grace Group

texts.en:
Habakuk F. is a leader of a group of 5 borrowers called the Grace group. Habakuk is a 35 year old single father with two children aged 7 and 11 years old, who are in 3rd and 5th grade at school. Habakuk and his family live in the Gbartala community, 20 kilometres from Gbarnga city the capital of Bong county, Liberia.

Habakuk is a high school graduate but could not continue to university due to lack of financial support.
His business is the sale of general goods, which he buys wholesale and sells to residents of Gbartala. Habakuk has been running this business for 15 years, and is hoping to improve his business to establish his own enterprise. Habakuk usually gives customers a discount in order to encourage them to continue buying from him.

He faces difficulty when buying goods in United States dollars and selling in Liberian dollars. He needs this loan to purchase more goods to improve his business.

Habakuk dreams of providing educating to his children so they can have a better future.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to improve business.

loans.name: Joumana

texts.en: Joumana has been working as a home-based tailor since 1980 to help her husband provide better conditions for their children. Today, Joumana is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy a new sewing machine to expand her business productivity.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.fr: M. Elisabeth est née le 09 Juillet 1951 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Elisabeth vit  au quartier Oganla dans le troisième arrondissement de Porto-Novo, depuis environs 25 ans. Mariée à FERAEZ Denis, un vendeur, Elisabeth est mère de quatre enfants, dont un est à sa charge. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés et vivent ensemble avec les deux parents. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Elisabeth a été à l'école jusqu'au cours secondaire. Il y a environs 3 ans que Elisabeth mène comme activité, la vente de glacières, par le système de distribution. C'est à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, que Elisabeth s'approvisionne. Elisabeth a obtenue déjà une fois de crédit à ALIDé, crédit qui a été bien remboursé. C'est en vue de renforcer son activité en ces périodes des fêtes de fin d'année, ce qui lui permettra d'accroître ses revenus, que Elisabeth sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Elisabeth M. was born on 9 July 1951 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. Elisabeth has lived in the Oganla area in the third arrondissement of Porto-Novo for about 25 years. Married to Denis Feraez, a vendor, Elisabeth is the mother of four children, of whom one is in her care. All of the children are in school and live together with both parents. The couple provide for the family together. Elisabeth attended school up to the secondary level. For about 3 years, Elisabeth has run a business selling iceboxes through the distribution system. It is in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, that Elisabeth gets her supplies. Elisabeth has already obtained one previous loan through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), which she repaid properly. With the goal of strengthening her business during this holiday period at the end of the year, which will allow her to increase her income, Elisabeth is seeking a second loan through ALIDÉ.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy iceboxes

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 29-year-old married man and father of two children. He has owned an air conditioner repair shop since 2008 with fifteen years of experience in this field.

Today, Ahmad is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase newly-developed tools and to enlarge his shop to meet the requirements of his clients and to make a good income for his family.

loans.use: To purchase newly-developed tools and to enlarge his shop

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 26-year-old single man living with his parents. He has been working as a furniture maker since 2004 with ten years of experience in this field. He cooperates with his family to provide better life conditions.

Today, Mahmoud is applying for a loan of $1,200 to buy more merchandise in order to increase his sales and so his business income.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Nidia

texts.en:
Nidia is 41 years old and has 6 children, all of whom are in school. Nidia has owned and operated a food stall for over 6 years, and has built up a loyal clientele in hr neighborhood.

Nidia started her business with some help from her husband and his savings and has since built it up to be a successful enterprise that offers a variety of products at affordable prices to its customers. Nidia will use her loan to purchase goods such as sugar, herbs, rice, beverages, soft drinks, baked goods and pastries.

loans.use: Merchandise/foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en:
Ramon P. is a well-known merchant and vendor in his neighborhood. He is 38 years old and has two children. He began his business in 1998. In 2005, when his mother had severe diabetes and needed one of her limbs amputated, he went bankrupt because he had to use all his money for medical costs and postoperative treatments.

In 2006, he reopened his business and has since then built up a permanent staff and continued to steadily grow his enterprise. Ramon will use his loan to buy wholesale jewelry to make a better profit.

loans.use: Merchandise to sell

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 50 years old and has two fully grown, independent children. For over 10 years she ran a business for which she had to rent the premises. A year ago she bought her business, with savings from working as a waitress in a bar.

Teodora started a small kiosk and has now developed it into a full supermarket. Teodora is really grateful for the opportunity she has had to get loans and improve her livelihood. She will use her loan to buy cider, beer and soda for her store.

loans.use: Merchandise for her store

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 32 years old and married to Nancy Wangui who is 42 years old. They live in Ndumberi, just outside of Kiambu. Together they run a 'posho' mill business (they grind maize into powder/flour). From this business they generate about 20,000 KES a month. The business is 5 years old.

This is Michael's second loan from KADET, and with it he will purchase additional maize stock so that he can continue to run his 'posho' mill business. The first loan he took out from KADET was used to purchase hardware supplies. In the face of Kenya's massive drought, Michael and Nancy were hit hard. To combat this, Michael did some research and found a market for hardware supplies in Nukuru (about 2 hours' drive). He used his first loan to become a hardware supplier to the Nukuru area. He continues this business and leans on Nancy to run the 'posho' mill business in his absence.

Michael dreams of buying a better 'posho' mill machine that will mill the maize finer. His current machine takes the entire maize and grinds it up; the machine he wants to own removes the outer shell before grinding into a finer substance.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Purchase more maize in order to continue his 'posho' mill business

loans.name: Nuevo Horizonte Group

texts.en: The ‘New Horizon’ Women’s Committee was formed by a group of women, all of who live in the same neighborhood. They all worked in “clorinderas” – transporting goods across the border into Paraguay. They saw a need for a greater quantity and diversity of goods, and an opportunity to make profit. All women already have their own established businesses, except for two who are starting new enterprises.

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Flora Muthoni

texts.en:
Flora is 32 years old and married with one daughter. She makes curtains and sells them in Riruta center. She has been in the business for a period of two years with a monthly profit of about 20,000 Kenya shillings.

She was introduced to KADET by a friend in her group and she has never borrowed from another MFI before. This is her first loan with KADET and she wants to use the loan to buy materials for making curtains.

She hopes to open another outlet where she will be selling furniture.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: Buying materials for making curtains

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.en: The committee 'United Women' was formed by women who all live and work in the same neighborhood. All women have their own independent businesses and use their loans to help continue growing them. The group is very solid and organized. All committee members are mothers, whose goal is to strengthen their income and help their families and children. They also focus on sustainable development of their businesses and hope to continue growing through taking out small loans.

loans.use: Merchandise to sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 58-year-old married man with 4 children. He has been working as a builder since 1979. Over the years, thanks to his business income, he has been able to meet his children's needs. Today, Ali is asking for a loan of US$ 1,000 to buy a crane in order to develop his business productivity.

loans.use: buy a crane

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 40-year-old married man, living with his wife and 4 children. He has been working as a van driver since 2005 to earn income to help satisfy the needs of the family. Today, Hussein is requesting to borrow US$ 1,000 to do some legal registration needed for the van.

loans.use: some legal registration needed for the van

loans.name: Fernando Joao

texts.pt:
Fernando João José nasceu na cidade de Chimoio, capital da Província de Manica, no centro de Moçambique, tem 50 anos de idade, viúvo e pai de 2 filhos de 14 e 16 anos de idade, ambos vão a escola. Fez 11ª classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com os seus filhos e não sustenta mais ninguém.

Saiu de Chimoio em 1977 para a formação militar, depois de terminar a carreira militar entrou no ministério do interior onde trabalha ate então e faz 8 horas por dia. Tem um salário mensal de 16.434.00mt que aplica nas despesas familiares e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 10.500.00mt com qual pretende comprar material de construção (portas e janelas) para dar continuidade com a sua obra.

Futuramente gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para poder iniciar uma actividade comercial para auxiliar nas despesas caseiras, para tal compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo sem problemas.
texts.en:
Fernando João José was born in the city of Chimoio, the capital of the province of Manica, which is in the center of Mozambique. He is 50, a widow, and the father of 2 children who are 14 and 16. Both of them go to school. He studied through 11th grade and didn't continue due to the lack of financial resources. He lives in his own home with his children and doesn't support anybody else. He left Chimoio in 1977 to complete his military service. After he finished his military career, he joined the Ministry of the Interior where he still works 8 hours a day. He has a monthly salary of 16,434 meticais, which he applies to his family's expenses and saves some in his bank account. He has never had a loan with another bank. He became familiar with Hluvuku through colleagues. This is his first loan in the amount of 10,500 meticais, which he will use to buy construction materials (doors and windows) to continue building his home. In the future, he would like to request more loans to be able to start a business to help with his home's expenses, so he promises to pay back this loan without any problems.

Translated from Portuguese by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (doors, windows, etc.)

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Khady N. est mariée, elle a 41 ans et 8 enfants en charges dont 6 qui fréquent l'école. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois de puis deux et demi et a bénéficié de 5 prêts qu'elle a bien gérés et remboursés. Elle développe un petit commerce de jus de fruits naturels, de glace et de crème glacée. Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son activité afin de générer des ressources qui l'aideront à participer aux différentes charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Khady N. is married and 41 years old. She provides for eight children, of whom six attend school. She has been a member of a village bank for two and a half years and received five loans, which she managed well and repaid on schedule. She runs a small business, where she sells natural fruit juice, ice and ice cream. This loan will bolster Khady’s activity and generate enough means to help her to participate in the various family expenses.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To develop her commercial activity

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en: Nidal is a 40-year-old single woman. She has owned a tailor shop since 2007, with 15 years of previous experience in this field. She works to earn a good income and help her father in the household. Today, Nidal is requesting to borrow US$ 1,200 to purchase merchandise to attract more clients to her shop.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Abass

texts.en:
Abass is a 33 year old engaged man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon. Abass has been working in construction for thirteen years. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work and to pay for his wedding expenses. This is the first time that Abass has requested a loan.

His clients are people from his region and from the surrounding villages. When Abass first started work, he wasn’t really known by the people in his region which means he wasn't able to do a lot of networking. He decided on going into this business because of his experience; he learned when he was young. In the future, he plans on improving his work.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en: Fadi is a 41-year-old married man and father of 2 children. He has been working as a furniture painter since 2007 in his own business. He has been involved in this business for 18 years. Today, Fadi is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase equipment and merchandise in order to enlarge his business.

loans.use: To purchase equipment and merchandise.

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.en: The committee "Oñondivepa" is made up of women who live in the same neighborhood in the city of Villa Elisa. All committee members have independent businesses, mostly in retail and sales. They are a very strong and organized group. All committee members are mothers, who share the goal of improving their quality of life and providing for their families. They hope to develop their businesses in a sustainable way, and will use their loans wisely to continue to grow their enterprises.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 33-year-old man who lives in Tyre,  in southern Lebanon. Ali has been selling car spare parts for three years now. He also cleans cars. He has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools such as a compressor and paint for his work. 

Ali has been a microcredit client for seven years now and has always paid on time.  His previous loans helped him improve and adapt himself with the required tools for his work. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When Ali first started his work, he had some financial issues. He decided to start his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Moises

texts.pt:
Moisés E. nasceu no Distrito de Massinga, Província de Inhambane, tem 51 anos de idade, casado e pai de 4 filhos de 27, 24, 21 e 12 anos de idade, destes apenas o ultimo vai a escola. Fez somente 4ª classe do antigo sistema de educação, não continuou porque foi incorporado no serviço militar obrigatório. Vive na casa própria com a sua família no bairro da Zona Verde (arredores da cidade da Matola) e não sustenta mais ninguém.

Saiu de Massinga para Beira em 1977 cumprindo o Serviço militar obrigatório, mais tarde foi transferido para Maputo onde veio a fixar a sua residência. Actualmente é desmobilizado e trabalha no Hospital Central de Maputo como esterilizador ha mais de 2 anos. Por mes consegue ter um rendimento de 2.052.00mt provenientes da pensão da reforma militar mais 2.186.74mt do salário do Hospital e ainda 1.100.00mt pela parte de prestação de serviços para uma clínica. Possui uma conta bancária num dos bancos comerciais.

Já teve um empréstimo numa instituição cujo nome já não se lembra no valor de 3.000.00mt para compra de material de construção da sua casa. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de seus colegas que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (chapas de zinco e barrotes) para a cobertura da sua residência.

Compromete se a pagar devidamente este crédito afim de poder aceder a mais empréstimo para o melhoramento da sua casa.
texts.en:
Moisés E. was born in the district of Massinga in the province of Inhambane. He is 51 and is the father of 4 children who are 27, 24, 21, and 12. Only the youngest one is in school. He studied through 4th grade of the old education system. He didn't continue because he was drafted into obligatory military service. He lives in his own home with his family in the Zona Verde neighborhood (on the outskirts of the city of Matola) and doesn't support anyone besides them. He left Massinga for Beira in 1977 to comply with his obligatory military service. Later he was transferred to Maputo where he started his home. Currently he is out of the military and has worked in the Central Hospital of Maputo for more than two years by disinfecting it. He makes a monthly income of 2,052 meticais from his military pension and 2,186.74 meticais a month from the hospital. He also makes 1,100 meticais a month by working at a clinic. He has bank accounts in two commercial banks. He already had a loan with another institution whose name he doesn't remember. His loan was for 3,000 meticais, and he used it to buy construction materials for his home. He became familiar with Hluvuku through his colleagues who are also clients of the institution. This is his first loan with Hluvuku, and it is for 10,000 meticais. He will use it to buy construction materials (metal sheets and bars) to put a roof on his home. He promises to pay back his loan on time so he can receive more loans in the future to make improvements to his home.

Translated from Portuguese by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials (metal sheets, bars, etc.)

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 29-year-old man who lives in Tyre, in southern Lebanon, with his wife and their child. Hassan has owned a bakery for seven years. He has been selling mankoucheh.  Mankoucheh looks like a folded pizza. The most common toppings are zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese) and lahm bi ajin (minced meat). You can eat it any time of the day, but somehow it tastes better in the morning.

Hassan is special in his work because he is known for his good and tasty mankoucheh. He has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase raw materials for his bakery.  Hassan has been a microcredit client for five years now and has always paid on time. 

Hassan is exceptional in his work because he knows how to treat his clients.  His clients are his family members, friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t have a lot of cash, as well as not a lot of passersby.  He decided to open his business because of his experience; he learned these skills when he was young. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for his bakery.

loans.name: Nabil

texts.en: Nabil has owned a car rental shop since 2006. He is 23 years old and is married with one child. Today, Nabil is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy a new car because there is a great demand in this market for his service.  He hopes to enlarge his business to meet the requirements of his clients and make a good income for his family.

loans.use: buy a new car

loans.name: Jane Karagwa

texts.en:
Jane N. is married to Isaiah and they have two children: Agnes and Faith. Jane was introduced to KADET through existing clients and she is servicing her third loan. She has been operating a bakery business for six years now and she sells cakes wholesale to retailers from her shop. With the loan she has applied for, she intends to increase production of the cakes as the demand is high.

The client's business is in a densely populated area and her customers run small retail shops. With the extra profits, the client intends to expand her business and educate her children.

Jane hopes to buy a baking plant so as to improve production; she believes she is hard-working, focused and determined.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: to add production

loans.name: Noa Johane

texts.pt:
Noa Johane M. nasceu no Distrito de Chibuto, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique, tem 54 anos de idade, casado e pai de 3 filhos de 18, 16 e 11 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez 7ª classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família no bairro da Matola rio e não sustenta mais ninguém.

Saiu de Chibuto para Matola – rio em 1962 com seus pais transferidos pelos serviços. Tem um negocio próprio ha mais de 15 anos, trabalha com sua esposa cerca de 10 horas por dia. Consegue um rendimento de cerca de 13.000.00mt por mes que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua casa bancária.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seu vizinho que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 11.500.00com o qual pretende comprar produtos (óleo, arroz, açúcar, bebidas e outros) para reforçar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.

Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a mais créditos no futuro de forma a melhorar e diversificar cada vez mais o seu negócio.
texts.en:
Noa Johane M. was born in the district of Chibuto in the province of Gaza in southern Mozambique. He is 54; married; and the father of 3 children who are 18, 16, and 11. All of them are in school. He studied through 7th grade and didn't continue due to the lack of financial resources. He lives in his own home with his family in the Matola neighborhood and doesn't support anyone besides them. He left Chibuto for Matola in 1962 with his parents when they were transferred here. He has had his own business for more than 15 years. He works with his wife for close to 10 hours a day. He makes a monthly income of about 13,000 meticais and applies it to his home's expenses and also saves some in his bank account. He has never had a loan with another bank. He became familiar with Hluvuku through his neighbor who is also a client of the institution. This is his first loan in the amount of 11,500 meticais, and he will use it to buy products (oleo, rice, sugar, drinks, etc.) to strengthen his quantity of merchandise. He promises to pay back this loan on time so he will be able to receive more credits in the future. He will use them to improve and diversify his business more and more.

Translated from Portuguese by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell beer, rice, flour, and other food products.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 21-year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon. Ibrahim has been working as a taxi driver. He requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase a van for his work. He plans on expanding his work by working also as a school van. This is the first time that Ibrahim has requested a loan.

Ibrahim is speciA. in his work because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are students, friends, neighbors and others. When he first started his business, he didn’t have a lot of cash and used to work as a driver. Ibrahim decided on doing his business because he didn’t want to work for someone anymore, he wanted to have an independent job. In the future, he plans on expanding his business by purchasing a school van.

loans.use: To purchase a van for his work

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 30-year-old single man. He has owned a special shop for car interiors since 2004 to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Today, Mohamad is asking for a loan of US$ 1,200 to purchase a sewing machine specialized for car interiors in order to develop his business.

loans.use: purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Serpohi

texts.en: Serpohi has owned a lingerie shop in her town since 2002, and she services the neighboring villages. She is married and mother of 3 children. She works hard to help her husband in the household. Today, Serpohi is requesting to borrow US$ 1,000 to increase her inventory and thus her income by attracting more clients to her shop.

loans.use: increase her inventory

loans.name: Khady Youssouf

texts.fr: Kadhy est mariée, elle a 50 ans et 5 enfants dont deux qui vont à l'école.Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 8 ans et a reçu 16 prêts qui lui permettent jusqu'à présent de développer une activité de vente d'huile de palme. Elle achète en gros par futs de 200 litres et revend au détaille pour se créer des ressources additionnelles qui lui permettrons de participer à la prise en charge de sa famille.
texts.en:
Khady is married and 50 years old. She has five children, of whom two attend school. She has been a member of a village bank for eight years and received 16 loans, which helped her to develop her palm oil business. She buys palm oil in 200-liter barrels and retails it. The additional resources from this activity enable her to participate in the family expenses.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her commercial activity

loans.name: Artimiza Ernesto

texts.pt:
Artimiza M. nasceu no Distrito de Chibuto, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique, tem 35 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 5 filhos de 17, 14, 12, 10 e 1 anos de idade, todos vão a escola menos o mais novo. Fez 4ª classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família no bairro da Matola- rio e não sustenta mais ninguém.

Saiu de Chibuto para Maputo em 1988 com seus pais, devido a guerra de destabilização. Tem um negocio próprio e dono do mesmo a mais de 8 anos, trabalha com sua esposa cerca de 10 horas por dia. Consegue um rendimento de cerca de 8.000.00mt por mes que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum no Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa) mensal com as amigas.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seu vizinho que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 8.000.00com o qual pretende comprar produtos (frangos, refrescos e cerveja) para reforçar o volume de negócio.
No futuro, pretende alastrar o seu negócio para outros locais e compromete se a reembolsar o presente empréstimo para poder aceder a mais créditos.
texts.en:
Artimiza M. was born in the district of Chibuto, Province of Gaza, in the south of Mozambique. She is 35 years old, single, and the mother of 5 children with ages 17, 14, 12, 10, and 1. All of them go to school except the youngest. She went to school until the 4th grade and did not continue because of her poor financial conditions. She lives in her own home with her family in the Matola-rio neighborhood, and she does not support anyone else. She left Cibuto for Maputo in 1988 with her parents due to the destabilization war. She has been the owner of her own business for eight years, and she works with her husband around 10 hours per day. She is able to earn around 8,000MT per month which are applied to home expenses, and she is still able to save a little in Xitique (traditional system of rotary savings) monthly with her friends. She has never had loans through other banks, and she came to know Hluvuku through her neighbor who is also a client of the institution. This is her first loan for 8,000MT with which she intends to purchase products (chicken, soft drinks, and beer) to increase the volume of her business. In the future, she intends to expand her business to other locations and is committed to paying back the current loan so she can accept more credit.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of soft drinks, beer, and other products

loans.name: Nicolau Arao

texts.pt:
Nicolau Arao Chivure nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, tem 34 anos de idade, solteiro e pai de 2 filhos de 8 e 4 anos de idade, o mais velho vai a escola. Fez 10ª classe na Escola Secundaria Joaquim Chissano de Boane e não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com os seus filhos em Boane e sustenta mais 2 irmãos enviando dinheiro.

Nunca saiu de Boane, trabalha no Ministério da Saúde como Motorista desde 2006 em regime de turnos. Tem um salário mensal de 3.119.00mt que aplica nas despesas familiares e ainda poupa cerca de 500.00mt por mes na sua conta bancária.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com qual pretende comprar material de construção (blocos, cimento e areia) para dar continuidade com a sua obra.

Futuramente gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para poder iniciar uma actividade comercial com o objectivo de incrementar a renda familiar e concluir com a construção da sua casa. Para tal compromete se a pagar devidamente para poder aceder a mais empréstimos no futuro.
texts.en:
Nicolau Arao Chivure was born in the district of Boane, province of Maputo, in the south of Mozambique. He is 34 years old, single, and the father of 2 children who are 8 and 4 years old. The oldest is in school. He completed the 10th grade at Joaquim Chissano Secondary School of Boane and did not continue due to poor financial conditions. He lives in his own home with his kids in Boane, and he supports 2 siblings by sending them money. He has never left Boane and has worked for the Ministry of Health as a driver since 2006. He works in shifts. He has a monthly salary of 3,119MT that he uses for family expenses, and he is still able to save about 500MT each month in his bank account. He has never had loans through other banks and came to know Hluvuku through his colleagues. This is his second loan in the amount of 10,000MT with which he intends to purchase construction materials (cement blocks and sand) so he can continue with his work. In the future he would like to solicit additional loans to be able to begin commercial activities with the objective of increasing his family earnings and completing the construction of his home. As such he is committed to paying back this loan properly so he can accept loans in the future.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Daniel Kilee

texts.en:
Daniel is married to Yvonne and they have no children yet. Daniel was introduced to KADET through a KADET officer, and he is servicing his third loan. Daniel has been in the boutique business for nine years,and with the loan the client intends to buy more stock of clothes, especially children's wear in readiness for the festive season.

His business is situated in a very crowded place with both residential and commercial shops.

With the extra profits, he will open another boutique in the capital city of Nairobi. Daniel believes he is hard-working.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: add more stock of clothes

loans.name: Luisa Drofi

texts.pt:
Luísa Drofi Q. nasceu no Distrito de Morumbene, Província de Inhambane, sul de Moçambique, tem 44 anos de idade, divorciada e mãe de 6 filhos de 21, 17, 15, 13, 9, e 3 anos de idade 5 destes vão a escola. Fez 10ª classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com seus filhos em Boane e sustenta ainda seu sobrinho que vive com ela.

Saiu de Morumbene para Chokwe (província de Gaza) em 1984 com seu marido, devido a transferência de seu Marido pelos serviços. Em 1986 é transferido para Boane, onde por fim fixaram sua residência. Mais tarde separa se com o marido e contínua a viver na mesma casa com seus filhos. Trabalha como agente comunitária de saúde num orfanato (Casa do Gaiato) ha mais de 8 anos e tem um salário mensal de 3.500.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum valor no banco comercial BCI.

Nunca teve empréstimos com outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seu colegas que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 8.500.00mt com qual pretende comprar material de Construção (cimento, areia e pagamento de mão de obra) para continuar com a ampliação da sua obra. O empréstimo anterior foi de 7.000.00mt para a mesma actividade.

Futuramente pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para poder concluir a sua obra e dar melhor conforto a seus filhos.
texts.en:
Luísa Drofi Q. was born in the district of Morumbene in the province of Inhambane in southern Mozambique. She is 44; divorced; and the mother of 6 children who are 21, 17, 15, 13, 9, and 3. Five of them are in school. She studied through 10th grade and didn't continue due to the lack of financial resources. She lives in her own home with her children in Boane and also supports her nephew who lives with her.

She left Morumbene for Chowke (in the province of Gaza) in 1984 with her husband when he was transferred there for his job. In 1986, he was transferred to Boane, where they started their home. Later she separated from her husband, and she continues to live in the same home with her children. She has worked as a community health worker at an orphanage (which is called Casa de Gaiato) for more than 8 years and has a monthly salary of 3,500 meticais, which she applies to her home's expenses and still saves some in the commercial bank, BCI.

She has never had a loan with another bank. She became familiar with Hluvuku through her colleages, who are also clients of the institution. This is her second loan, and it is for 8,500 meticais. She will use it to purchase construction materials (cement, sand, and to pay for labor) to continue expanding her home. Her previous loan was for 7,000 meticais, which she used for the same purpose.

In the future, she hopes to request more loans to be able to finish her home and to give more comfort to her children.

Translated from Portuguese by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials (cement, sand, etc.)

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita R. is 40 years old and her husband Reynald works as a motorcycle driver but sometimes helps his wife sell different kinds of food in the bus terminal. The couple is blessed with 9 children who are aged 2 to 23 years old, 8 of whom are attending school. She only wants for her children to finish their studies, to be able to help her husband to generate additional income for the family to sustain their household needs and to have an economically independent life.

Cristita started her food vending business in 1993. She sold different kinds of food around their local community for 3 years, then she saw that she had a bigger opportunity to sell her food products to people in the bus terminal. In 1996, she concentrated most of her operations around the Sagay City bus terminal. She sold the most likely food that travelers would buy to eat while they traveled or as a gift for their families and friends.

Her income from selling food at the terminal was so successful, she soon realized she needed bigger capital just to have enough inventory of the products she sold. This motivated her to join NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002. With the additional income from her loans, she was able to increase her income capacity in turn. Now she earns about PHP 12,000 per month on average and she has been setting aside some money for the education of her children after providing for their household expenses.

Her previous loan of PHP 19,500 was used as additional capital for her food vending business and it helped her sustain her volume level and generate good income for her family. Now for her 10th loan cycle, she is borrowing PHP 18,000 to continue to sustain her business' capital requirement and maintain momentum in her food vending business.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon -  a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To obtain additional working capital for her food vending business.

loans.name: Jamileh

texts.en: Jamileh is a 57-year-old married woman with one child. She works as a tailor to help her husband to provide better life conditions for their family. She has been involved in this business for the past 23 years. Today, Jamileh is applying for a loan of $1,200 to buy a new sewing machine to replace her used one.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion P. is a 58 year-old married woman with one adult child who is now helping her in their business. Consolacion and her family live in Prk. Pag-asa, Poblacion 2, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. In spite of her advancing years, Consolacion works hard so that she can continue to earn a good living for her family, not only for their immediate needs, but also for when she and her husband are old and no longer able to work for a living. Consolacion also hopes that by sustaining a stable business now, her child will be able to continue with the business in the future.

Consolacion started her RTW (ready-to-wear clothes) business in 1975 to have a stable source of income for their small family. This was her only source of income for many years, then at some point, she had to shift to another business venture because the RTW business was not doing as well. So she invested in a food vending business making specialty rice-cakes called "bibingka", made with rice flour, coconut, and sugar, and cooked on a top-fired oven.  When RTW became in demand again, Consolacion shifted back to her RTW business, selling clothes from a rented stall in the Sagay City Central Market.

In 1999, she again experienced some financial difficulties as some of her capital had to be spent on the tuition fees of her child who was at the time attending college. But her cash flow problem was solved when she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon where she was able to borrow the necessary capital to sustain her business operations, and, as the years passed, has allowed her to expand her product lines with access to bigger loans because of her good credit record. Consolacion earns an average of PHP 30,000 monthly from her RTW business, and she saves a majority of this amount towards her "retirement fund" so that she and her husband will not be a burden to their child in later years.

Consolacion's previous loan of PHP 19,000 was used to buy new stock for their business and she was able to pay that loan as usual without any problems. Now for her 11th loan cycle, she is borrowing the same amount so that she can continue to restock her store with new fashions for her customers.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To obtain additional working capital for her RTW (ready-to-wear clothing) business.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La socia MARGARITA pertenece al banco comunal “HATUN SONCCO”. El nombre del banco comunal es de origen del idioma Quechua, “HATUN” significa “Grande” y “SONCCO” significa “Corazón” que traducido al español significa “Corazón grande”. 

La socia tiene 40 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene cuatro hijos; tres varones y una mujer. El hijo mayor estudia en la universidad y los hijos menores estudian en el colegio. Ellos viven en la ciudad Imperial del Cusco. La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta de comida. Nuestra socia tiene su propio stand en el mercado central de “San Pedro” del Cusco donde prepara solo almuerzo. Ya son varios años con esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo, nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora pues con mucha voluntad se levanta 5 a.m. para preparar la comida. La socia requiere el préstamo para la educación, para la alimentación, mensualidad del colegio de sus hijos y para aumentar la producción de preparación de platos de comida. 
 
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Margarita belongs to the Atún Soncco Communal Bank. The name of the communal bank is from the Quechua language. “Hatun” means big, and “Soncco” means heart. Translated into Spanish (and then into English) it means Big Heart. She is 40, in a common law marriage, and has four children; three boys and a girl. Her oldest child attends the university, and the younger children go to school. They live in the Imperial City of Cusco. She alternates her activities between the household and her food sales. She has her own stand in the central market of San Pedro in Cusco. She prepares only lunches. She has been doing this for several years. It has gone very well for her thanks to all of the effort that she puts into her work. She is a hard-working mother, and she is enterprising. She gets up at 5 a.m. to make the food. She needs the loan for education, food, monthly school fees for her children, and to increase food production of her dishes. She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to pay it back on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase production of her dishes by purchasing more supplies like sugar, rice, oil, and vegetables

loans.name: Julieth

texts.en:
Julieth is a strong, single business woman who resides within the Nairobi Area.

Julieth was introduced to KADET through existing members and is servicing her first loan which she will use to add more clothes for sale. She has been in the clothing business for two years. Her area of operation is within a residential area and she has many customers. With the extra profits she anticipates on getting, Julieth will open a stall in an identified market area.

Julieth hopes are to have a variety of clothes to sell and she believes she is hardworking.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke.

loans.use: To add stock of new clothes.

loans.name: Anastasie

texts.en:
Anastasie is 52 years old and is married with five children with ages between 10 and 17. She lives in Nyarugenge, a region of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda. Here, Anastasie has been a proven entrepreneur for a long time. This is her thirtieth successful year in this business! She employs one person and the hours of her business require that she works from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. every weekday.

Although, Anastasie has been selling shoes for thirty years, her investing capital is still too low for her business to expand meaningfully. She hopes that when she gets additional capital she can make positive changes to her business. She has a plan to expand into new lines of products.

Anastasie used to only sell men's shoes. However, with this loan, she will invest in purchasing women's shoes and handbags for sale. With this additional business, Anastasie expects to attract more customers and as a result, earn more profit.

Anastasie hopes to improve her business and its prospects and with any profits she will continue to take care of her children and to build a secure future for them.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes and handbags for sale

loans.name: Solange

texts.en:
Solange is 24 years old, is single, and takes care of two dependents aged 1 and 5. To save money, she lives with her parents. and, together, they live in Nyarugenge, a region of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

Solange has been selling traditional clothing and dresses for the past five years and employs one person in her business. The hours of her business require that she works from early morning to late in the evening every day except Sunday.

Solange is requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company and Kiva lenders in order to purchase some new attractive clothing and material styles for sale as well as additional sizes and colors. With this loan, Solange hopes to attract more customers to her shop and hopefully earn more profit in the process.

Solange will save a portion of any profits earned, as a major goal for her is to build a secure financial future for herself and her loved ones.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Marie Goreth

texts.en:
Marie Goreth is 46 years old and is married with eight children with ages between 5 and 23. She lives in Gasabo, a region of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

Marie Goreth is a self-employed woman who has owned a small shop selling traditional clothes and dresses which she sews herself. The hours of her business require that she works from 7 a.m. until late in the evening every day except Sunday.

After twenty years of sewing various styles of clothes, Marie Goreth wishes to purchase a new sewing machine and cloth material. She plans to try sewing new styles of clothes including men's clothing which hopefully will attract more customers to her business.

With this loan, Marie Goreth will be employing more than one person in her business - creating a job in her community. This loan will allow her and her devoted spouse to put aside more funds to buy a house they have long dreamed of owning. Also, it will allow them to continue paying school fees and provide more and better food for their children and to build a secure future for them.

loans.use: To purchase more cloth for sewing clothes and a sewing machine

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
El socio MARCO ANTONIO pertenece al banco comunal “HATUN SONCCO”. 

El socio tiene 38 años de edad, tiene tres hijos; dos mujeres y una varón. Ellos viven en la ciudad Imperial del Cusco. El socio trabaja en el Instituto Peruano de Deportes del Cusco como administrativo. El socio y su esposa tiene un negocio familiar de venta de frutas, ellos tiene su propio stand en el mercado central de “San Pedro” del Cusco donde vende toda variedad de frutas manzanas, peras, plátanos, piñas, naranjas, etc. Ya son varios años con esta actividad y les ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que ponen en su trabajo, nuestro socio es un padre responsable y trabajador pues con mucha voluntad ayuda a su esposa en la venta de frutas. El socio requiere el préstamo para la educación, la alimentación, la mensualidad del colegio de sus hijos y para comprar más frutas así aumentar el capital del negocio. 
 
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Marco Antonio belongs to the Atún Soncco Communal Bank. He is 38 and has three children, two girls and a boy. They live in the Imperial city of Cusco. He works in the Peruvian Sports Institute of Cusco as an administrator. He and his wife have a family business selling fruit. They have their own stand in the San Pedro central market of Cusco. They sell all types of fruit like apples, pears, bananas, pineapples, and oranges, etc. They have been doing this for several years. It has gone very well for them thanks to they effort they put into their work. He is a hard-working and responsible father. With great pleasure he helps his wife sell the fruit. He needs a loan for education, food, monthly school fees for his children, and to buy more fruit to increase the capital in the business. He is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and he promises to repay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Education, food, monthly school fees for his children, and to buy more fruit to increase the capital in the business

loans.name: Unidas Para Triunfar 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Benita, 31, is a borrower from Santiago, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Unidas para Triunfar (United to Triumph), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group.

Benita and her family live in a simple house near Santiago, the second largest city in the Dominican Republic with a population of over a million people. Life around the city can be difficult, with little access to reliable electricity and running water. It is also crowded and polluted, with insufficient sanitation. Despite any difficulties she may face, Benita runs a successful shop from her home selling clothes. She plans to use this loan, her very first from Esperanza International, to purchase both new and used blouses, shirts, and pants for women and men. She will then sell the clothes to her friends and neighbors at a small markup.

Benita is very grateful for her newfound access to financial services such as loans and savings, as well as health services for her family. She hopes to continue expanding her business, and she hopes to own her own shop one day. Benita has four children, from twelve to eighteen years old, and she also hopes to send them all to university with the extra profits from her business. With your help, Benita will be able to achieve these goals. Thank you for lending to Benita and the Unidas para Triunfar group!

loans.use: Blouses, shirts, and pants

loans.name: Juanita

texts.es:
La socia JUANITA pertenece al banco comunal “HATUN SONCCO”. 

La socia tiene 50 años D. edad, tiene dos hijas mujeres. La mayor es independiente y la menor estudia en la Universidad “Andina D. Cusco” la carrera profesional D. Administración D. Empresas. Ellas viven en la ciudad Imperial del Cusco. La socia tiene un pequeño negocio D. café al paso. Ya es un año que tiene esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que ponen en su trabajo, nuestra socia es una madre responsable y trabajadora pues con mucha voluntad y con ayuda D. sus hijas atienden el negocio. La socia requiere el préstamo para la implementar el local del negocio comprando sillas y mesas. La socia abrirá otro local D. las mismas características que el primero con ayuda D. los préstamos.
 
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Juanita belongs to the HATUN SONCCO community bank. This member is 50 years old and has two daughters. The older one lives independently, and the younger is studying at the University "Andina Cusco" for a career in Business Administration. They live in the city of Cusco. The member has a small coffee business. She has had the business for one year and has done very well thanks to all the effort they put into their work. Our member is a responsible and hard-working mother with the will and support of her children tending to the business. The member requires the loan to grow her business in buying tables and chairs. The member will open another location with similar features as the first with the help of the loan. The member is grateful for the opportunity afforded by this measure and, likewise, promises to comply with the re-payment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Zal Bilimoria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chairs and tables for her coffee shop

loans.name: Caminando Con Jesús Group

texts.en:
Ana, 39, is a borrower from Santiago, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Caminando con Jesús (Walking with Jesus), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group.

Ana and her husband live with their four children, ages ten to nineteen. They live in a simple house near Santiago, the second largest city in the Dominican Republic with a population of over a million people. Life around the city can be difficult with little access to reliable electricity and running water. Despite any difficulties she may face, Ana runs a successful shop from her home selling clothes. She plans to use this loan, her third from Esperanza International, to purchase new blouses for women and pants for both men and women. She will then sell the clothes to her friends and neighbors at a small markup.

Ana is very grateful for her newfound access to financial services such as loans and savings, as well as health services for her family. She hopes to continue expanding her business, and she hopes to own her own shop one day. With a house full of growing children, Ana also hopes to send them all to university with the extra profits from her business. With your help, Ana will be able to achieve these goals. Thank you for lending to Ana and the Caminando con Jesús group!

loans.use: To buy blouses and pants

loans.name: Nabil

texts.en: Nabil is a 45-year-old married man with a wife and two young children. He has owned a farm since 2004, servicing the neighboring villages. Today, Nabil is asking for a loan of $800 to buy materials and fodder for his cattle.

loans.use: To buy materials and fodder for his cattle.

loans.name: Ebenezer 3 Group

texts.en:
Eliberto, 43, is a borrower from Santiago, Dominican Republic. He is the coordinator for his group, Ebenezer, and his story is representative of the other borrowers in the group.

Eliberto and his family live in a simple house near Santiago, the second largest city in the Dominican Republic with a population of over a million people. Life around the city can be difficult with little access to reliable electricity and running water. It is also crowded and polluted because of insufficient sanitation efforts by the government. Despite any difficulties he may face, Eliberto runs a successful shop from his home selling clothes. He plans to use this loan, his very first from Esperanza International, to purchase new shoes, shirts, and pants for women and men. He will then sell the clothes to his friends and neighbors at a small markup.

Eliberto is very grateful for his newfound access to financial services such as loans and savings, as well as health services for his family. He hopes to continue expanding his business, and he hopes to own his own shop one day. Eliberto has three children from nine to fourteen, and he also hopes to send them all to university with the extra profits from his business. With your help, Eliberto will be able to achieve these goals. Thank you for lending to Eliberto and the Ebenezer group!

loans.use: To buy shoes and other clothing to resell

loans.name: Souad

texts.en: Souad is a 40-year-old single woman living with her two brothers. She has been working as a home-based tailor since 2004 and has 22 years of experience in this market. She presents a variety of products to her clientele. Souad is asking for a loan of US$ 1,000 to buy an additional sewing machine to develop and enlarge her business.

loans.use: to buy an additional sewing machine

loans.name: Marizol

texts.es:
La socia MARIZOL pertenece al banco comunal “HATUN SONCCO”. 

La socia, es conviviente, tiene dos hijos; un varón y una mujer. Ellos viven en la ciudad Imperial del Cusco. La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta de comida. Nuestra socia tiene su propio stand en el mercado central de “San Pedro” del Cusco donde prepara solo almuerzo. Ya son varios años con esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo, nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora pues con mucha voluntad se levanta 5 a.m. para preparar la comida. La socia requiere el préstamo para la educación, la alimentación y la mensualidad del colegio de sus hijos y aumentar la preparación de comida y así tener mayores ingresos. Con este crédito de 2,500 nuevos soles comprará productos alimenticios para preparar sus menús como: arroz, aceite, menestras, fideos, etc. 

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
The member MARIZOL belongs to the communal bank “HATUN SONCCO”. The member is in a common-law marriage, has two children, a boy and a girl. They live in the city Imperial del Cusco. She alternates her household activities with selling food. She has her own stand in the central market “San Pedo” in Cusco where she makes lunches. It’s been several years since she’s been doing this work and it’s been going very well thanks to all the effort that she puts into her work. Our member is a hard-working mother and enterprising woman. She gets up enthusiastically at 5 am to make the food. The members needs a loan for the education, food and monthly expenses of her children and to increase the food production so that she will have bigger profits. With this loan of 2500 new soles she will buy food products to make her lunches such as rice, oil, vegetables, noodles, etc. The member is very appreciative of the opportunity offered her this way and she herself promises to make the payments according to the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her purchasing of ingredients such as sugar, rice, oil, vegetables to make the food

loans.name: Sami

texts.en: Sami is a 64-year-old married man with 4 children. He has owned an internet café since 1999 to earn income to satisfy the needs of his family. Today, Sami is asking for a loan of US$ 1,000 to buy merchandise for his shop.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Unidas Para El Progreso 1-3 Group

texts.en:
Maria, 43, is a borrower who lives near San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Unidas para el Progreso (United for Progress), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group.

Maria and her husband have nine children, ages six to twenty-three, all of whom live in their home. She and her family live in Batey El Fao, a small rural community northwest of San Pedro. Bateyes are small communities built by sugar companies for their workers. They typically have poor housing, scarce electricity, and unreliable running water that is never potable. With the profits from her business over the years, Maria has been able to construct her own home from cement block, a significant improvement over the typical local home. 

This is Maria’s sixth loan with Esperanza. She plans to use the loan to purchase rice, beans, oil, and other staple foods for her small colmado, or general store. She came to Esperanza because she likes the borrowing model based on holistic development. Maria not only receives loans, but also savings and health services for her family, among other things. She hopes that with the profits from this loan, she will move closer to her dream of sending her children to college. With your help, Maria can reach that goal. Thank you for lending to Maria and the Unidas para el Progreso group!

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, oil, plantains, and other foods

loans.name: Diaa

texts.en: Diaa is a 39-year-old married man with one child. He has owned a phone  shop since 1999. Today, Diaa is applying for a loan of US$ 1,200 to buy additional phones and rechargeable cards to increase his sales.

loans.use: to buy additional phones and rechargeable cards

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en: Kassem is a 41-year-old married man living with his wife and five young children. In 1989, he started working in construction and tiling. Today, Kassem is hoping to further expand his business buy taking a US$ 1,000 loan to purchase scaffolding.

loans.use: to purchase scaffolding

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 19-year-old young man living with his parents and three siblings. Four years ago his father taught him how to work as a construction worker and in 2008 he started working on his own. Today, Mahmoud is requesting to borrow US$ 1,200 to purchase wood for his new project.

loans.use: to purchase wood

loans.name: Libia

texts.es:
La socia LIBIA pertenece al banco comunal “HATUN SONCCO”. 

La socia, tiene 55 años de edad, es casada, tiene tres hijos; una mujer y dos varones. Ellos viven en la ciudad Imperial del Cusco. La socia es licenciada en enfermería y trabaja capacitando a mujeres en el Centro de Medicina Andina del Cusco. La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta de medicamentos naturales. Ya son varios años con esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo, nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora. La socia requiere el préstamo para la educación, la alimentación y la mensualidad del colegio de sus hijos y aumentar el capital del negocio y así tener mayores ingresos. Con este crédito de 1,200 nuevos soles comprará medicinas naturales. 

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
The member Libia belongs to the "HATUN SONCCO" community bank. The member is 55 years old, is married with three children: one woman and two men. They live in the city of Cusco. The member has a degree in nursing and trains women at the Centro de Medicina Andina in Cusco. The member alternates household activities with the sale of natural medications. It has been several years that she has worked in this business and has done very well thanks to all the effort put into her work. Our partner is a hard-working and enterprising mother. The member requires a loan for education, food and monthly schooling for her children and to increase working capital and thus make more income. With this loan of 1,200 nuevos soles, she will buy natural medicines. The partner is grateful for the opportunity afforded by this measure and, likewise, will promise to pay back the loan according to the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Zal Bilimoria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy natural medicines

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 35-year-old married man living with his wife and three children. In 2001, he started working as a taxi driver. Today, Ali is requesting a loan of $1,200 in order to register his rented car and improve its performance.

loans.use: To register his rented car

loans.name: Unidas Para El Progreso 4&5 Group

texts.en:
Familien, 34, is a borrower who lives near San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic. He is the coordinator for his group, Unidas Para el Progreso (United for Progress), and his story is representative of the other borrowers in the group.

Familien and his wife have one daughter who is just 16 months old. They live in a small rural community called Batey El Fao, where most of the other borrowers in the group live as well. Bateyes are communities built by sugar companies for their field workers. Living conditions are rough with little to no electricity, sanitation, running water, or medical facilities. Despite these difficulties, Familien runs a successful store selling new clothing to the people in his community. With this loan, his third with Esperanza, Familien plans to purchase more clothing and perfume to sell.

Familien’s dream is to someday move his family to Santo Domingo, the capital of the Dominican Republic. He would like to have his own house there and start a large store selling all types of clothing. With his new access to capital, Familien is confident that this can someday happen. He also hopes that his daughter can grow up to be “whatever she wants, owning her own business or even making art”. Familien is determined and amiable, and with your support, he can accomplish these goals. Thank you for lending to Familien and the Unidas Para El Progreso group!

loans.use: To buy jeans, shirts, shoes, and perfume

loans.name: Die

texts.fr: Madame Die F. est une commerçante qui s'est convertie en avicultrice suite à une longue maladie .ce prêt entre dans le cadre du renforcement de son activité pour mieux gérer son temps en élevant des poussins destinés à la revente .Ainsi elle pourra générer des revenus pour faire face aux dépenses de sa famille
texts.en:
Mrs. Die F. is a businesswoman who became a poultry farmer after a long disease. This loan will bolster her activity and enable her to manage her time more efficiently when she raises and sells her chicks. Thus she will be able to generate some income to meet her family expenses.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Poultry farming

loans.name: Thelma Elizzette

texts.es: La señora Thelma Ramírez trabaja en una empresa como Analista Presupuestaria desde hace un año, a muchos esfuerzos logro concluir su carrera en contabilidad, lo cual desea llegar a ejercer la contabilidad generar. Tiene 36 años de edad, procreo dos hijos que estudian también esta al cuidado de su mama que tiene 70 años y cuida de su salud y sus medicamentos, su esposo es contador. Doña Thelma vende cosméticos y ropa por encargo en su trabajo como en su casa ya que tiene que recoger para poder ayudar a su mama. Con este préstamo lo que desea es poder hacer mejora a la cocina por que la madera esta vieja  como hacer un bajarete para mejor comodidad ya que le da mucho el sol. En un futuro espera lograrla hacer su cocina toda de concreto. Es su quinto ciclo  en Afodenic el cual  ha logrado poder tener mejores condiciones para su familia.
texts.en:
Thelma Ramírez, 36, has worked as a budget analyst for a company for the past year. With much effort she was able to finish her education as an accountant and she wants to be a general accountant. She has two children and she also cares for her 70-year-old mother; seeing to her health and medicines. Her husband is an accountant. Thelma also sells cosmetics and clothing per prior order both at her work and from home because she needs the extra income to help her mother. With this financing she would like to make improvements to her kitchen because the wood is old. She also wants to build a covered shelter from the sun for more comfort. In the future, she hopes to make her kitchen completely of concrete. This is her fifth loan cycle with Afodenic which has helped her attain better living conditions for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy zinc metal sheeting, nails and lumber to repair kitchen and build a shelter from the sun.

loans.name: Eduardo Jose

texts.es: El señor Eduardo es trabajador activo de los bomberos de Nicaragua desde hace siete años, sastifecho por que puede servir a la sociedad y a todo a aquel que  pueda. Tiene 54 años de edad, vive junta a su esposa que comerciante vende golosinas ambulante el cual cubre los gastos básicos de  agua, luz. Tiene dos hijos uno trabaja en el ejercito y el otro estudia la secundaria el cual espera apoyar hasta donde pueda. Con este préstamo quiere terminar su construcción de su casa le hace falta el techo y las ventana el cual comprara y seguir haciéndola para gozar de una vivienda digna. Todo gracias a los financiamientos a largo plazo y de bajos intereses el cual se benefician muchas familias Nicaragüenses y gozar de una vivienda.
texts.en:
